94 #define MIN_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD 100 /* 0.1 millisec */
95 #define MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD 50000 /* 50 msecs - better for Linux within a VM - worst was 3.6% during idle */

102 //#define USE_WINDOW_XIMAGE /* comment this out to disable using an XImage to perform graphiic operations on a window */
103 
104 
105 // **************************************************************************
106 // ALGORITHMS AND OTHER RELATED NOTES
107 // the hash algorithm is simple. First, apply 'WINDOW_ENTRY_HASH' to the
108 // window ID. Then use it as an index into the array of '_WINDOW_ENTRY_'
109 // structures. If the entry it points to does NOT match the window ID I'm
110 // interested in, increment the index 'mod ARRAY SIZE' until I either find
111 // the matching window ID, wrap around, or find a zero window ID. Wrapping
112 // around is basically prevented by ensuring that the array is at least twice
113 // the size of the maximum allowed window count. And, for the above reasons,
114 // the size of the array must be a power of 2 so that the hash works properly.
115 
116 // NOTE: window assignments tend to be consecutive so I must scramble them
117 // up or risk inefficiency in the hash algorithm. This can be
118 // improved later to minimize the impact of this behavior.
119 //
120 // NOTE 2: Window ID and other XID values APPEAR to depend on the definition
121 // of 'RESOURCE_AND_CLIENT_COUNT' and the max # of clients
122 // This basically makes the lower 29 bits of an XID consist of
123 // the client ID (5 to 9 bits) and the resource ID (remaining bits)
124 // with leading bits 31,30,29 all zeros.
125 // It may be possible to create "fake" windows with the high bit set
126 // **************************************************************************
127 
128

132 /* */

760 typedef struct __internal_window_entry__ // the structure that identifies the window and what to do with it
761 {
762  Window wID;
763  const char *szClassName;
764  Display *pDisplay;
765  WB_UINT64 iFlags;
766  XImage *pImage;
767  Window wParent;
768  WBGC hGC;
769  unsigned long clrFG;
770  unsigned long clrBG;
771  WB_FONT pFont;
772  XWMHints *pWMHints;
773  Pixmap pxIcon;
774  Pixmap pxMask;
775 
783  int (* pCallback)(Window wIDEvent, XEvent *pEvent);
784  WB_GEOM geomAbsolute;
785  Region rgnClip;
786  Region rgnPaint;
787  Window wIDMenu;
788 
789  int (* pMenuCallback)(Window wIDEvent, XEvent *pEvent);
790  Cursor curRecent;
791  int idCursor;
792  int idDefaultCursor;
793  int iWaitCursorCount;
794  int width;
795  int height;
796  int border;
797  int iModalFlag;
798  int iModalReturn;
799  int iWindowState;
800  enum WMPropertiesWindowType eWindowType;
801  enum WMPropertiesWMProtocols eWMProtocols;
802  struct timeval tvLastActivity;
803  void *aWindowData[WINDOW_DATA_SIZE];
804 } _WINDOW_ENTRY_;
805 
806 #define WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_SIZE 2048 /* must be a power of 2 and twice the max expected # of windows */
807 #define WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX 2047 /* must be the above value minus 1 */
808 #define WINDOW_ENTRY_HASH(X) (((((unsigned long)X & 0xf00) + \
809  (((unsigned long)X >> 3) & 0x1f) + \
810  (((unsigned long)X << 5) & 0xe0)) ^ \
811  ((unsigned long)X >> 12)) & WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX)
812 
813 #define WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED ((Window)-1)
814 
815 #define WB_WINDOW_DELETE -3 /* entry to be deleted during cleanup phase */
816 #define WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED -2 /* window has been destroyed, entry remains */
817 #define WB_WINDOW_DESTROYING -1 /* not destroyed yet - prevent recursion */
818 #define WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED 0 /* window created, but not yet mapped */
819 #define WB_WINDOW_MAPPED 1 /* window mapped */
820 #define WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP 2 /* focus is to be set when the window is mapped */
821 #define WB_WINDOW_DELETE_TIMEOUT 5 /* seconds to wait before deleting hash entry (was 30, now 5) */
822 
823 #define WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP)
824 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED || (X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP)
825 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_MAPPED)
826 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYING)
827 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED || (X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DELETE)
828 #define WB_TO_DELETE_WINDOW_ENTRY(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DELETE)
829 
830

833 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

835 static _WINDOW_ENTRY_ sWBHashEntries[WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_SIZE]={{0,0}};
836 static volatile int nWBHashEntries = 0;
837 static Window wWBFakeWindow = 0; // fake window keeps me from losing connection when I close all windows
838 static Window wIDApplication = None; // application window ID
839 
840 // ignoring X errors - sometimes errors are expected (!?)
841 int bIgnoreXErrors = 0;
842 static WB_ERROR_INFO xErrorInfo = {NULL, NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, None};
843 
844 // the default display - if I manage more than one, I may need these to be display-specific
845 Time tmDefaultDisplay = 0; // most recent time value for default display (from events)
846 WB_UINT64 qwDefaultDisplayTick = 0LL; // the tick count for the last 'default display time'

849 XStandardColormap cmapDefault; // a copy of teh XStandardColormap for the Colormap for the default display

859 #define EVENT_ARRAY_SIZE 0x2000 /* this many events maximum */
860 #define EVENT_ARRAY_MASK 0x1fff /* 'and' this for modular math */
861 
872 typedef struct __EVENT_ENTRY__
873 {
874  Display *pDisplay;
875  int iNext;
876  Window wID;
877  XEvent xEvt;
878 
885  char padding[256 - sizeof(Display *) - sizeof(Window) - sizeof(int) - sizeof(XEvent)];
886 
887 } EVENT_ENTRY;
888 
889 static EVENT_ENTRY axWBEvt[EVENT_ARRAY_SIZE];
890 
891 static int iWBQueuedEvent = -1, iWBQueueLast = -1, iWBPaintEvent = -1, iWBPaintLast = -1, iWBFreeEvent = -1;
892 static int iInitEventFlag = 0;

895 static int (* pAppEventCallback)(XEvent *pEvent) = NULL;

898 #define TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE 512
899 
908 typedef struct __TIMER_ENTRY__
909 {
910  struct __TIMER_ENTRY__ *pNext;
911  WB_UINT64 lTimeIndex;
912  unsigned long lTimeInterval;
913 
914  Display *pDisplay;
915  Window wID;
916  long lID;
917 } TIMER_ENTRY;
918 
919 static TIMER_ENTRY axWBTimer[TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE];
920 static TIMER_ENTRY *pTimerEntryActive = NULL, *pTimerEntryFree = NULL;
921  // pointers for two linked lists. entries must be in either 'active' or 'free' list.
922 
931 typedef struct __DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY__
932 {
933  struct __DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY__ *pNext;
934  WB_UINT64 lTimeIndex;
935 
936  XEvent event;
937 } DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY;

940 static DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY *pDelayedEventEntryActive = NULL, *pDelayedEventEntryFree = NULL;

977 /* */

979 
980 static int disable_imagecache = 0;
981 static int (*pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler)(Display *) = NULL;
982 static int WBXIOErrorHandler(Display *pDisp);
983 static int WBXErrorHandler(Display *pDisplay, XErrorEvent *pError);
984 static int hBogus[3]; // 'bogus' handles 0-2
985 
986 static WB_GEOM geomStartup
987 #ifdef WB_C99_INITIALIZERS
988  = {.x=0,.y=0,.width=0,.height=0,.border=0}; // C99 syntax; MS does not support this even in 2010 compiler
989  // NOTE: older 'element:value' syntax is supported by GCC only; use '.element=value' (C99) instead
990 #else // WB_C99_INITIALIZERS
991  = {0,0,0,0,0}; // C89 syntax (universally supported)
992 #error this compiler does not support C99 structure initializers. Some code will not (yet) compile.
993 #endif // WB_C99_INITIALIZERS
994 static char szStartupDisplayName[512]=":0.0"; // NOTE: new values must be UTF-8
995 static char szDefaultDisplayName[512]= ""; // copy the "default" display name from WBInit() here
996 
997 // libXft aka Freetype -
998 #ifdef X11WORKBENCH_TOOLKIT_HAVE_XFT
999 extern FT_Library __ftlib; /* located in font_helper.c */
1000 #endif // X11WORKBENCH_TOOLKIT_HAVE_XFT

1004 // helpers called by WBParseStandardArguments()
1005 
1006 void __internal_startup_display(const char *szVal)
1007 {
1008  strncpy(szStartupDisplayName, szVal, sizeof(szStartupDisplayName));
1009 
1010  szStartupDisplayName[sizeof(szStartupDisplayName) - 1] = 0;
1011 }
1012 
1013 
1014 void __internal_startup_minimize(void)
1015 {
1016  iStartupMinMax = -1;
1017 }
1018 
1019 
1020 void __internal_startup_maximize(void)
1021 {
1022  iStartupMinMax = 1;
1023 }
1024 
1025 
1026 void __internal_startup_geometry(const char *szVal)
1027 {
1028  sscanf(szVal, "%dx%d+%d+%d",
1029  &geomStartup.width, &geomStartup.height, &geomStartup.x, &geomStartup.y);
1030 }
1031 
1032 
1033 void __internal_disable_imagecache(void)
1034 {
1035  disable_imagecache = 1;
1036 }
1037 
1038 
1039 
1040 // MAIN WINDOW INITIALIZATION FUNCTION - call this after WBParseStandardArguments() to be
1041 // fully compliant with X11 command line standards.
1042 
1043 Display *WBInit(const char *szDisplayName) // NOTE: this is 'single instance' only...
1044 {
1045 int i1;
1046 Display *pRval;
1047 
1048 #ifndef WIN32
1049  signal(SIGCHLD, SIG_IGN); // make sure that 'SIGCHLD' signals are *IGNORED* - this is important
1050 #endif // WIN32
1051 
1052 
1053  WBPlatformOnInit(); // initialize a few important 'platform helper' things
1054 
1055  bQuitFlag = FALSE; // in case I re-init an app. note the variable is in 'platform_helper.c'
1056 
1057  // ********************************************************************************
1058  // HACK ALERT - HACK ALERT - HACK ALERT
1059  //
1060  // before I begin, allocate 3 handles. Any handles <= '2' will be KEPT OPEN
1061  // to avoid problems with the X display using things like stderr for I/O
1062  // (that is in case stdin, stdout, and stderr weren't allocated or were freed)
1063  // This assumes that these 3 aren't already open, but for a windowing application
1064  // with no stdin/stdout/stderr, this is a distinct possibility
1065  //
1066  // It is caused by a limitation of the X11 libraries, and is probably a bug.
1067 
1068  for(i1=0; i1 < 3; i1++)
1069  {
1070  hBogus[i1] = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
1071  }
1072 
1073  // NOTE: I can choose to clean this up later but for now it shouldn't do
1074  // any harm to leave any file handles <= 2 open in 'hBogus'
1075 
1076  for(i1=2; i1 >= 0; i1--)
1077  {
1078  if(hBogus[i1] > 2)
1079  {
1080  close(hBogus[i1]);
1081  hBogus[i1] = -1;
1082  }
1083  }
1084 
1085  // HACK ALERT - HACK ALERT - HACK ALERT
1086  // ********************************************************************************
1087 
1088  // NEXT, determine what the display name should be and open it
1089 
1090  if(!szDisplayName)
1091  {
1092  szDisplayName = GetStartupDisplayName();
1093  if(!szDisplayName || !*szDisplayName)
1094  {
1095  szDisplayName = ":0.0"; // make sure it's SOMETHING
1096  }
1097  }
1098 
1099  if((pRval = XOpenDisplay(szDisplayName)) == NULL)
1100  {
1101  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - can't open display %s\n", __FUNCTION__, szDisplayName);
1102 
1103  return NULL;
1104  }
1105 
1106  // make a copy of the display name for use later on, like for the clipboard initialization
1107  strncpy(szDefaultDisplayName, szDisplayName, sizeof(szDefaultDisplayName));
1108 
1109 
1110  // new I/O error handler - 'quit flag' will be set on error but app will
1111  // not terminate until the quit flag is 'noticed'
1112 
1113  pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler = XSetIOErrorHandler(WBXIOErrorHandler);
1114 
1115  if(WBInitDisplay(pRval)) // open and initialize display and basic windowing stuff (including clipboard)
1116  {
1117  WBExit(); // in case there are resources to free, plus it does XCloseDisplay(pRval);
1118 
1119  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - Unable to initialize X11 WorkBench Toolkit\n", __FUNCTION__);
1120 
1121  return NULL;
1122  }
1123 
1124 // XFlush(pRval);
1125  XSync(pRval, 0); // make sure that the display is "in sync"
1126 
1127 #if 0 // see if I still need this by removing it
1128  WBDelay(100000); // wait 0.1 seconds for everything to stabilize (shorter times not good enough)
1129  // sometimes the window manager will get caught in a race condition and
1130  // forward along keystrokes that belong to the OLD application, such
1131  // as the last <RETURN> keystroke release, which could cause a dialog box
1132  // to mis-behave or a window to insert an unnecessary keystroke. Giving
1133  // the window manager a chance to NOT be involved in a race condition should
1134  // prevent this from happening, or at least minimize the chances.
1135 #endif // 0
1136 
1137  // now that I've initialized the display I can initialize things
1138  // that depend up on it, beginning with the font stuff
1139 
1140  __internal_font_helper_init(); // initialize font helper
1141 
1142  // TODO: other things
1143 
1144  return pRval;
1145 }
1146 
1147 static int WBXIOErrorHandler(Display *pDisp)
1148 {
1149  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_ERROR | DebugSubSystem_Application,
1150  "I/O error occurred, setting 'bQuitFlag'\n");
1151 
1152  bQuitFlag = TRUE; // set QUIT flag on ALL I/O errors. This is the safest way to shut things down.
1153 
1154 // if(pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler)
1155 // return(pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler(pDisp));
1156 
1157  return 0; // for now will do this
1158 }
1159 
1160 
1161 int WBInitDisplay(Display *pDisplay)
1162 {
1163 unsigned long long ullTick;
1164 
1165  ullTick = WBGetTimeIndex();
1166 
1167  pDefaultDisplay = pDisplay;
1168 
1169  // create a 'fake' window that will keep me from losing connection when I terminate the app
1170  wWBFakeWindow = XCreateSimpleWindow(pDisplay, DefaultRootWindow(pDisplay), -1, -1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0);
1171 
1172  // assign a global X11 error handler that will continue execution after printing an appropriate
1173  // debug message (as needed), in lieu of basically KILLING THE APPLICATION due to some trivial B.S. "error"
1174 
1175 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1176  XSetErrorHandler(WBXErrorHandler);
1177 // END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1178 
1179  // begin clipboard initialization with a background thread
1180 
1181  if(__StartInitClipboardSystem(pDisplay, szDefaultDisplayName)) // initialize clipboard system
1182  {
1183  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - unable to initialize clipboard system\n", __FUNCTION__);
1184 
1185  return 2;
1186  }
1187 
1188  /*
1189  * Load the font to use. See Sections 10.2 & 6.5.1 of the X11 docs
1190  */
1191 
1192  pDefaultFont = WBLoadFont(pDisplay, WB_DEFAULT_FONT, WB_DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE, 0);
1193 
1194  if(!pDefaultFont)
1195  {
1196  pDefaultFont = WBLoadFont(pDisplay, "*", WB_DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE,
1197  WBFontFlag_PITCH_FIXED | WBFontFlag_STYLE_SANS);
1198 
1199  if(!pDefaultFont)
1200  {
1201  pDefaultFont = WBLoadFont(pDisplay, "*", WB_DEFAULT_FONT_SIZE, 0);
1202 
1203  if(!pDefaultFont)
1204  {
1205  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - NO DEFAULT FONT, returning 0\n", __FUNCTION__);
1206  return 0;
1207  }
1208  }
1209  }
1210 
1211 // fontsetDefault = WBFontSetFromFont(pDisplay, pDefaultFont);
1212 
1213  //------
1214  // ATOMS
1215  //------
1216 
1217  // NOTE: the documentation for 'XInternAtom' does _NOT_ include a provision to
1218  // free up unused atoms. There's no obvious way to get rid of the ones that
1219  // are not being used any more. The docs say the following:
1220  // "It will become undefined only when the last connection to the X server closes."
1221  // (As such, I should minimize introducing NEW atoms, even though it's kinda necessary)
1222  //
1223  // To compensate, MANY of the atoms that I create will use WBGetAtom() rather than XInternAtom()
1224  // and are considered to be 'WorkBench internal' only - so don't use outside of the toolkit
1225 
1226  // ClientMessage events (in general) for various notifications
1227  aMENU_COMMAND = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "MENU_COMMAND"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "MENU_COMMAND", False);
1228  aMENU_UI_COMMAND = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "MENU_UI_COMMAND"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "MENU_UI_COMMAND", False);
1229  aRESIZE_NOTIFY = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "RESIZE_NOTIFY"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "RESIZE_NOTIFY", False);
1230  aCONTROL_NOTIFY = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "CONTROL_NOTIFY"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "CONTROL_NOTIFY", False);
1231  aSCROLL_NOTIFY = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "SCROLL_NOTIFY"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "SCROLL_NOTIFY", False);
1232  aQUERY_CLOSE = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "QUERY_CLOSE"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "QUERY_CLOSE", False);
1233  aRECALC_LAYOUT = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "RECALC_LAYOUT"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "QUERY_CLOSE", False);
1234  aDESTROY_NOTIFY = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "DESTROY_NOTIFY"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "DESTROY_NOTIFY", False);
1235  aDLG_FOCUS = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "DLG_FOCUS"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "DLG_FOCUS", False);
1236  aSET_FOCUS = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "SET_FOCUS"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "SET_FOCUS", False);
1237 
1238  // no doubt the above list will grow as new types of ClientMessage events are added
1239 
1240  // internally-generated 'TIMER' event notification
1241  aWB_TIMER = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "WB_TIMER"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WB_TIMER", False);
1242 
1243  // additional 'window manager' ClientMessage events that are generated internally by the toolkit
1244  // as a result of 'message translation' (basically user input 'RAW' to something more usable)
1245  aWB_CHAR = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "WB_CHAR"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WB_CHAR", False);
1246  aWB_POINTER = WBGetAtom(pDisplay, "WB_POINTER"); //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WB_POINTER", False);
1247 
1248 
1249  // these next atoms REQUIRE the use of 'XInternAtom' since they have 'global' scope for the entire X11 system
1250 
1251  // window manager messages (see open desktop specification for window managers)
1252  // these should already be on the server since the WM would create them
1253  aWM_PROTOCOLS = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WM_PROTOCOLS", False);
1254  aWM_DELETE_WINDOW = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WM_DELETE_WINDOW", False);
1255  aWM_TAKE_FOCUS = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WM_TAKE_FOCUS", False);
1256 
1257  // atoms used for fonts (font properties, basically)
1258  aAVERAGE_WIDTH = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "AVERAGE_WIDTH", False);
1259 
1260  // atoms for the clipboard (these are all standards, should be on the server already)
1261  aCLIPBOARD = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "CLIPBOARD", False);
1262  aMANAGER = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "MANAGER", False);
1263  aTARGET = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "TARGET", False);
1264  aINCR = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "INCR", False);
1265  aPIXEL = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "PIXEL", False);
1266  aTEXT = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "TEXT", False);
1267 #ifdef X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING /* this indicates the extension is present - rarely would it NOT be */
1268  aUTF8_STRING = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "UTF8_STRING", False);
1269 #endif // X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING
1270  aC_STRING = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "C_STRING", False);
1271  aCOMPOUND_TEXT = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "COMPOUND_TEXT", False);
1272  aTARGETS = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "TARGETS", False);
1273  aMULTIPLE = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "MULTIPLE", False);
1274  aTIMESTAMP = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "TIMESTAMP", False);
1275 
1276 // other atoms that are pre-defined - left as comments for future reference, as needed
1277 //
1278 // aPRIMARY = XA_PRIMARY; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "PRIMARY", False);
1279 // aSECONDARY = XA_SECONDARY; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "SECONDARY", False);
1280 // aWINDOW = XA_WINDOW; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WINDOW", False);
1281 // aBITMAP = XA_BITMAP; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "BITMAP", False);
1282 // aDRAWABLE = XA_DRAWABLE; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "DRAWABLE", False);
1283 // aCOLORMAP = XA_COLORMAP; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "COLORMAP", False);
1284 // aPIXMAP = XA_PIXMAP; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "PIXMAP", False);
1285 // aSTRING = XA_STRING; //XInternAtom(pDisplay, "STRING", False);
1286 
1287  // and, of course, the string 'NULL' which should be globally defined
1288  aNULL = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "NULL", False);
1289 
1290  // make sure my atoms work. Mostly, they're pre-defined or 'WorkBench internal'
1291  // atoms, so no reason why they should not
1292 
1293  if(aMENU_COMMAND == None ||
1294  aMENU_UI_COMMAND == None ||
1295  aRESIZE_NOTIFY == None ||
1296  aCONTROL_NOTIFY == None ||
1297  aSCROLL_NOTIFY == None ||
1298  aQUERY_CLOSE == None ||
1299  aDESTROY_NOTIFY == None ||
1300  aDLG_FOCUS == None ||
1301  aSET_FOCUS == None ||
1302  aWM_PROTOCOLS == None ||
1303  aWM_DELETE_WINDOW == None ||
1304  aWM_TAKE_FOCUS == None ||
1305  aAVERAGE_WIDTH == None ||
1306  aWB_CHAR == None ||
1307  aWB_TIMER == None ||
1308  aWB_POINTER == None ||
1309  aCLIPBOARD == None ||
1310  aMANAGER == None ||
1311  aTARGET == None ||
1312  aINCR == None ||
1313  aPIXEL == None ||
1314  aTEXT == None ||
1315 #ifdef X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING /* this indicates the extension is present */
1316  aUTF8_STRING == None || // TODO: should this one be optional?
1317 #endif // X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING
1318  aC_STRING == None ||
1319  aCOMPOUND_TEXT == None ||
1320  aTARGETS == None ||
1321  aMULTIPLE == None ||
1322  aTIMESTAMP == None ||
1323 // aPRIMARY == None ||
1324 // aSECONDARY == None ||
1325 // aWINDOW == None ||
1326 // aBITMAP == None ||
1327 // aDRAWABLE == None ||
1328 // aCOLORMAP == None ||
1329 // aPIXMAP == None ||
1330 // aSTRING == None ||
1331  aNULL == None )
1332  {
1333  return 1;
1334  }
1335 
1336 
1337  // FINALLY, initialize settings and finish the clipboard system
1338 
1339  if(__FinishInitClipboardSystem(pDisplay, szDefaultDisplayName)) // initialize clipboard system
1340  {
1341  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - unable to initialize clipboard system\n", __FUNCTION__);
1342 
1343  return 2;
1344  }
1345 
1346  CHSettingsRefresh(pDisplay); // must init first part of the clipboard system *FIRST* before I call this
1347 
1348  // now there's a minimum time delay that I need so that any characters
1349  // that have been posted to a console window are processed by that console
1350  // window and not by me. If I grab the focus too early, it could interpret the
1351  // return for the previous command as an input to the program.
1352  //
1353  // This needs to be longer for a debug build than for a release one, due to debug output
1354  // on stderr (mostly). At least that's how it seems to me.
1355  //
1356  // So, I need to delay for about 0.25 seconds at a minimum for debug builds, and 0.1 seconds
1357  // for a release build.
1358 
1359 #ifdef NO_DEBUG
1360 #define MIN_STARTUP_DELAY 100000LL
1361 #else
1362 #define MIN_STARTUP_DELAY 250000LL
1363 #endif // NO_DEBUG
1364 
1365  ullTick = WBGetTimeIndex() - ullTick;
1366  if(ullTick < MIN_STARTUP_DELAY)
1367  {
1368  // TODO: eat all keyboard and mouse input events...
1369 
1370  usleep(MIN_STARTUP_DELAY - ullTick);
1371  }
1372 
1373  return 0; // success
1374 }
1375 
1376 
1377 WB_FONTC WBGetDefaultFont(void)
1378 {
1379  if(!pDefaultFont)
1380  {
1381  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - pDefaultFont is NULL\n", __FUNCTION__);
1382  }
1383 
1384  return (WB_FONTC)pDefaultFont;
1385 }
1386 
1387 //XFontStruct *WBGetDefaultFont(void)
1388 //{
1389 // extern XFontStruct *pDefaultFont; // default font
1390 //
1391 // if(!pDefaultFont)
1392 // {
1393 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - pDefaultFont is NULL\n", __FUNCTION__);
1394 // }
1395 //
1396 // return(pDefaultFont);
1397 //}
1398 
1399 //XFontSet WBGetDefaultFontSet(Display *pDisplay)
1400 //{
1401 //extern XFontSet fontsetDefault; // TODO: per-display font sets?
1402 //
1403 // if(!pDisplay || pDisplay == pDefaultDisplay)
1404 // {
1405 // if(fontsetDefault == None)
1406 // {
1407 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - fontsetDefault is None\n", __FUNCTION__);
1408 // }
1409 //
1410 // return fontsetDefault;
1411 // }
1412 //
1413 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TODO: %s - support use of non-default Display (returning 'None')\n", __FUNCTION__);
1414 //
1415 // return None; // for now...
1416 //}
1417 
1418 Window WBGetHiddenHelperWindow(void)
1419 {
1420  if(wWBFakeWindow == None)
1421  {
1422  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - wWBFakeWindow is 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__);
1423  }
1424 
1425  return wWBFakeWindow;
1426 }
1427 
1428 void __InternalDestroyWindow(Display *pDisp, Window wID, _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry)
1429 {
1430  Window wIDTemp;
1431  Atom aNCW;
1432  XClientMessageEvent xMsg;
1433  Status st;
1434  XImage *pTempImage;
1435  int i1;
1436 
1437 
1438 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - Destroying window %u (%08xH), %d hash entries\n",
1439 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID, nWBHashEntries);
1440 
1441  // first, I want to destroy any child windows that have window entries, FIRST. Do that now.
1442 
1443  for(i1=0; i1 < WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_SIZE; i1++)
1444  {
1445  if(WB_LIKELY(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED) ||
1446  WB_LIKELY(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == None))
1447  {
1448  continue; // ignore 'None' and 'UNUSED'
1449  }
1450 
1451  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == wID)
1452  {
1453 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - Destroy child windows, found 'me' %u (%08xH)\n",
1454 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID);
1455  continue; // ignore "me"
1456  }
1457 
1458  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wParent == wID)
1459  {
1460  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(sWBHashEntries[i1]))
1461  {
1462 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - child window already being destroyed %u (%08xH)\n",
1463 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
1464  }
1465  else if(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(sWBHashEntries[i1])) // not already destroyed (or being deleted)
1466  {
1467 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - child window already destroyed %u (%08xH)\n",
1468 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
1469  }
1470  else if(WB_TO_DELETE_WINDOW_ENTRY(sWBHashEntries[i1]))
1471  {
1472 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - child window entry to be deleted %u (%08xH)\n",
1473 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
1474  }
1475  else
1476  {
1477 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - Destroying child window %u (%08xH)\n",
1478 // __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (unsigned int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
1479 
1480  __InternalDestroyWindow(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, &(sWBHashEntries[i1]));
1481  }
1482  }
1483  }
1484 
1485 
1486  if(!pEntry || !(pEntry->eWMProtocols & WMPropertiesWMProtocols_DeleteWindow))
1487  {
1488 destroy_without_wm:
1489 
1490  if(pEntry)
1491  {
1492  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // so that there is no recursion problem
1493  // this way the window has already been marked 'destroyed' before actually calling
1494  // the function to destroy it. Doing it this way tells everything else down the
1495  // pike that I shouldn't be querying info or trying to destroy it TWICE.
1496  }
1497 
1498 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - call to XDestroyWindow for %u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
1499 
1500  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1501  XDestroyWindow(pDisp, wID); // do this anyway (since it's still mapped and not destroyed)
1502  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1503 
1504  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1505 // XFlush(pDefaultDisplay);
1506  XSync(pDefaultDisplay, FALSE); // try sync'ing to avoid certain problems
1507  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1508 
1509  // TODO: if pEntry is not NULL, do I wait for it to REALLY get destroyed?
1510 
1511  if(pEntry)
1512  {
1513  pTempImage = pEntry->pImage;
1514  pEntry->pImage = NULL;
1515 
1516  if(pTempImage)
1517  {
1518  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1519  XDestroyImage(pTempImage); // buh-bye!
1520  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1521  }
1522  }
1523 
1524  return;
1525  }
1526 
1527  if(!pDisp)
1528  {
1529  pDisp = pDefaultDisplay;
1530  }
1531 
1532  wIDTemp = DefaultRootWindow(pDisp);
1533 
1534  if(wIDTemp == None)
1535  {
1536  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - default root window = 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__);
1537  goto destroy_without_wm;
1538  }
1539 
1540  aNCW = XInternAtom(pDisp, "_NET_CLOSE_WINDOW", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
1541 
1542  if(aNCW == None)
1543  {
1544  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - atom for _NET_CLOSE_WINDOW = 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__);
1545  goto destroy_without_wm;
1546  }
1547 
1548  memset(&xMsg, 0, sizeof(xMsg));
1549 
1550  xMsg.type = ClientMessage;
1551  xMsg.serial = 0;
1552  xMsg.send_event = 1;
1553  xMsg.display = pDisp;
1554  xMsg.window = wID;
1555  xMsg.message_type = aNCW; // TODO: different atom for different display?
1556  xMsg.format = 32;
1557  xMsg.data.l[0] = CurrentTime; //WBGetLastEventTime();
1558  xMsg.data.l[1] = 1; // normal application
1559 
1560  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYING; // so that there is no recursion problem
1561 
1562  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1563  st = XSendEvent(pDisp, wIDTemp, False, NoEventMask, (XEvent *)&xMsg);
1564  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1565 
1566  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1567  XSync(pDefaultDisplay, FALSE); // try sync'ing to avoid certain errors
1568  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1569 
1570 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("<<TEMPORARY: %s - message sent to %d to close %d (%s)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wIDTemp, (int)wID, pEntry->szClassName);
1571 
1572 #if 0 /* this section never works */
1573  // waiting for the entry to be marked "destroyed"
1574 
1575  if(st)
1576  {
1577  WB_UINT64 tmNow = WBGetTimeIndex();
1578 
1579  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s - 'DESTROY WINDOW' message sent OK to WM\n", __FUNCTION__);
1580 
1581  st = 0;
1582  while(pEntry && (WBGetTimeIndex() - tmNow) < 50000) // wait up to 0.05 seconds
1583  {
1584  XEvent evt;
1585 
1586  WBDelay(MIN_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD); // wait 0.1 msec
1587 
1588  // look for (and dispatch) destroy notify messages for my window
1589  if(XCheckTypedEvent(pDisp, DestroyNotify, &evt))
1590  {
1591  WBDispatch(&evt); // process destroy notifications
1592  }
1593 
1594  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
1595  {
1596  st = 1;
1597 
1598  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s - 'DESTROY WINDOW' message acknowledged by WM\n", __FUNCTION__);
1599 
1600  break;
1601  }
1602  }
1603  }
1604 
1605  if(!st)
1606 #endif // 0
1607 
1608  {
1609 
1610 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Window,
1611 // "WARNING - %s - did not destroy window via WM, calling XDestroyWindow for %d (%s)\n",
1612 // __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, pEntry->szClassName);
1613 
1614  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // so that there is no recursion problem or attempts to use the window
1615 
1616 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - call to XDestroyWindow for %u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
1617 
1618  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1619  XDestroyWindow(pDisp, wID); // do this anyway (since it's still mapped and not destroyed)
1620  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1621 
1622  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1623  XSync(pDefaultDisplay, FALSE); // try sync'ing to avoid certain problems
1624  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1625 
1626  // if there's a cached XImage for this window, destroy it
1627 
1628  pTempImage = pEntry->pImage;
1629  pEntry->pImage = NULL;
1630 
1631  if(pTempImage)
1632  {
1633  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1634  XDestroyImage(pTempImage); // buh-bye!
1635  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1636  }
1637  }
1638 }
1639 
1640 void WBExit()
1641 {
1642 int i1;
1643 //Window wIDRoot, wIDTemp;
1644 
1645  bQuitFlag = TRUE; // in case this makes something happen
1646 
1647  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Init,
1648  "TRACE: WBExit\n");
1649 
1650  if(!pDefaultDisplay)
1651  {
1652  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - default display contains NULL\n", __FUNCTION__);
1653 
1654  WBExitClipboardSystem(NULL); // just in case
1655  return;
1656  }
1657 
1658  WBExitClipboardSystem(pDefaultDisplay); // do this now
1659 
1660  XFlush(pDefaultDisplay);
1661 
1662  // for each remaining window in my list, destroy it
1663  for(i1=WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX - 1; i1 >= 0; i1--)
1664  {
1665  Display *pDisp = sWBHashEntries[i1].pDisplay;
1666  Window wID = sWBHashEntries[i1].wID;
1667 
1668  if(!wID || wID == WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED)
1669  {
1670  continue;
1671  }
1672 
1673  if(!pDisp)
1674  {
1675  pDisp = pDefaultDisplay;
1676  }
1677 
1678  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(sWBHashEntries[i1]))
1679  {
1680  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s destroying window %d\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID);
1681 
1682  // send a 'destroy' request to the window manager
1683 
1684  __InternalDestroyWindow(pDisp, wID, &(sWBHashEntries[i1]));
1685  }
1686 
1687  WBUnregisterWindowCallback(wID);
1688 
1689  XFlush(pDisp);
1690  }
1691 
1692 // TODO: cache font sets within the font helper, and manage all of them there.
1693 // Font_OnExit(pDefaultDisplay); // call this _BEFORE_ I close the display
1694 
1695 // if(fontsetDefault != None)
1696 // {
1697 // XFreeFontSet(pDefaultDisplay, fontsetDefault);
1698 // fontsetDefault = None;
1699 // }
1700 
1701  if(pDefaultFont)
1702  {
1703 // XFreeFont(pDefaultDisplay, pDefaultFont);
1704  WBFreeFont(pDefaultDisplay, pDefaultFont);
1705  pDefaultFont = NULL;
1706  }
1707 
1708  if(wWBFakeWindow != None) // NOTE: WM doesn't know about this
1709  {
1710  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s destroying 'fake' window %d\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wWBFakeWindow);
1711 
1712  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1713  XDestroyWindow(pDefaultDisplay, wWBFakeWindow);
1714  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1715  }
1716 
1717  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1718  XSync(pDefaultDisplay, FALSE); // try sync'ing first to avoid certain errors
1719  XCloseDisplay(pDefaultDisplay); // display is to be destroyed now
1720  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1721 
1722  wWBFakeWindow = None;
1723  pDefaultDisplay = NULL;
1724 
1725  __internal_font_helper_exit(); // font helper
1726  PXM_OnExit(); // pixmap_helper
1727  CHOnExit(); // config_helper
1728  WBPlatformOnExit(); // platform_helper
1729 
1730  if(pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler)
1731  {
1732  XSetIOErrorHandler(pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler);
1733  pOldDisplayIOErrorHandler = NULL;
1734  }
1735 }
1736 
1737 const char *GetStartupDisplayName(void)
1738 {
1739  return szStartupDisplayName;
1740 }
1741 
1742 void GetStartupGeometry(WB_GEOM *pGeom)
1743 {
1744  if(pGeom)
1745  {
1746  memcpy(pGeom, &geomStartup, sizeof(WB_GEOM));
1747  }
1748 }
1749 
1750 int GetStartupMinMax(void)
1751 {
1752  return iStartupMinMax;
1753 }
1754 
1755 
1756 Display *WBThreadInitDisplay(void)
1757 {
1758 Display *pDisplay;
1759 
1760  if(!szDefaultDisplayName[0]) // no display has been opened yet
1761  {
1762  return NULL;
1763  }
1764 
1765  pDisplay = XOpenDisplay(szDefaultDisplayName); // open a copy of the display
1766 
1767 
1768  // TODO: other initialization
1769 
1770 
1771  if(pDisplay)
1772  {
1773  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1774 // XFlush(pDisplay);
1775  XSync(pDisplay, FALSE); // sync everything now
1776  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1777  }
1778 
1779  return pDisplay;
1780 }
1781 
1782 void WBThreadFreeDisplay(Display *pThreadDisplay)
1783 {
1784  if(pThreadDisplay)
1785  {
1786  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1787 // XFlush(pThreadDisplay);
1788  XSync(pThreadDisplay, FALSE); // try sync'ing first to avoid certain errors
1789  XCloseDisplay(pThreadDisplay); // display is to be destroyed now
1790  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1791  }
1792 }
1793 
1794 void WBInitWindowAttributes(XSetWindowAttributes *pXSWA, unsigned long lBorderPixel,
1795  unsigned long lBackgroundPixel, Colormap clrMap, int iBitGravity)
1796 {
1797  memset(pXSWA, 0, sizeof(*pXSWA));
1798 
1799  pXSWA->border_pixel = lBorderPixel;
1800  pXSWA->background_pixel = lBackgroundPixel;
1801  pXSWA->colormap = clrMap;
1802  pXSWA->bit_gravity = iBitGravity;
1803 }
1804 
1805 void WBInitSizeHints(XSizeHints *pSH, Display *pDisplay, int iMinHeight, int iMinWidth)
1806 {
1807  WB_GEOM geomStartup;
1808 
1809  if(!pDisplay)
1810  {
1811  pDisplay = WBGetDefaultDisplay();
1812  }
1813 
1814 #define WBInitSizeHints__max(X,Y) ((X) > (Y) ? (X) : (Y))
1815 
1816  memset(pSH, 0, sizeof(*pSH));
1817 
1818  pSH->flags = (PPosition | PSize);
1819 
1820  GetStartupGeometry(&geomStartup); // based on user-specified or stored parameters
1821 
1822  // making this SIMPLE AS POSSIBLE, default to 2/3 of the screen (vertically and horizontally) and
1823  // center the window. If the screen is 16x9, reduce the width estimate to 4/3 the height
1824 
1825  if(!geomStartup.width || !geomStartup.height) // width or height zero --> default
1826  {
1827  int iDisplayHeight = DisplayHeight(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay));
1828  int iDisplayWidth = DisplayWidth(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay));
1829  int iActualDisplayWidth = iDisplayWidth;
1830 
1831  if(iDisplayWidth > iDisplayHeight * 4 / 3) // for 16x9 screens, we want a reasonable estimate
1832  {
1833  iDisplayWidth = iDisplayHeight * 4 / 3;
1834  }
1835 
1836  // base window dimensions on 2/3 of the size of the display or min height/width
1837 
1838  pSH->width = WBInitSizeHints__max(iMinWidth, iDisplayWidth * 2 / 3);
1839  pSH->height = WBInitSizeHints__max(iMinHeight, iDisplayHeight * 2 / 3);
1840 
1841  // vertically and horizontally center the window
1842 
1843  pSH->x = (iActualDisplayWidth - pSH->width) / 2; // use the actual display width this time
1844  pSH->y = (iDisplayHeight - pSH->height) / 2;
1845  }
1846  else
1847  {
1848  // user-specified dimensions take precedence
1849 
1850  pSH->x = geomStartup.x;
1851  pSH->y = geomStartup.y;
1852 
1853  pSH->width = geomStartup.width;
1854  pSH->height = geomStartup.height;
1855  }
1856 
1857 #undef WBInitSizeHints__max
1858 
1859 }
1860 
1861 
1862 
1863 int WBShowModal(Window wID, int bMenuSplashFlag)
1864 {
1865 int iRval = -1;
1866 int iSleepPeriod;
1867 WB_GEOM geom;
1868 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
1869 
1870 
1871  if(!pEntry)
1872  return -1;
1873 
1874  pEntry->iModalFlag = 1;
1875  pEntry->iModalReturn = -1;
1876 
1877  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Window,
1878  "Show Modal %d (%08xH) bMenuSplashFlag=%d\n", (int)wID, (int)wID, bMenuSplashFlag);
1879 
1880  // make sure I'm "transient for" the parent window [always] except for menus
1881  if(bMenuSplashFlag <= 0) // not for menus but splash ok
1882  {
1883  Atom a1, a2;
1884 // Window wParent;
1885 
1886  a1 = XInternAtom(pEntry->pDisplay, "_NET_WM_STATE", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
1887  a2 = XInternAtom(pEntry->pDisplay, "_NET_WM_STATE_MODAL", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
1888  XChangeProperty(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, a1, XA_ATOM, 32, PropModePrepend, (unsigned char *)&a2, 1);
1889  // note: Keeping existing properties, and adding my own
1890 
1891 // // setting 'WM_TRANSIENT_FOR' allows me to use the parent window while the dialog is open - I do NOT want that!
1892 // a1 = XInternAtom(pEntry->pDisplay, "WM_TRANSIENT_FOR", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
1893 // wParent = WBGetParentWindow(wID); NOTE this is not the way to do it, fix elsewhere eh?
1894 // XChangeProperty(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, a1, XA_WINDOW, 32, PropModeReplace, (unsigned char *)&wParent, 1);
1895  }
1896 
1897  XMapRaised(pEntry->pDisplay, wID);
1898 
1899  if(!bMenuSplashFlag) // dialog boxes ONLY
1900  {
1901  WBSetInputFocus(wID); // NOTE: menu popups _MUST_ be declared with 'focus bit' 0, and handled differently
1902  }
1903 
1904  if(bMenuSplashFlag > 0)
1905  {
1906 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - grabbing mouse and keyboard\n", __FUNCTION__);
1907 
1908  // ----------------------------
1909  // mouse and keyboard grab time
1910  // ----------------------------
1911 
1912  WBGetWindowGeom2(wID, &geom); // geometry relative to root window
1913 
1914  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1915  XGrabPointer(pEntry->pDisplay,wID, 1,
1916  ButtonPressMask | ButtonReleaseMask | ButtonMotionMask | PointerMotionMask
1917  | EnterWindowMask | LeaveWindowMask,
1918  GrabModeAsync, // pointer mode
1919  GrabModeAsync, // keyboard mode
1920  None, None, CurrentTime);
1921  XGrabKeyboard(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, 1,
1922  GrabModeAsync, // pointer mode
1923  GrabModeAsync, // keyboard mode
1924  CurrentTime);
1925  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
1926  }
1927 // else
1928 // {
1929 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: showing modal for NON-menu\n");
1930 // }
1931 
1932 
1933 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - begin modal event processing\n", __FUNCTION__);
1934 
1935  iSleepPeriod = MIN_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD; // initial value, in microseconds
1936 
1937  while(!bQuitFlag)
1938  {
1939  XEvent event;
1940 
1941  // do a mini event loop but only for this window. The event handler should
1942  // be smart enough to handle a condition where I attempt to change focus
1943 
1944  // for future implementation - see XmTrackingEvent for hints on how to implement this properly
1945 
1946  // TODO: modal filtering for window and children of this window
1947 
1948  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID); // re-assign 'pEntry'
1949 
1950  if(!pEntry)
1951  {
1952  break;
1953  }
1954 
1955  if(!WBIsValid(pEntry->pDisplay, wID) ||
1956  !pEntry->iModalFlag)
1957  {
1958  break;
1959  }
1960 
1961  if(!__InternalCheckGetEvent(pEntry->pDisplay, &event, wID))
1962  {
1963  WBDelay(iSleepPeriod); // 100 microsecs (0.1 milliseconds) initially, grows over time
1964  if(iSleepPeriod < MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD) // up to 'MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD' microseconds
1965  {
1966  iSleepPeriod += (iSleepPeriod >> 1); // increase by 50%
1967  }
1968  else
1969  {
1970  iSleepPeriod = MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD; // the maximum
1971  }
1972 
1973  continue;
1974  }
1975 
1976  iSleepPeriod = MIN_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD; // reset to the initial value
1977 
1978  // check for application events - these will continue to happen
1979  // even during a modal loop.
1980 
1981  if(event.xany.window == None)
1982  {
1983  // TODO: if messages aren't consistent with 'xany', filter them here.
1984 
1985  WBAppDispatch(&event);
1986  continue;
1987  }
1988 
1989 //#ifndef NO_DEBUG
1990 // WBDebugDumpEvent(&event); // TEMPORARY
1991 //#endif // NO_DEBUG
1992 
1993  // For menus, check for mousie events outside of my window. If this happens
1994  // I want to cancel the modal loop and re-play the event.
1995 
1996  if(bMenuSplashFlag > 0) // menus only
1997  {
1998  if((event.type == ButtonPress || event.type == ButtonRelease) &&
1999  !WBPointInGeom(event.xbutton.x_root, event.xbutton.y_root, geom))
2000  {
2001  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Mouse | DebugSubSystem_Menu,
2002  "WBShowModal - (menu) mouse button press outside of grab window\n");
2003 
2004  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2005  XUngrabPointer(pEntry->pDisplay, CurrentTime);
2006  XUngrabKeyboard(pEntry->pDisplay, CurrentTime);
2007  XAllowEvents(pEntry->pDisplay, ReplayPointer, CurrentTime/*event.xbutton.time*/); // re-play the mousie event
2008 
2009  XPutBackEvent(pEntry->pDisplay, &event); // TODO: correct window ID?
2010  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2011 
2012  WBDestroyWindow(wID);
2013  return -1; // "canceled"
2014  }
2015  }
2016  else if(bMenuSplashFlag < 0) // splash screens
2017  {
2018  }
2019  else if(event.xany.window != wID && event.type == FocusIn) // dialog boxes getting focus
2020  {
2021  // in this case it is EXTREMELY important to determine if the main
2022  // window is getting an 'enter focus' notification, since I will need
2023  // to re-assign focus to 'wID' ASAP. Examples are when the user clicks
2024  // on the main window while a dialog box is visible, or if the user attempts
2025  // to change focus to the main window via alt+tab or clicking on an icon in
2026  // the task bar. Therefore, if 'event.xany.window' isn't a child of 'wID'
2027  // I shall call 'SetFocus' on 'wID' and eat the message.
2028  // For this to work, top level windows must allow 'EnterNotify' messages.
2029 
2030  if(!WBIsChildWindow(wID, event.xany.window))
2031  {
2032  Display *pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
2033 
2034 // fprintf(stderr, "** TEMPORARY: window %08xH 'FocusIn' in modal loop for %08xH\n",
2035 // (unsigned int)event.xany.window, (unsigned int)wID);
2036 
2037  WBPostDelayedSetFocusAppEvent(pDisplay, wID, event.xany.window, 100); // 100 msec delay
2038  // activate, set focus, raise, and map 'wID' (with 'event.xany.window' possibly having HAD focus)
2039  // and the 100 msec delay is to ensure that NO race conditions happen with the window manager
2040 
2041  continue; // old message eaten
2042  }
2043  }
2044 
2045 
2046  // see if this event is intended for the modal window or one of its children
2047  // and if so, I want to dispatch it
2048 
2049  if(event.xany.window == wID ||
2050  event.type == Expose || // always handle expose events
2051  event.type == GraphicsExpose ||
2052 // event.type == NoExpose ||
2053  event.type == DestroyNotify || // always allow destroy notifications
2054  event.type == SelectionRequest ||
2055  event.type == SelectionClear ||
2056  event.type == SelectionNotify ||
2057  (bMenuSplashFlag > 0 && // check for ANY KB+mouse events when NOT a splash window
2058  (event.type == KeyPress || event.type == KeyRelease ||
2059  event.type == ButtonPress || event.type == ButtonRelease ||
2060  event.type == MotionNotify || event.type == EnterNotify ||
2061  event.type == LeaveNotify)) ||
2062  (bMenuSplashFlag >= 0 && WBIsChildWindow(wID, event.xany.window)) || // check for 'is a child of modal' when NOT a splash window
2063  WB_UNLIKELY(event.type == ClientMessage &&
2064  (event.xclient.message_type == aWM_PROTOCOLS || // all of these get through
2065  event.xclient.message_type == aWB_TIMER))) // all timers get through
2066  {
2067  if(event.xany.window != wID && bMenuSplashFlag > 0 && // menu only because I'm capturing keyboard and mouse
2068  (event.type == KeyPress || event.type == KeyRelease || event.type == MotionNotify))
2069  {
2070  if(event.type == MotionNotify)
2071  {
2072  int iX, iY;
2073  // mouse coordinates have been adjusted for the window for which
2074  // it was intended. these must be 'altered'
2075  WBXlatCoordPoint(event.xmotion.window, event.xmotion.x, event.xmotion.y,
2076  wID, &iX, &iY);
2077  event.xmotion.x = iX;
2078  event.xmotion.y = iY;
2079  event.xmotion.window = wID; // assign THIS window's ID for such messages
2080  }
2081  else
2082  {
2083 // Window wParent = WBGetParentWindow(wID);
2084  if(!WBIsChildWindow(wID, event.xany.window))
2085  {
2086  event.xany.window = wID; // assign THIS window's ID for such messages
2087  }
2088  }
2089  }
2090 
2091 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
2092  if(event.xany.window != wID &&
2093  WB_LIKELY(event.type != ClientMessage ||
2094  (event.xclient.message_type != aWB_TIMER && event.xclient.message_type != aWM_PROTOCOLS)))
2095 
2096  {
2097  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2098  "%s - event %s for window %d (%08xH) in modal loop\n",
2099  __FUNCTION__,
2100  WBEventName(event.type),
2101  (int)event.xany.window, (int)event.xany.window);
2102  }
2103 
2104  if(event.type == KeyPress || event.type == KeyRelease)
2105  {
2106  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Keyboard | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2107  "%s - TEMPORARY - processing key press/release within modal loop: %d (%08xH), %d (%08xH)\n",
2108  __FUNCTION__, (int)event.xany.window, (int)event.xany.window, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2109  }
2110 
2111 #endif // NO_DEBUG
2112 
2113  WBWindowDispatch(event.xany.window, &event);
2114  }
2115 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
2116  else
2117  {
2118  // say something for debug purposes about messages that weren't processed
2119 
2120 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_ERROR,
2121 // "** TEMPORARY: IGNORING %s in modal loop: %d (%08xH), %d (%08xH)\n",
2122 // __internal_event_type_string(event.type),
2123 // (int)event.xany.window, (int)event.xany.window, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2124 
2125  if(event.type == KeyPress || event.type == KeyRelease)
2126  {
2127  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Keyboard | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2128  "%s - key press/release in modal loop: %d (%08xH), %d (%08xH)\n",
2129  __FUNCTION__, (int)event.xany.window, (int)event.xany.window, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2130  }
2131  }
2132 #endif // NO_DEBUG
2133 
2134  // other stuff gets ignored
2135 
2136  }
2137 
2138  if(!pEntry)
2139  {
2140  return -1;
2141  }
2142 
2143  if(bMenuSplashFlag > 0) // menus only
2144  {
2145  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2146  XUngrabPointer(pEntry->pDisplay, CurrentTime);
2147  XUngrabKeyboard(pEntry->pDisplay, CurrentTime);
2148  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2149  }
2150 
2151  iRval = pEntry->iModalReturn;
2152 
2153  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2154  "Exit from modal loop, window %d (%08xH) - returning %d (%08xH)\n",
2155  (int)wID, (int)wID, iRval, iRval);
2156 
2157  // destroy the window now that I'm out of the loop
2158 
2159 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("** TEMPORARY - %s - destroying window %d\n", __FUNCTION__,(int)wID);
2160 
2161  WBDestroyWindow(wID);
2162 
2163  return iRval;
2164 }
2165 
2166 void WBEndModal(Window wID, int iRval)
2167 {
2168  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
2169 
2170  if(!pEntry)
2171  return;
2172 
2173  pEntry->iModalFlag = 0;
2174  pEntry->iModalReturn = iRval;
2175 
2176  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2177  "WBEndModal - Window %d (%08xH), returning %d (%08xH)\n",
2178  (int)wID, (int)wID, iRval, iRval);
2179 }
2180 
2181 void WBSetInputFocus(Window wID) // set input focus to specific window (revert window is previous focus window)
2182 {
2183  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
2184  Window wIDCurrent;
2185  int iRevert;
2186  Display *pDisp = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
2187 
2188  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2189  XGetInputFocus(pDisp, &wIDCurrent, &iRevert);
2190  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2191 
2192  if(wID != wIDCurrent) // don't have focus
2193  {
2194  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pPrev = WBGetWindowEntry(wIDCurrent);
2195  if(pPrev)
2196  {
2197  if(WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pPrev))
2198  {
2199  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2200  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) disabling focus change on map\n",
2201  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wIDCurrent);
2202 
2203  pPrev->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED; // remove 'set focus' state
2204  }
2205  }
2206 
2207  // see if expose event has been done on this yet...
2208  if(WB_LIKELY(pEntry) && //WB_UNLIKELY(!pEntry->width && !pEntry->height && !pEntry->border))
2209  WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(*pEntry)))
2210  {
2211  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2212  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) not yet visible, enabling focus change on map\n",
2213  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2214 
2215  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP;
2216  }
2217  else
2218  {
2219  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2220  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) calling XSetInputFocus\n",
2221  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2222 
2223 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (uint32_t)wID);
2224 
2225  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2226  XSetInputFocus(pDisp, wID, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
2227  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2228  }
2229  }
2230 }
2231 
2232 // construction and destruction
2233 
2234 void WBDestroyWindow(Window wID)
2235 {
2236  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
2237  Display *pDisplay = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
2238  XEvent event;
2239 
2240  if(pEntry && WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry)) // recursive or extra call
2241  {
2242  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - Recursive call, Window %d (%08xH)\n",
2243  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2244 
2245  __WBDelWindowPaintEvents(pDisplay, wID); // make sure expose events go away
2246 
2247  return;
2248  }
2249 
2250  if(pEntry && WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(*pEntry)) // recursive call in need of XDestroyWindow
2251  {
2252  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // initially, do this (in case of extra recursion)
2253 
2254  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s recursively destroying window %d\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID);
2255 
2256  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2257  XDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID); // handler should clean up the rest
2258  // NOTE: this _CAN_ recurse in some cases
2259 // XFlush(pDisplay);
2260  XSync(pDisplay, False); // wait for server to actually do it - specific to debug output, really
2261  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2262 
2263  __WBDelWindowPaintEvents(pDisplay, wID); // make sure expose events go away
2264 
2265  return;
2266  }
2267 
2268  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Chatty | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2269  "%s - Window %d (%08xH) class %s\n",
2270  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID, pEntry ? (pEntry->szClassName ? pEntry->szClassName : "NULL") : "*Unk*");
2271 
2272  // get all events for this window and remove them
2273 
2274  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2275  XSync(pDisplay, FALSE); // force a sync first
2276  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2277 
2278  while(XCheckWindowEvent(pDisplay, wID, EVENT_ALL_MASK, &event))
2279  {
2280 // WBDelay(1000); // force sleep during loop?
2281  }
2282 
2283  if(!pEntry)
2284  {
2285  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: WBDestroyWindow for wID not in list - window already destroyed?\n");
2286 
2287  XSync(pDisplay, 0);
2288 
2289  __WBDelWindowEvents(pDefaultDisplay, wID);
2290 
2291  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s destroying UN-REGISTERED window %d\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID);
2292 
2293 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2294 // XDestroyWindow(pDefaultDisplay, wID);
2295 // END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2296  __InternalDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID, NULL);
2297  }
2298  else
2299  {
2300  // TODO: should I send a notification first?
2301 
2302  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2303  "WBDestroyWindow - wID %d (%08xH)\n",
2304  (int)wID, (int)wID);
2305 
2306  // I'll want to process some additional events at this point, JUST for the
2307  // window and its children
2308 
2309  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2310  XSync(pDisplay, 0);
2311  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2312 
2313 // NOTE: I used to dispatch remaining events, but this might dispatch EXPOSE and I don't want that
2314 // while(XCheckWindowEvent(pDisplay, wID, EVENT_ALL_MASK, &event))
2315 // {
2316 // WBWindowDispatch(wID, &event);
2317 // }
2318 
2319  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2320  "WBDestroyWindow - wID %d (%08xH), display flushed\n",
2321  (int)wID, (int)wID);
2322 
2323  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry))
2324  {
2325  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2326  "WBDestroyWindow - wID %d (%08xH), calling XDestroyWindow\n",
2327  (int)wID, (int)wID);
2328 
2329  __InternalDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID, pEntry); // may mark it 'DESTROYING' so recursion won't happen (see above)
2330 
2331 // if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
2332 // {
2333 // pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // initially, do this (in case of recursion)
2334 //
2335 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("** WARNING: %s destroying window %d (marked it 'destroyed') "/*X errors ignored*/"\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID);
2336 //
2338 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2339 // XDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID); // handler should clean up the rest
2340 // // NOTE: this _CAN_ recurse in some cases
2342 // XSync(pDisplay, False);
2343 // END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2345 // }
2346  }
2347  else if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(*pEntry) && !WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
2348  {
2349  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2350  "WBDestroyWindow - wID %d (%08xH), destroying 'unmapped' window\n",
2351  (int)wID, (int)wID);
2352 
2353  __InternalDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID, pEntry); // may mark it 'DESTROYING' so recursion won't happen (see above)
2354  }
2355  // NOTE: the above 'if' may preclude this next one from EVAR happening
2356  else if(!WB_TO_DELETE_WINDOW_ENTRY(*pEntry)) // has not called 'WBUnregisterWindowCallback'
2357  {
2358  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2359  "WBDestroyWindow - wID %d (%08xH), Marking 'unmapped' window 'destroyed'\n",
2360  (int)wID, (int)wID);
2361 
2362  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // initially, do this
2363  }
2364 
2365  __WBDelWindowEvents(pDisplay, wID);
2366 
2367  if(!WB_TO_DELETE_WINDOW_ENTRY(*pEntry)) // in case 'Destroy' notification didn't make this happen
2368  {
2369  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2370  "WARNING - %s - last ditch attempt, unregistering window callback for window %d\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID);
2371  WBUnregisterWindowCallback(wID);
2372  }
2373  }
2374 }
2375 
2376 
2377 // application callback registration
2378 
2379 void WBRegisterAppCallback(WBAppEvent pCallback)
2380 {
2381  pAppEventCallback = pCallback;
2382 }
2383 
2384 void WBUnregisterAppCallback()
2385 {
2386  pAppEventCallback = NULL;
2387 }
2388 
2389 
2390 /**********************************************************************/
2391 /* */
2392 /* window entry array processing */
2393 /* */
2394 /**********************************************************************/
2395 
2396 
2397 static __inline__ void InternalRestoreWindowDefaults(int iIndex)
2398 {
2399  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].szClassName = NULL; // no class name, initially
2400  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wParent = 0; // mark it as "unassigned"
2401  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].idCursor = WB_DEFAULT_CURSOR;
2402  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].idDefaultCursor = WB_DEFAULT_CURSOR;
2403  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].iWaitCursorCount = 0;
2404  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].curRecent = None;
2405  bzero(&(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].geomAbsolute), sizeof(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].geomAbsolute));
2406  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnClip = 0;
2407  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnPaint = 0;
2408 
2409  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].iModalFlag = 0;
2410  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].iModalReturn = -1;
2411 
2412  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].width = sWBHashEntries[iIndex].height
2413  = sWBHashEntries[iIndex].border = 0; // make sure these are zero as well (indicates 'not yet visible')
2414 
2415 
2416  // this is primarily for when I unregister the callback (I must also unregister the menu)
2417  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wIDMenu = 0;
2418  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pMenuCallback = 0;
2419  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED;
2420 
2421  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].eWindowType = WMPropertiesWindowType_Normal; // TODO: notify window manager?
2422  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].eWMProtocols = WMPropertiesWMProtocols_None; // TODO: notify window manager?
2423 
2424  // zero out the window data (TODO: zero out everything?)
2425  bzero(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].aWindowData, sizeof(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].aWindowData));
2426 }
2427 
2428 //static /*__inline*/ WBWindow WBWindowFromWindow(Window wID)
2429 //{
2430 // return (WBWindow)((unsigned long long)wID | WBWINDOW_FLAGS_NORMAL);
2431 //}
2432 
2433 //static /*__inline*/ Window WBWindowToWindow(WBWindow wID)
2434 //{
2435 // return (Window)(wID & WBWINDOW_MASK);
2436 //}
2437 
2438 
2439 // WBGetWindowEntry - the debug version indicates what the caller's line number and function are
2440 
2441 #ifdef NO_DEBUG
2442 static /*__inline__*/ _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *WBGetWindowEntry(Window wID)
2443 #else
2444 #define WBGetWindowEntry(X) Debug_WBGetWindowEntry(X, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__)
2445 static /*__inline__*/ _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *Debug_WBGetWindowEntry(Window wID, const char *szFunction, int nLine)
2446 #endif // NO_DEBUG
2447 {
2448  int i1, iStart;
2449 
2450  if(!nWBHashEntries)
2451  {
2452 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
2453  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2454  "%s:%d - Window hash table empty, %d (%08xH) not found\n",
2455  szFunction, nLine, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2456 #endif // NO_DEBUG
2457  return(NULL);
2458  }
2459 
2460  i1 = iStart = WINDOW_ENTRY_HASH(wID);
2461 
2462  while(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID) // this must be assigned to zero for this to work properly
2463  {
2464  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == wID)
2465  {
2466  gettimeofday(&(sWBHashEntries[i1].tvLastActivity), NULL);
2467  return(sWBHashEntries + i1);
2468  }
2469 
2470  i1++;
2471  i1 &= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX;
2472 
2473  if(i1 == iStart)
2474  break;
2475  }
2476 
2477 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
2478  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2479  "%s:%d - Window ID %d (%08xH) not found\n",
2480  szFunction, nLine, (int)wID, (int)wID);
2481 #endif // NO_DEBUG
2482 
2483  return(NULL);
2484 }
2485 
2486 // window callback registration - this also adds a window entry if one does
2487 // not already exist for the specified window ID. This function assumes
2488 // that the window's display is the default display.
2489 
2490 static _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *__AddOrLocateEntry(Window wID)
2491 {
2492 register int i1, i2, iStart;
2493 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pRval = NULL;
2494 
2495 
2496  i2 = -1; // 'unused' entry marker
2497  i1 = WINDOW_ENTRY_HASH(wID);
2498 
2499  if(!nWBHashEntries)
2500  {
2501  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2502  "__AddOrLocateEntry - zero out window hash/array since it's empty\n");
2503  bzero(sWBHashEntries, sizeof(sWBHashEntries));
2504  }
2505  else
2506  {
2507  // keep track of the one I start with as 'iStart'
2508 
2509  iStart = i1;
2510 
2511  while(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID) // the array must be pre-assigned to zero for this to work properly
2512  {
2513  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == wID)
2514  {
2515  pRval = sWBHashEntries + i1;
2516  break;
2517  }
2518 
2519  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED)
2520  {
2521  i2 = i1; // keep track of the 1st unused entry in the chain
2522  }
2523 
2524  i1++;
2525  i1 &= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX;
2526 
2527  if(i1 == iStart)
2528  {
2529  i1 = -1; // error flag (hash table full)
2530  break;
2531  }
2532  }
2533  }
2534 
2535  // if pRval is NULL, I need to add the entry
2536  // in that case, either i2 or i1 points to it.
2537  // if both i1 and i2 are negative, it's an error
2538  // The number of active entries is limited to 3/4
2539  // of the hash table size for speed and efficiency.
2540 
2541  if(!pRval)
2542  {
2543  if(i1 < 0 && i2 < 0)
2544  return NULL;
2545 
2546  // --------------------------
2547  // HASH TABLE SIZE LIMITATION
2548  // --------------------------
2549 
2550  // if 4 times the # of entries is larger than 3 times the # of hash entries,
2551  // then the hash is 3/4 full and grossly inefficient. This is my limit.
2552 
2553  if((nWBHashEntries * 4) > (3 * sizeof(sWBHashEntries)/sizeof(sWBHashEntries[0]))) // an efficient algorithm
2554  return NULL; // enforce hash table twice maximum
2555 
2556  nWBHashEntries++; // keep track
2557 
2558  if(i2 >= 0)
2559  i1 = i2;
2560 
2561  pRval = sWBHashEntries + i1;
2562  pRval->wID = wID; // mark it "mine"
2563  pRval->pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay; // for now - TODO get the real display
2564  pRval->pImage = NULL; // pre-assign the cached image to NULL
2565 
2566  InternalRestoreWindowDefaults(i1);
2567 
2568  WBRestoreDefaultCursor(wID); // assign the default cursor for a new entry
2569  }
2570 
2571  if(pRval)
2572  {
2573  gettimeofday(&(pRval->tvLastActivity), NULL);
2574  }
2575 
2576  return pRval;
2577 }
2578 
2579 static void __WindowEntryRestoreDefaultResources(int iIndex)
2580 {
2581  Display *pDisp = pDefaultDisplay;
2582 
2583  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pDisplay)
2584  {
2585  pDisp = sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pDisplay;
2586  }
2587 
2588  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2589 // if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].fontSet != None && sWBHashEntries[iIndex].fontSet != fontsetDefault) // must delete it
2590 // {
2591 // XFreeFontSet(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].fontSet);
2592 // sWBHashEntries[iIndex].fontSet = None;
2593 // }
2594 // if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFontStruct && sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFontStruct != pDefaultFont) // must delete it
2595 // {
2596 // XFreeFont(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFontStruct);
2597 // sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFontStruct = NULL;
2598 // }
2599  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFont && sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFont != pDefaultFont) // must delete it
2600  {
2601  WBFreeFont(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFont);
2602  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pFont = NULL;
2603  }
2604  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxIcon)
2605  {
2606  XFreePixmap(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxIcon);
2607  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxIcon = 0;
2608  }
2609  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxMask)
2610  {
2611  XFreePixmap(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxMask);
2612  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pxMask = 0;
2613  }
2614  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pWMHints)
2615  {
2616  XFree(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pWMHints);
2617  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pWMHints = NULL;
2618  }
2619  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].curRecent != None)
2620  {
2621  XFreeCursor(pDisp, sWBHashEntries[iIndex].curRecent);
2622  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].curRecent = None;
2623  }
2624  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnClip != 0)
2625  {
2626  XDestroyRegion(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnClip);
2627  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnClip = 0;
2628  }
2629  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnPaint != 0)
2630  {
2631  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: paint region non-zero in __WindowEntryRestoreDefaultResources\n");
2632  XDestroyRegion(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnPaint);
2633  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].rgnPaint = 0;
2634  }
2635  if(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pImage != NULL)
2636  {
2637  XDestroyImage(sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pImage);
2638  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pImage = NULL;
2639  }
2640  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2641 
2642 }
2643 
2644 static void __WindowEntryDestructor(int iIndex)
2645 {
2646 int iPrev, iNext;
2647 
2648  __WindowEntryRestoreDefaultResources(iIndex); // make sure no resources are allocated
2649 
2650  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pCallback = 0;
2651  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].pDisplay = NULL; // must happen AFTER restoring default resources
2652 
2653  // restore these and additional default values
2654  InternalRestoreWindowDefaults(iIndex);
2655 
2657  // _ _ _ _____ _ _ ____ _ //
2658  // | | | | __ _ ___| |__ |_ _|_ _| |__ | | ___ / ___| | ___ __ _ _ __ _ _ _ __ //
2659  // | |_| |/ _` / __| '_ \ | |/ _` | '_ \| |/ _ \ | | | |/ _ \/ _` | '_ \| | | | '_ \ //
2660  // | _ | (_| \__ \ | | | | | (_| | |_) | | __/ | |___| | __/ (_| | | | | |_| | |_) | //
2661  // |_| |_|\__,_|___/_| |_| |_|\__,_|_.__/|_|\___| \____|_|\___|\__,_|_| |_|\__,_| .__/ //
2662  // |_| //
2664 
2665  // NOW, I have to 'zero out' or mark the entry 'unused'. To do this I
2666  // have to define what an unused window ID is ('WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED').
2667  // (this MUST happen or the hash table won't work)
2668  // there are a couple of cases where deleting an entry might break a 'chain'
2669  // As a result I need to ensure that I make use of 'unused' markers and only
2670  // remove them when the final entry in the chain is followed by a 'NULL'.
2671  //
2672  // Preceding entries that aren't 'NULL' indicate I am part of a 'chain' and
2673  // so I can't mark it 'NULL' if this entry isn't the last entry in the 'chain'
2674  // or the 'chain' breaks. Therefore it will be marked 'unused'.
2675 
2676  iPrev = (iIndex - 1) & WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX;
2677  iNext = (iIndex + 1) & WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX;
2678 
2679  if(!sWBHashEntries[iNext].wID) // next isn't NULL so I'm the end of the chain
2680  {
2681  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wID = 0; // it's safe to do this now
2682 
2683  for(iIndex=iPrev; iIndex != iNext && sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wID == WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED;
2684  iIndex = (iIndex - 1) & WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX) // roundie roundie
2685  {
2686  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wID = 0; // zero out back up the chain until I hit something that's not 'unused'
2687  }
2688  }
2689  else
2690  {
2691  if(!sWBHashEntries[iPrev].wID) // previous is NULL
2692  {
2693  // I'm not a chain. I can mark this zero
2694  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wID = 0; // just zero it out (the normal case)
2695  }
2696  else
2697  {
2698  sWBHashEntries[iIndex].wID = WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED; // mark this as "unused" but not the end of a chain
2699  }
2700  }
2701 
2702  nWBHashEntries--;
2703 }
2704 
2705 static void __PeriodicWindowEntryCleanup(void)
2706 {
2707 int i1;
2708 struct timeval tvNow;
2709 static struct timeval tvLastTime = {0,0};
2710 
2711  gettimeofday(&tvNow, NULL);
2712 
2713  if(tvNow.tv_sec == tvLastTime.tv_sec)
2714  {
2715  return; // so I don't do this too often - only once per second
2716  }
2717 
2718  tvLastTime.tv_sec = tvNow.tv_sec;
2719 
2720  tvNow.tv_sec -= WB_WINDOW_DELETE_TIMEOUT;
2721 
2722  // for each remaining window in my list, destroy it
2723  // TODO: a more intelligent way to do this. Currently it loops 2048 times
2724  // and this is NOT efficient. however, at 1Ghz, 2048 loops should easily
2725  // be less than 1 msec (maybe 10 to 20 cycles per loop on average).
2726  for(i1=WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX - 1; i1 >= 0; i1--)
2727  {
2728  Window wID = sWBHashEntries[i1].wID;
2729 
2730  if(!wID || wID == WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED)
2731  {
2732  continue;
2733  }
2734 
2735  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DELETE &&
2736  sWBHashEntries[i1].tvLastActivity.tv_sec < tvNow.tv_sec) // aged enough?
2737  {
2738  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
2739  "%s - destroying entry %d for window %u (%08xH)\n",
2740  __FUNCTION__, i1,
2741  (int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
2742 
2743 
2744 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - delete window entry %d for window %u (%08xH)\n",
2745 // __FUNCTION__, i1,
2746 // (int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID, (int)sWBHashEntries[i1].wID);
2747 
2748 // __WindowEntryRestoreDefaultResources(i1); // make sure no resources are allocated - actually next function does this already
2749  __WindowEntryDestructor(i1); // finalizes destruction and marks it 'unused'
2750  }
2751  }
2752 }
2753 
2754 Window WBCreateWindow(Display *pDisplay, Window wIDParent,
2755  WBWinEvent pProc, const char *szClass,
2756  int iX, int iY, int iWidth, int iHeight, int iBorder, int iIO,
2757  WB_UINT64 iFlags, XSetWindowAttributes *pXSWA)
2758 {
2759 Window idRval;
2760 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry;
2761 WB_GEOM geom;
2762 unsigned long valuemask;
2763 XSetWindowAttributes xswa;
2764 
2765 
2766  if(!pDisplay)
2767  {
2768  pDisplay = WBGetDefaultDisplay();
2769 
2770  if(!pDisplay) // in case the library wasn't initialized
2771  {
2772  return None;
2773  }
2774  }
2775 
2776 // POOBAH
2777 #ifdef HAS_WB_UINT64_BUILTIN
2778  valuemask = (unsigned long)(iFlags & 0xffffffffL);
2779 #else // HAS_WB_UINT64_BUILTIN
2780  valuemask = iFlags.dw2; // assume low endian (for now)
2781 #endif // HAS_WB_UINT64_BUILTIN
2782 
2783  if(!valuemask)
2784  {
2785  valuemask = CWBorderPixel | CWBackPixel | CWColormap | CWBitGravity; // for now...
2786  if(!pXSWA)
2787  {
2788  pXSWA = &xswa;
2789 
2790  WBInitWindowAttributes(&xswa,
2791  BlackPixel(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)),
2792  WhitePixel(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)),
2793  DefaultColormap(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)),
2794  CenterGravity);
2795  }
2796  }
2797 
2798  idRval = XCreateWindow(pDisplay,
2799  wIDParent != None ? wIDParent : DefaultRootWindow(pDisplay),
2800  iX, iY, iWidth, iHeight, iBorder,
2801  DefaultDepth(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)),
2802  iIO,
2803  DefaultVisual(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)),
2804  valuemask,
2805  pXSWA);
2806 
2807  if(idRval != None)
2808  {
2809  WBRegisterWindowCallback(idRval, pProc); // this must happen first (it creates the internal structures)
2810  WBSetWindowClassName(idRval, szClass);
2811 
2812  if(wIDParent != None)
2813  {
2814  WBSetParentWindow(idRval, wIDParent); // assign the cached copy of the window's parent
2815  }
2816 
2817  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(idRval);
2818 
2819  if(!pEntry)
2820  {
2821  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - unable to get window entry (window still created)\n", __FUNCTION__);
2822  }
2823  else
2824  {
2825  pEntry->iFlags = iFlags; // cache it
2826  pEntry->pDisplay = pDisplay; // make sure
2827 
2828  if(!pEntry->pWMHints) // normally THIS WILL BE THE CASE
2829  {
2830  // if no window hints were configured, set some up
2831 
2832  if(!__internal_alloc_WMHints(pEntry))
2833  {
2834  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2835  XSetWMHints(pDisplay, idRval, pEntry->pWMHints);
2836  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2837  }
2838  }
2839 
2840  geom.x = 0; // client area always begins at 0,0
2841  geom.y = 0;
2842  geom.width = iWidth;
2843  geom.height = iHeight;
2844  geom.border = iBorder;
2845 
2846  WBInvalidateGeom(idRval, &geom, 0); // invalidate but don't paint yet
2847  }
2848  }
2849 
2850  return idRval;
2851 }
2852 
2853 void WBSetWMProperties(Window wID, const char *szTitle, XSizeHints *pNormalHints,
2854  XWMHints *pWMHints, XClassHint *pClassHints)
2855 {
2856 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
2857 Display *pDisplay = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
2858 XTextProperty xTextProp;
2859 // XSetStandardProperties(pDisplay, pNew->wbFW.wID, szTitle, szTitle, None,
2860 // NULL, 0, NULL); // argv, argc, &xsh);
2861 // // this has been superseded by XSetWMProperties() and should not be used any more
2862 
2863 // typedef struct {
2864 // unsigned char *value;/* property data */
2865 // Atom encoding; /* type of property */
2866 // int format; /* 8, 16, or 32 */
2867 // unsigned long nitems;/* number of items in value */
2868 // } XTextProperty;
2869 
2870  if(szTitle)
2871  {
2872  xTextProp.value = (void *)szTitle;
2873  xTextProp.encoding = XA_STRING;
2874  xTextProp.format = 8; // 8-bit bytes in this one
2875  xTextProp.nitems = strlen(szTitle);
2876  }
2877 
2878  if(pWMHints)
2879  {
2880  if(!pEntry->pWMHints)
2881  {
2882  // if no window hints were configured, set some up
2883 
2884  if(__internal_alloc_WMHints(pEntry))
2885  {
2886  // TODO: error??
2887  }
2888  }
2889 
2890  if(pEntry->pWMHints)
2891  {
2892  // combine the hints!
2893 
2894  if(pWMHints->flags & InputHint)
2895  {
2896  pEntry->pWMHints->input = pWMHints->input;
2897  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= InputHint;
2898  }
2899 
2900  if(pWMHints->flags & StateHint)
2901  {
2902  pEntry->pWMHints->initial_state = pWMHints->initial_state;
2903  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= StateHint;
2904  }
2905 
2906  if(pWMHints->flags & IconPixmapHint)
2907  {
2908  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2909  if(pEntry->pxIcon != None)
2910  {
2911  XFreePixmap(pDisplay, pEntry->pxIcon);
2912 // pEntry->pxIcon = None;
2913  }
2914  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2915 
2916  pEntry->pxIcon = pWMHints->icon_pixmap;
2917  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_pixmap = pWMHints->icon_pixmap;
2918  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconPixmapHint;
2919  }
2920  else if(pEntry->pxIcon != None &&
2921  (!(pEntry->pWMHints->flags & IconPixmapHint) || pEntry->pWMHints->icon_pixmap == None))
2922  {
2923  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_pixmap = pEntry->pxIcon;
2924  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconPixmapHint;
2925  }
2926 
2927  if(pWMHints->flags & IconMaskHint)
2928  {
2929  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2930  if(pEntry->pxMask != None) // this is where I keep track of it
2931  {
2932  XFreePixmap(pDisplay, pEntry->pxMask);
2933 // pEntry->pxMask = None;
2934  }
2935  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2936 
2937  pEntry->pxMask = pWMHints->icon_mask;
2938  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_mask = pWMHints->icon_mask;
2939  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconMaskHint;
2940  }
2941  else if(pEntry->pxMask != None &&
2942  (!(pEntry->pWMHints->flags & IconMaskHint) || pEntry->pWMHints->icon_mask == None))
2943  {
2944  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_mask = pEntry->pxMask;
2945  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconMaskHint;
2946  }
2947 
2948  if(pWMHints->flags & IconWindowHint)
2949  {
2950  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_window = pWMHints->icon_window;
2951  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconWindowHint;
2952  }
2953 
2954  if(pWMHints->flags & IconPositionHint)
2955  {
2956  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_x = pWMHints->icon_x;
2957  pEntry->pWMHints->icon_y = pWMHints->icon_y;
2958  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= IconPositionHint;
2959  }
2960 
2961  if(pWMHints->flags & WindowGroupHint)
2962  {
2963  pEntry->pWMHints->window_group = pWMHints->window_group;
2964  pEntry->pWMHints->flags |= WindowGroupHint;
2965  }
2966  }
2967  }
2968 
2969  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2970  if(szTitle)
2971  {
2972  XSetWMProperties(pDisplay, wID, &xTextProp, &xTextProp, NULL, 0,
2973  pNormalHints,
2974  pEntry->pWMHints ? pEntry->pWMHints : pWMHints,
2975  pClassHints);
2976  }
2977  else
2978  {
2979  XSetWMProperties(pDisplay, wID, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0,
2980  pNormalHints,
2981  pEntry->pWMHints ? pEntry->pWMHints : pWMHints,
2982  pClassHints);
2983  }
2984  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2985 
2986  if(pWMHints)
2987  {
2988  if(pEntry->pWMHints)
2989  {
2990  XFree(pEntry->pWMHints);
2991  }
2992 
2993  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2994  pEntry->pWMHints = XGetWMHints(pDisplay, wID);
2995  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
2996  }
2997 
2998 // void XSetWMProperties(Display *display, Window w,
2999 // XTextProperty *window_name, XTextProperty *icon_name,
3000 // char **argv, int argc,
3001 // XSizeHints *normal_hints, XWMHints *wm_hints,
3002 // XClassHint *class_hints);
3003 }
3004 
3005 void WBSetWindowTitle(Window wID, const char *szTitle)
3006 {
3007 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
3008 Display *pDisplay = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
3009 Atom a1, a2;
3010 
3011 
3012  a1 = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WM_NAME", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
3013  a2 = XInternAtom(pDisplay, "WM_ICON_NAME", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
3014 
3015  if(a1 != None)
3016  {
3017  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3018  XChangeProperty(pDisplay, wID, a1, XA_STRING, 8, PropModeReplace, (unsigned char *)szTitle, strlen(szTitle));
3019  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3020  }
3021 
3022  if(a2 != None)
3023  {
3024  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3025  XChangeProperty(pDisplay, wID, a2, XA_STRING, 8, PropModeReplace, (unsigned char *)szTitle, strlen(szTitle));
3026  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3027  }
3028 }
3029 
3030 void WBRegisterWindowCallback(Window wID, WBWinEvent pCallback)
3031 {
3032 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = __AddOrLocateEntry(wID);
3033 
3034  if(pEntry)
3035  {
3036  int bNewEntry = 0;
3037 
3038  if(!pEntry->pCallback)
3039  {
3040  bNewEntry = 1;
3041  }
3042 
3043  pEntry->pCallback = pCallback;
3044 
3045  if(bNewEntry)
3046  {
3047  WBRestoreDefaultCursor(wID); // assign the default cursor if this is a new entry
3048  }
3049  }
3050 }
3051 
3052 void WBUnregisterWindowCallback(Window wID)
3053 {
3054  int i1, /*iPrev, iNext,*/ iStart;
3055 
3056  if(wID == wIDApplication)
3057  {
3058  wIDApplication = None; // application window being unregistered
3059  }
3060 
3061  if(!nWBHashEntries)
3062  {
3063  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
3064  "%s - nWBHashEntries == NULL\n", __FUNCTION__);
3065  return;
3066  }
3067 
3068  i1 = iStart = WINDOW_ENTRY_HASH(wID);
3069 
3070  while(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID) // the array must be pre-assigned to zero for this to work properly
3071  {
3072  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == wID)
3073  break;
3074 
3075  i1++;
3076  i1 &= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX;
3077 
3078  if(i1 == iStart)
3079  {
3080  i1 = -1; // as a flag that I didn't find it
3081  break;
3082  }
3083  }
3084 
3085  // free resources, mark the 'last activity' time, and
3086  // mark this entry as "to be destroyed"
3087 
3088  // NOTE: used to NOT actually change the callback address (TODO: change name of function?)
3089  // but in this case I'm going to NULL it. I don't want window callbacks being called
3090 
3091  if(i1 >= 0 && sWBHashEntries[i1].wID == wID) // guarantees I have the right one
3092  {
3093  // look through all of the timers and unregister any that involve this window
3094  // this is to avoid certain problems where windows aren't being notified properly
3095 
3096  DeletAllTimersForWindow(sWBHashEntries[i1].pDisplay, wID);
3097 
3098  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].iWindowState != WB_WINDOW_DELETE)
3099  {
3100  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window,
3101  "Entry %d for window %d (%08xH) marked as 'to be destroyed'\n",
3102  i1, (int)wID, (int)wID);
3103 
3104 // __WindowEntryDestructor(i1);
3105  __WindowEntryRestoreDefaultResources(i1); // make sure no resources are allocated
3106 
3107  gettimeofday(&(sWBHashEntries[i1].tvLastActivity), NULL);
3108 
3109  sWBHashEntries[i1].iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DELETE;
3110  }
3111 
3112  sWBHashEntries[i1].pCallback = NULL; // no more callback function. 'DestroyNotify' may still happen.
