3113  // for 'DestroyNotify' events following this, WBDispatch will deal with that.
3114  }
3115 
3116 }
3117 
3118 // this one is ONLY called before mapping the window
3119 void WBSetWMPropertiesWindowType(Window wID, enum WMPropertiesWindowType wmProp)
3120 {
3121 
3122  // TODO: implement this
3123  // see _NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE and _NET_WM_STATE atom documentation, wm-spec-latest.html
3124 
3125 }
3126 
3127 // this one is called AFTER mapping the window. The 'root' window
3128 // will have to be notified of the changes being made.
3129 void WBChangeWMPropertiesWindowType(Window wID, enum WMPropertiesWindowType wmProp, enum WMPropertiesWindowType wmChangeMask)
3130 {
3131 
3132  // TODO: implement this
3133  // see _NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE and _NET_WM_STATE atom documentation, wm-spec-latest.html
3134 
3135 }
3136 
3137 enum WMPropertiesWindowType WBGetWMPropertiesWindowType(Window wID)
3138 {
3139 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
3140 
3141 
3142  if(!pEntry)
3143  {
3144  return WMPropertiesWindowType_Normal;
3145  }
3146 
3147  return pEntry->eWindowType;
3148 }
3149 
3150 // this is a MUCH nicer way of handling variable length lists of WM_PROTOCOL atoms, as far as
3151 // the code's appearance goes. A bit of extra work, but you don't do this very often
3152 void WBSetWMProtocols(Window wID, Atom aProperty, ...)
3153 {
3154 va_list va, va2;
3155 Atom *pTemp, aArg;
3156 int i1, nItems;
3157 Display *pDisplay;
3158 Atom aTemp[32]; // temp storage, in case I need "something"
3159 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
3160 
3161 
3162  pTemp = aTemp;
3163 
3164  pDisplay = WBGetWindowDisplay(wID);
3165 
3166  if(!pDisplay)
3167  {
3168  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - no Display pointer\n", __FUNCTION__);
3169  return;
3170  }
3171 
3172  if(aProperty == None)
3173  {
3174  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - removing WM PROTOCOLS atom list\n", __FUNCTION__);
3175 
3176  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3177  XSetWMProtocols(pDisplay, wID, pTemp, 0);
3178  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3179 
3180  return;
3181  }
3182 
3183  va_start(va, aProperty);
3184 
3185  // copy the va_list so I can count items and possibly allocate memory
3186  va_copy(va2, va);
3187  nItems = 1; // always at least one if the first isn't "None"
3188 
3189  while(1)
3190  {
3191  aArg = va_arg(va2, Atom);
3192 
3193  if(aArg == None)
3194  {
3195  break;
3196  }
3197 
3198  nItems++;
3199  }
3200 
3201  va_end(va2); // cleanup
3202 
3203  // using the # of items I count here, determine if my array size is sufficient
3204  // and WBAlloc() a bigger one if needed. or not.
3205 
3206  if(nItems >= sizeof(aTemp)/sizeof(aTemp[0]))
3207  {
3208  pTemp = (Atom *)WBAlloc((nItems + 1) * sizeof(Atom));
3209 
3210  if(!pTemp)
3211  {
3212  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - not enough memory for atom list, errno=%d (%xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, errno, errno);
3213  return;
3214  }
3215  }
3216 
3217  pTemp[0] = aProperty;
3218 
3219  for(i1=1; i1 < nItems; i1++)
3220  {
3221  aArg = va_arg(va, Atom);
3222 
3223  // TODO: debug, check value?
3224 
3225  pTemp[i1] = aArg;
3226  }
3227 
3228  pTemp[nItems] = None; // end with 'none'
3229 
3230  va_end(va); // cleanup
3231 
3232  // next, scan the list for properties that require special flags
3233 
3234  if(pEntry) // only if I have a window entry
3235  {
3236  pEntry->eWMProtocols &= ~WMPropertiesWMProtocols_Mask;
3237 
3238  for(i1=0; i1 < nItems; i1++)
3239  {
3240  if(pTemp[i1] == aWM_DELETE_WINDOW) // this window supports WM_DELETE
3241  {
3242  pEntry->eWMProtocols |= WMPropertiesWMProtocols_DeleteWindow;
3243  }
3244 
3245  // TODO, others
3246  }
3247  }
3248 
3249  // NOW, do the deed. and assign the atoms to WM_PROTOCOLS
3250 
3251  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3252  XSetWMProtocols(pDisplay, wID, pTemp, nItems);
3253  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3254 
3255 
3256  if(pTemp != aTemp) // if I allocated the buffer
3257  {
3258  WBFree(pTemp);
3259  }
3260 
3261 }
3262 
3263 
3264 Window WBLocateWindow(WBLocateWindowCallback callback, void *pData)
3265 {
3266 int i1, i2;
3267 
3268  if(!callback)
3269  {
3270  return (Window)0;
3271  }
3272 
3273  for(i1=0; i1 <= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX; i1++)
3274  {
3275  Window wID = sWBHashEntries[i1].wID;
3276  if(wID && wID != WINDOW_ENTRY_UNUSED)
3277  {
3278  i2 = callback(wID, pData);
3279  if(i2 > 0)
3280  {
3281  return wID;
3282  }
3283  else if(i2 < 0)
3284  {
3285  return 0;
3286  }
3287  }
3288  }
3289 
3290  return 0;
3291 }
3292 
3293 
3294 // locate and return the application window. there can be only one.
3295 
3296 Window WBGetApplicationWindow(void)
3297 {
3298  return wIDApplication;
3299 }
3300 
3301 void WBSetApplicationWindow(Window wID)
3302 {
3303 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry;
3304 
3305  if(wID == None)
3306  {
3307  wIDApplication = None;
3308  }
3309  else
3310  {
3311  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
3312 
3313  if(!pEntry)
3314  {
3315  wIDApplication = None;
3316  }
3317  else
3318  {
3319  wIDApplication = wID;
3320  }
3321  }
3322 }
3323 
3324 
3325 /**********************************************************************/
3326 /* */
3327 /* periodic timer and delayed event helper functions */
3328 /* */
3329 /**********************************************************************/
3330 
3331 //#define TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE 512
3332 //
3333 //static struct __TIMER_ENTRY__
3334 //{
3335 // struct __TIMER_ENTRY__ *pNext; // linked lists for performance
3336 // unsigned long long lTimeIndex; // time index for which this timer next expires
3337 // unsigned long lTimeInterval; // interval (or zero for one-shot timer)
3338 //
3339 // Display *pDisplay; // display associated with timer
3340 // Window wID; // window to receive timer event
3341 // long lID; // timer identifier
3342 //} TIMER_ENTRY;
3343 //
3344 //static TIMER_ENTRY axWBTimer[TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE];
3345 //static TIMER_ENTRY *pTimerEntryActive = NULL, *pTimerEntryFree = NULL;
3346 // // pointers for two linked lists. entries must be in either 'active' or 'free' list.
3347 
3348 int CreateTimer(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, unsigned long lInterval, long lID, int iPeriodic)
3349 {
3350 int i1;
3351 TIMER_ENTRY *pCur;
3352 // if timer linked lists aren't set up yet, do that now
3353 
3354 
3355  if(!pTimerEntryActive && !pTimerEntryFree) // initial state
3356  {
3357  bzero(axWBTimer, sizeof(axWBTimer));
3358 
3359  for(i1=1; i1 < TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE; i1++)
3360  {
3361  axWBTimer[i1 - 1].pNext = axWBTimer + i1; // build linked list
3362  }
3363 
3364  pTimerEntryFree = axWBTimer;
3365  }
3366 
3367  // search for match, return -2 if found
3368  pCur = pTimerEntryActive;
3369  while(pCur)
3370  {
3371  if(pCur->pDisplay == pDisplay &&
3372  pCur->wID == wID &&
3373  pCur->lID == lID)
3374  {
3375  return -2;
3376  }
3377 
3378  pCur = pCur->pNext;
3379  }
3380 
3381  if(!pTimerEntryFree)
3382  {
3383  return -1; // no memory
3384  }
3385 
3386  pCur = pTimerEntryFree;
3387  pTimerEntryFree = pTimerEntryFree->pNext;
3388 // pCur->pNext = NULL; // TODO in case I have to add locking later
3389 
3390  pCur->pDisplay = pDisplay;
3391  pCur->wID = wID;
3392  pCur->lID = lID;
3393 
3394  pCur->lTimeIndex = WBGetTimeIndex() + lInterval;
3395  if(iPeriodic)
3396  {
3397  pCur->lTimeInterval = lInterval;
3398  }
3399  else
3400  {
3401  pCur->lTimeInterval = 0;
3402  }
3403 
3404  pCur->pNext = pTimerEntryActive; // goes at the beginning of the list (it's easier)
3405  pTimerEntryActive = pCur;
3406 
3407  return 0;
3408 }
3409 
3410 static void __DeleteTimer(TIMER_ENTRY *pPrev, TIMER_ENTRY *pEntry)
3411 {
3412  pEntry->lTimeIndex = pEntry->lTimeInterval = 0;
3413  pEntry->pDisplay = NULL;
3414  pEntry->wID = 0;
3415  pEntry->lID = 0;
3416 
3417  if(!pPrev) // assume head of linked list
3418  {
3419  if(pTimerEntryActive != pEntry) // sanity checks
3420  {
3421  // a leak is better than a crash
3422  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - (1) unable to properly delete timer due to pointer inconsistency %p %p %p\n",
3423  __FUNCTION__, pTimerEntryActive, pEntry, pEntry->pNext);
3424  }
3425  else
3426  {
3427  pTimerEntryActive = pEntry->pNext;
3428  pEntry->pNext = pTimerEntryFree;
3429  pTimerEntryFree = pEntry;
3430  }
3431  }
3432  else if(pPrev->pNext == pEntry) // more sanity checks
3433  {
3434  pPrev->pNext = pEntry->pNext;
3435  pEntry->pNext = pTimerEntryFree;
3436  pTimerEntryFree = pEntry;
3437  }
3438  else
3439  {
3440  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - (2) unable to properly delete timer due to pointer inconsistency %p %p %p %p\n",
3441  __FUNCTION__, pPrev, pPrev->pNext, pEntry, pEntry->pNext);
3442  }
3443 }
3444 
3445 void DeleteTimer(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, long lID)
3446 {
3447 TIMER_ENTRY *pCur, *pPrev;
3448 
3449  pCur = pTimerEntryActive;
3450  pPrev = NULL;
3451 
3452  while(pCur)
3453  {
3454  if(pCur->pDisplay == pDisplay &&
3455  pCur->wID == wID &&
3456  pCur->lID == lID)
3457  {
3458  __DeleteTimer(pPrev, pCur);
3459  return;
3460  }
3461 
3462  pPrev = pCur;
3463  pCur = pCur->pNext;
3464  }
3465 }
3466 
3467 static void DeletAllTimersForWindow(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
3468 {
3469 TIMER_ENTRY *pCur, *pPrev, *pNext;
3470 
3471  pCur = pTimerEntryActive;
3472  pPrev = NULL;
3473 
3474  while(pCur)
3475  {
3476  if(pCur->pDisplay == pDisplay &&
3477  pCur->wID == wID)
3478  {
3479  pNext = pCur->pNext;
3480 
3481  __DeleteTimer(pPrev, pCur);
3482 
3483  pCur = pNext; // must do it THIS way if I remove the entry in between
3484  // note: 'pPrev' doesn't change, but 'pNext' does (pPrev->pNext should equal pCur now)
3485  }
3486  else
3487  {
3488  pPrev = pCur;
3489  pCur = pCur->pNext;
3490  }
3491  }
3492 }
3493 
3494 static int __CheckTimers(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent)
3495 {
3496 TIMER_ENTRY *pCur, *pPrev;
3497 WB_UINT64 lTime = WBGetTimeIndex();
3498 
3499 // Find the _NEXT_ registered timer for which the current time 'crosses'
3500 
3501  pCur = pTimerEntryActive;
3502  pPrev = NULL;
3503 
3504  while(pCur)
3505  {
3506  if(pCur->pDisplay == pDisplay &&
3507  lTime >= pCur->lTimeIndex) // time index has crossed "the threshold" for the timer
3508  {
3509  if(!pEvent)
3510  {
3511  return 1; // only indicate that I found a timer that's active (don't process it)
3512  }
3513 
3514  if(pCur->lTimeInterval)
3515  {
3516  pCur->lTimeIndex += pCur->lTimeInterval;
3517 
3518  if(lTime >= pCur->lTimeIndex) // to prevent 'spinning'
3519  {
3520  pCur->lTimeIndex = lTime + pCur->lTimeInterval;
3521  }
3522  }
3523  else
3524  {
3525  __DeleteTimer(pPrev, pCur);
3526  }
3527 
3528  // now fill out the event structure pointed to by 'pEvent'
3529  bzero(pEvent, sizeof(*pEvent));
3530 
3531  pEvent->xclient.type = ClientMessage;
3532  pEvent->xclient.serial = 0;
3533  pEvent->xclient.send_event = 0;
3534  pEvent->xclient.display = pDisplay;
3535  pEvent->xclient.window = pCur->wID;
3536  pEvent->xclient.message_type = aWB_TIMER;
3537  pEvent->xclient.format=32; // 32-bit integers
3538  pEvent->xclient.data.l[0] = pCur->lID;
3539 
3540  return 1; // found/processed a timer
3541  }
3542 
3543  pPrev = pCur;
3544  pCur = pCur->pNext;
3545  }
3546 
3547  return 0; // no timer found/processed
3548 }
3549 
3550 static void __CreateDelayedEvent(XEvent *pEvent, unsigned int uiInterval)
3551 {
3552 int i1;
3553 DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY *pCur;
3554 // if timer linked lists aren't set up yet, do that now
3555 
3556 
3557  if(!pDelayedEventEntryActive && !pDelayedEventEntryFree) // initial state
3558  {
3559  bzero(axWBDelayedEvent, sizeof(axWBDelayedEvent));
3560 
3561  for(i1=1; i1 < TIMER_ARRAY_SIZE; i1++)
3562  {
3563  axWBDelayedEvent[i1 - 1].pNext = axWBDelayedEvent + i1; // build linked list
3564  }
3565 
3566  pDelayedEventEntryFree = axWBDelayedEvent;
3567  }
3568 
3569  // search for match, return -2 if found
3570  pCur = pDelayedEventEntryFree;
3571  pDelayedEventEntryFree = pDelayedEventEntryFree->pNext;
3572 // pCur->pNext = NULL; // TODO in case I have to add locking later
3573 
3574  memcpy(&(pCur->event), pEvent, sizeof(pCur->event));
3575 
3576  pCur->lTimeIndex = WBGetTimeIndex() + uiInterval;
3577 
3578  pCur->pNext = pDelayedEventEntryActive; // goes at the beginning of the list (it's easier)
3579  pDelayedEventEntryActive = pCur;
3580 }
3581 
3582 static void __DeleteDelayedEvent(DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY *pPrev, DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY *pEntry)
3583 {
3584  pEntry->lTimeIndex = 0;
3585  bzero(&(pEntry->event), sizeof(pEntry->event));
3586 
3587  if(!pPrev) // assume head of linked list
3588  {
3589  if(pDelayedEventEntryActive != pEntry) // sanity checks
3590  {
3591  // a leak is better than a crash
3592  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - (1) unable to properly delete delayed event due to pointer inconsistency %p %p %p\n",
3593  __FUNCTION__, pTimerEntryActive, pEntry, pEntry->pNext);
3594  }
3595  else
3596  {
3597  pDelayedEventEntryActive = pEntry->pNext;
3598  pEntry->pNext = pDelayedEventEntryFree;
3599  pDelayedEventEntryFree = pEntry;
3600  }
3601  }
3602  else if(pPrev->pNext == pEntry) // more sanity checks
3603  {
3604  pPrev->pNext = pEntry->pNext;
3605  pEntry->pNext = pDelayedEventEntryFree;
3606  pDelayedEventEntryFree = pEntry;
3607  }
3608  else
3609  {
3610  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - (2) unable to properly delete delayed event due to pointer inconsistency %p %p %p %p\n",
3611  __FUNCTION__, pPrev, pPrev->pNext, pEntry, pEntry->pNext);
3612  }
3613 }
3614 
3615 static int __attribute__((noinline)) __CheckDelayedEvents(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent)
3616 {
3617 DELAYED_EVENT_ENTRY *pCur, *pPrev;
3618 WB_UINT64 lTime = WBGetTimeIndex();
3619 
3620  // Find the _NEXT_ registered delayed event for which the current time 'crosses'
3621 
3622  pCur = pDelayedEventEntryActive;
3623  pPrev = NULL;
3624 
3625  while(pCur)
3626  {
3627  if((pCur->event.xany.display == pDisplay || pCur->event.xany.window == None) &&
3628  lTime >= pCur->lTimeIndex)
3629  {
3630  // fill out the event structure pointed to by 'pEvent'
3631 
3632  if(pCur->event.xany.window != None)
3633  {
3634  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(pCur->event.xany.window);
3635 
3636  if(!pEntry || WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
3637  {
3638  __DeleteDelayedEvent(pPrev, pCur);
3639  return 0; // none processed [code is easier this way]
3640  }
3641  }
3642 
3643  if(pEvent) // if NULL, I'm only looking to see if there IS one
3644  {
3645  memcpy(pEvent, &(pCur->event), sizeof(*pEvent));
3646 
3647  __DeleteDelayedEvent(pPrev, pCur);
3648  }
3649 
3650  return 1; // processed
3651  }
3652 
3653  pPrev = pCur;
3654  pCur = pCur->pNext;
3655  }
3656 
3657  return 0; // no timer processed
3658 }
3659 
3660 
3661 
3662 /**********************************************************************/
3663 /* */
3664 /* message loop helper functions */
3665 /* */
3666 /**********************************************************************/
3667 
3668 static Bool __WBCheckIfEventPredicate(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent, XPointer arg)
3669 {
3670  if(pEvent && pEvent->type != Expose)
3671  {
3672  return TRUE;
3673  }
3674  else
3675  {
3676  return FALSE;
3677  }
3678 }
3679 
3680 static Bool __WBCheckIfEventPredicate0(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent, XPointer arg)
3681 {
3682  if(pEvent &&
3683  (pEvent->type == SelectionNotify ||
3684  pEvent->type == SelectionClear ||
3685  pEvent->type == SelectionRequest))
3686  {
3687  return TRUE;
3688  }
3689  else
3690  {
3691  return FALSE;
3692  }
3693 }
3694 
3695 // WBCheckGetEvent - get next (prioritized) event, do translations
3696 
3697 static int iMouseState = 0; // artificial mouse state (global) for dbl-click and drag
3698 static int iMouseModShiftCtrl = 0; // Mod/Shift/Ctrl state for last mouse state
3699 static int iMouseDragButtonState = 0; // mouse button bit-flags for last mouse state and auto-drag-cancel
3700 static WB_UINT64 tmMouse; // timeval for most recent processed mouse event
3701 static Window wMouseCapture = None;
3702 static int iMouseX = 0, iMouseY = 0; // RAW x,y position from mouse message
3703 
3704 
3705 enum
3706 {
3707  MouseState_NONE = 0,
3708  MouseState_LCLICK = 1,
3709  MouseState_WAS_LCLICK,
3710  MouseState_LDRAG, // 'drag' states imply mouse captured
3711  MouseState_RCLICK,
3712  MouseState_WAS_RCLICK,
3713  MouseState_RDRAG,
3714  MouseState_CCLICK,
3715  MouseState_WAS_CCLICK,
3716  MouseState_CDRAG
3717 };
3718 
3719 Time WBGetLastEventTime(void)
3720 {
3721 WB_UINT64 qwTick = WBGetTimeIndex();
3722 
3723  return tmDefaultDisplay + (qwTick - qwDefaultDisplayTick) / 1000;
3724 }
3725 
3726 int WBCheckGetEvent(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent)
3727 {
3728  return __InternalCheckGetEvent(pDisplay, pEvent, None); // no modal window implies "do certain things differently"
3729 }
3730 
3731 void WBWaitForEvent(Display *pDisplay)
3732 {
3733 int iTemp, iSleepPeriod;
3734 
3735  // First, see if I have any priority or other queued events
3736 
3737  iTemp = iWBQueuedEvent;
3738 
3739  // check internal queues first, if there's something there
3740  // these queues won't change without calling WBCheckGetEvent()
3741 
3742  iSleepPeriod = MIN_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD; // the initial value
3743 
3744  while(WB_LIKELY(iTemp >= 0))
3745  {
3746  if(WB_LIKELY(axWBEvt[iTemp].pDisplay == pDisplay))
3747  {
3748  return; // found one
3749  }
3750 
3751  iTemp = axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext;
3752  }
3753 
3754  iTemp = iWBPaintEvent;
3755 
3756  while(iTemp >= 0)
3757  {
3758  if(WB_LIKELY(axWBEvt[iTemp].pDisplay == pDisplay))
3759  {
3760  return; // found one
3761  }
3762 
3763  iTemp = axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext;
3764  }
3765 
3766  while(!bQuitFlag) // forever, unless I quit
3767  {
3768  // check timers and internal event queues
3769 
3770  if(__CheckTimers(pDisplay, NULL)) // a timer is ready to create an event?
3771  {
3772  return;
3773  }
3774 
3775  if(__CheckDelayedEvents(pDisplay, NULL)) // delayed events
3776  {
3777  return;
3778  }
3779 
3780  if(XEventsQueued(pDisplay, QueuedAfterFlush)) // this appears to be the most efficient method to use
3781  {
3782  return; // I have events waiting!
3783  }
3784 
3785  // perform a variable delay, up to MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD, before checking again, so I don't 'spin'
3786  // we start with the min period, so we'll more effectively capture 'bunches' of events, which would be
3787  // typical for UI actions - this makes it appear 'snappier'. But when no events happen, the sleep period
3788  // will increase until it hits 'MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD', which should be tweeked accordingly to get
3789  // minimum CPU usage while "idling" (and yet still respond to important things).
3790 
3791  WBDelay(iSleepPeriod); // 100 microsecs (0.1 milliseconds) initially, grows over time
3792 
3793  if(iSleepPeriod < MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD) // up to 'MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD' microseconds
3794  {
3795  iSleepPeriod += (iSleepPeriod >> 2); // increase by 25%
3796  }
3797  else
3798  {
3799  iSleepPeriod = MAX_EVENT_LOOP_SLEEP_PERIOD; // the maximum
3800  }
3801  }
3802 }
3803 
3804 // "internal" version that allows me to do things different for modal loops
3805 // it prioritizes events based on what type they are, to make UI response 'snappier'
3806 
3807 int __InternalCheckGetEvent(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent, Window wIDModal)
3808 {
3809 int iRval = 0, iQueued;
3810 int iFirstTime = 1;
3811 //static unsigned long long ullLastTime = 0;
3812 
3813  do
3814  {
3815  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3816  if(iFirstTime)
3817  {
3818  iQueued = XEventsQueued(pDisplay, QueuedAfterFlush); // QueuedAfterFlush on the first pass
3819 
3820  iFirstTime = 0; // assign it here so I only do this code section once
3821  }
3822  else
3823  {
3824  iQueued = XEventsQueued(pDisplay, QueuedAlready); // see if events are queued already (first, no flushing)
3825  }
3826 
3827  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3828 
3829  // check for selection events first...
3830 
3831  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3832  iRval = iQueued && // SelectionNotify, SelectionClear, SelectionRequest
3833  XCheckIfEvent(pDisplay, pEvent, __WBCheckIfEventPredicate0, NULL);
3834  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3835 
3836  if(!iRval)
3837  {
3838  if(WB_UNLIKELY(0 != (iRval = __CheckDelayedEvents(pDisplay, pEvent)))) // delayed events first
3839  {
3840  break;
3841  }
3842 
3843  if(WB_UNLIKELY(0 != (iRval = __CheckTimers(pDisplay, pEvent)))) // then timers
3844  {
3845  break;
3846  }
3847 
3848  // then check for actual events in the X11 event queue
3849 
3850  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3851  iRval = iQueued /*XEventsQueued(pDisplay, QueuedAlready)*/ &&
3852  (XCheckIfEvent(pDisplay, pEvent, __WBCheckIfEventPredicate, NULL) ||
3853  XCheckMaskEvent(pDisplay, ExposureMask, pEvent));
3854  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3855  }
3856 
3857  if(iRval)
3858  {
3859  if(pDisplay == pDefaultDisplay) // for default display, grab the timestamp
3860  {
3861  Time tmEvent = 0;
3862 
3863  // for certain events I want to get the time of the event
3864  // and so I'll record that here
3865 
3866  switch(pEvent->type) // for the ones that have timestamps, I check for them
3867  {
3868  case KeyPress:
3869  case KeyRelease:
3870  tmEvent =((XKeyEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3871  break;
3872  case ButtonPress:
3873  case ButtonRelease:
3874  tmEvent =((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3875  break;
3876  case MotionNotify:
3877  tmEvent =((XMotionEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3878  break;
3879  case EnterNotify:
3880  case LeaveNotify:
3881  tmEvent =((XCrossingEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3882  break;
3883  case PropertyNotify:
3884  tmEvent =((XPropertyEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3885  break;
3886  case SelectionRequest:
3887  tmEvent =((XSelectionRequestEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3888  break;
3889  case SelectionClear:
3890  tmEvent =((XSelectionClearEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3891  break;
3892  case SelectionNotify:
3893  tmEvent =((XSelectionEvent *)pEvent)->time;
3894  break;
3895  }
3896 
3897  if(tmEvent > tmDefaultDisplay)
3898  {
3899  tmDefaultDisplay = tmEvent; // with the assumption that the millis here NEVER wrap around
3900  qwDefaultDisplayTick = WBGetTimeIndex(); // snap this too so I can adjust it
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  if(pEvent->type == Expose) // expose events get special handling
3905  {
3906  // EXPOSE EVENTS - some special handling
3907 
3908  WBProcessExposeEvent((XExposeEvent *)pEvent); // this consolidates incoming Expose events
3909 
3910  // after processing the expose event, use XSync to immediately sync back up
3911  // in case there are more events NOT received yet. Only for EXPOSE though.
3912 
3913  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3914  XFlush(pDisplay); // send the events to the server (asynchronously)
3915 // XSync(pDisplay, 0); // this way, I am waiting for the window painting to actually happen
3916  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
3917 
3918  iRval = 0;
3919  continue; // added - this might have been a bug...?
3920  }
3921  else if(pEvent->type == NoExpose) // pretend I never got this
3922  {
3923  iRval = 0;
3924  continue; // act like it wasn't even there - try again
3925  }
3926 
3927  // TODO: other events that might be part of the above list of events to grab first
3928 
3929  break;
3930  }
3931  else // no display events
3932  {
3933  // use XEventsQueued to see if I have events. Use 'QueueAfterFlush' which appears to be the
3934  // most efficient way of doing this.
3935 
3936  if(XEventsQueued(pDisplay, QueuedAfterFlush) > 0) // flushes and attempts to read more events into queue
3937  {
3938  continue; // more events were read in, so loop back to the beginning
3939  }
3940 
3941  // regular 'next event' processing
3942 
3943  iRval = WBNextEvent(pDisplay, pEvent); // get 'internal' queued events
3944 
3945  break; // regardless if an event is found I break out now
3946  }
3947 
3948  // this conveniently re-tries when I get an Expose event (to try and consolidate them)
3949 
3950 
3951  } while(1);
3952 
3953  if(iRval)
3954  {
3955  if(pEvent->type == ConfigureNotify)
3956  {
3957  WB_GEOM gm;
3958  Window wIDTemp;
3959  // NOTE: this could be done in WBWindowDispatch but the chance that
3960  // it might be missed demands it be handled at a lower level
3961 
3962  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(pEvent->xconfigure.window);
3963 
3964  if(pEntry) // notification needs to update internal 'absolute geometry' data
3965  {
3966  // NOTE: window will get at least one of these when it becomes visible
3967  // until then the values are initialized as zeros
3968 
3969  if(pEntry->geomAbsolute.width == 0 && // first time through, trust the message
3970  pEntry->geomAbsolute.height == 0)
3971  {
3972  pEntry->geomAbsolute.x = pEvent->xconfigure.x;
3973  pEntry->geomAbsolute.y = pEvent->xconfigure.y;
3974  pEntry->geomAbsolute.width = pEvent->xconfigure.width;
3975  pEntry->geomAbsolute.height = pEvent->xconfigure.height;
3976  pEntry->geomAbsolute.border = pEvent->xconfigure.border_width;
3977 
3978  // first time through, create clip region that's empty, and record the window's width/height info
3979  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
3980  {
3981  // NOTE: I must do it THIS way because the window isn't mapped yet.
3982 
3983  pEntry->width = pEvent->xconfigure.width;
3984  pEntry->height = pEvent->xconfigure.height;
3985  pEntry->border = pEvent->xconfigure.border_width;
3986 
3987  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion();
3988  }
3989 
3990  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
3991  {
3992  XRectangle xrct;
3993 
3994  xrct.x = 0;//(short)pEntry->x;
3995  xrct.y = 0;//(short)pEntry->y;
3996  xrct.width = (unsigned short)pEntry->width;
3997  xrct.height = (unsigned short)pEntry->height;
3998 
3999  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip); // clip region includes this, now
4000  }
4001  }
4002  else if(WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry)) // get values from parent window(s) and adjust absolute coords
4003  { // NOTE: this won't work if this OR the PARENT windows aren't mapped
4004  wIDTemp = pEvent->xconfigure.window;
4005  pEntry->geomAbsolute.x = pEntry->geomAbsolute.y = 0;
4006 
4007  while(wIDTemp)
4008  {
4009  WBGetWindowGeom(wIDTemp, &gm);
4010  pEntry->geomAbsolute.x += gm.x;
4011  pEntry->geomAbsolute.y += gm.y;
4012 
4013  if(wIDTemp == pEvent->xconfigure.window)
4014  {
4015  pEntry->geomAbsolute.width = gm.width;
4016  pEntry->geomAbsolute.height = gm.height;
4017  pEntry->geomAbsolute.border = gm.border;
4018  }
4019 
4020  wIDTemp = WBGetParentWindow(wIDTemp);
4021  }
4022  }
4023  else
4024  {
4025  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - subsequent ConfigureNotify and window is not yet mapped\n", __FUNCTION__);
4026  }
4027 
4028  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4029  "%s - update internal geometry %d (%08xH) %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
4030  __FUNCTION__,
4031  (int)pEvent->xconfigure.window, (int)pEvent->xconfigure.window,
4032  pEntry->geomAbsolute.x, pEntry->geomAbsolute.y,
4033  pEntry->geomAbsolute.width, pEntry->geomAbsolute.height);
4034  }
4035  }
4036 
4037  // MOUSE translations (double-click, drag help)
4038  // to use these, the client shouldn't handle the system mouse events
4039  // Additionally, behavior DIFFERS SIGNIFICANTLY when inside a modal loop
4040 
4041  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress ||
4042  pEvent->type == ButtonRelease ||
4043  pEvent->type == MotionNotify)
4044  {
4045  int iButton1 = (((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & Button1Mask)
4046  || ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->button == Button1;
4047  int iButton2 = (((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & Button2Mask)
4048  || ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->button == Button2;
4049  int iButton3 = (((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & Button3Mask)
4050  || ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->button == Button3;
4051  int iButton4 = (((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & Button4Mask)
4052  || ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->button == Button4;
4053  int iButton5 = (((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & Button5Mask)
4054  || ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->button == Button5;
4055 
4056  int iDragButtonState = (iButton1 ? 1 : 0) // mostly for dragging, but used in other places, too
4057  | (iButton2 ? 2 : 0)
4058  | (iButton3 ? 4 : 0);
4059 
4060  int iModShiftCtrl = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->state & (ShiftMask | LockMask | ControlMask | Mod1Mask
4061  | Mod2Mask | Mod3Mask | Mod4Mask | Mod5Mask);
4062  int iX, iY;
4063 
4064  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress &&
4065  (iMouseState == MouseState_NONE ||
4066  iMouseState == MouseState_WAS_LCLICK))
4067  {
4068  Window wIDCurrent = None;
4069  int iRevert = 0;
4070  Window wID0 = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window;
4071 
4072  // NOTE: if window does _NOT_ have input focus, make sure it gets the focus
4073  // and re-display it's container in front of other windows (as needed)
4074 
4075 
4076  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4077  XGetInputFocus(pDisplay, &wIDCurrent, &iRevert);
4078  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4079 
4080 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: mouse click %d, old window %d (%08xH), new window %d (%08xH)\n",
4081 // iMouseState, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wID0, (int)wID0);
4082 
4083  if(wIDCurrent != wID0 &&
4084  ( wIDModal == None || // ok if NOT in modal state
4085  WBIsChildWindow(wIDModal, wID0))) // window I'm switching focus to is child of modal loop owner
4086  {
4087 // WBSetInputFocus(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window);
4088  // TODO: replicate part of 'set focus' code as private function to avoid duplication?
4089 
4090 
4091  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pPrev = WBGetWindowEntry(wIDCurrent);
4092  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID0);
4093 
4094 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: mouse click %d, old window %d (%08xH), new window %d (%08xH)\n",
4095 // iMouseState, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wID0, (int)wID0);
4096 
4097  if(pPrev)
4098  {
4099  if(WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pPrev))
4100  {
4101  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4102  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) disabling focus change on map\n",
4103  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wIDCurrent, (int)wIDCurrent);
4104 
4105  pPrev->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED; // remove 'set focus' state
4106  }
4107  }
4108 
4109  // see if expose event has been done on this yet...
4110  if(WB_LIKELY(pEntry) && //WB_UNLIKELY(!pEntry->width && !pEntry->height && !pEntry->border))
4111  WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(*pEntry)))
4112  {
4113  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4114  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) not yet visible, enabling focus change on map\n",
4115  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID0, (int)wID0);
4116 
4117  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP;
4118  }
4119  else
4120  {
4121  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4122  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) calling XSetInputFocus\n",
4123  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID0, (int)wID0);
4124 
4125 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID0, (uint32_t)wID0);
4126 
4127  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4128  XSetInputFocus(pDisplay, wID0, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
4129  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4130  }
4131 
4132  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE; // if window focus changes, I don't want double clicking or dragging to happen
4133  }
4134 
4135  // TODO: bring top level window forward if not topmost already
4136  }
4137 
4138 
4139  // based on current state
4140  switch(iMouseState)
4141  {
4142  case MouseState_WAS_LCLICK:
4143 
4144  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress)
4145  {
4146  int iDblClickThresh = CHGetDoubleClickDistance(pDisplay);
4147  WB_UINT64 tmTemp = WBGetTimeIndex(); // snapshot the current time (microseconds)
4148 
4149  if(abs(iMouseX - ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x) >= iDblClickThresh || // too far
4150  abs(iMouseY - ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y) >= iDblClickThresh || // too far
4151  (tmTemp - tmMouse) > 1000 * CHGetDoubleClickTime(pDisplay)) // too slow
4152  {
4153  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE;
4154 
4155  // flow through to next section
4156  }
4157  else if(!iButton1 || iButton2 || iButton3)
4158  {
4159  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE;
4160 
4161  // flow through to next section
4162  }
4163  else
4164  {
4165  // post a double-click notification
4166 
4167  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4168  .type=ClientMessage,
4169  .serial=0,
4170  .send_event=0,
4171  .display=pDisplay,
4172  .window=((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window,
4173  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4174  .format=32
4175  };
4176 
4177  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_DBLCLICK;
4178  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState;
4179  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4180  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4181  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4182 
4183  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y,
4184  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4185 
4186  evt.data.l[3] = iX;
4187  evt.data.l[4] = iY;
4188 
4189  WBPostPriorityEvent(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4190 
4191  break;
4192  }
4193  }
4194  else if(pEvent->type == ButtonRelease)
4195  {
4196  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE;
4197 
4198  break;
4199  }
4200  else
4201  {
4202  // TODO: mouse motion is OK, but what about anything else?
4203 
4204  break;
4205  }
4206 
4207  // at this poitn the state has been re-assigned
4208 
4209  case MouseState_NONE: // base condition - no current activity
4210  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress)
4211  {
4212  // for now, post a 'CLICK' notification every time
4213 
4214  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4215  .type=ClientMessage,
4216  .serial=0,
4217  .send_event=0,
4218  .display=pDisplay,
4219  .window=((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window,
4220  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4221  .format=32
4222  };
4223 
4224  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_CLICK;
4225  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState
4226  | (iButton4 ? 8 : 0)
4227  | (iButton5 ? 16 : 0);
4228  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4229  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4230  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4231 
4232  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y,
4233  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4234 
4235  evt.data.l[3] = iX;
4236  evt.data.l[4] = iY;
4237 
4238  WBPostPriorityEvent(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4239 
4240 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: mouse click at %d %d for %d (%08xH) %d %d %d\n",
4241 // iX, iY, (int)((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (int)((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window,
4242 // iButton1, iButton2, iButton3);
4243 
4244  if(iButton1 && !iButton2 && !iButton3 && !iButton4 && !iButton5)
4245  {
4246  // left button - for now this is all I test for
4247  iMouseState = MouseState_LCLICK;
4248  iMouseModShiftCtrl = iModShiftCtrl;
4249 
4250  tmMouse = WBGetTimeIndex(); // snapshot the time (microseconds)
4251 
4252  iMouseX = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x;
4253  iMouseY = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y;
4254  }
4255  else if(iButton4 || iButton5)
4256  {
4257  // notify window of mouse wheel scrolling. iButton4 is "scroll up", iButton5 is "scroll down"
4258 
4259  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4260  .type=ClientMessage,
4261  .serial=0,
4262  .send_event=0,
4263  .display=pDisplay,
4264  .window=pEvent->xany.window,
4265  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4266  .format=32
4267  };
4268 
4269  if(iButton4)
4270  {
4271  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_SCROLLUP;
4272  }
4273  else
4274  {
4275  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_SCROLLDOWN;
4276  }
4277 
4278  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState
4279  | (iButton4 ? 8 : 0)
4280  | (iButton5 ? 16 : 0);
4281  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4282  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4283  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4284 
4285  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, iMouseX, iMouseY,
4286  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4287 
4288  evt.data.l[3] = iX; // TODO: should this be UN-TRANSLATED or SCREEN coordinates?
4289  evt.data.l[4] = iY; // should I indicate WHICH WINDOW this should be for?
4290 
4291  WBWindowDispatch(evt.window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4292  }
4293  }
4294  else if(pEvent->type == ButtonRelease)
4295  {
4296 // if(iButton1 || iButton2 || iButton3 || iButton4 || iButton5)
4297 // {
4298 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s button release, button state %d %d %d %d %d\n",
4299 // __FUNCTION__, iButton1, iButton2, iButton3, iButton4, iButton5);
4300 // }
4301  }
4302  else // if(pEvent->type == MotionNotify)
4303  {
4304 // if(iButton1 || iButton2 || iButton3 || iButton4 || iButton5)
4305 // {
4306 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s motion notify, button state %d %d %d %d %d\n",
4307 // __FUNCTION__, iButton1, iButton2, iButton3, iButton4, iButton5);
4308 // }
4309  }
4310 
4311  break;
4312 
4313  case MouseState_LCLICK:
4314 
4315  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress)
4316  {
4317  if(!iButton1 || iButton2 || iButton3)
4318  {
4319  // TODO: MCLICK and RCLICK?
4320  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE;
4321  }
4322  else
4323  {
4324  // TODO: is this a double-click?
4325  }
4326  }
4327  else if(pEvent->type == ButtonRelease)
4328  {
4329  iMouseState = MouseState_WAS_LCLICK;
4330  }
4331  else if(iMouseModShiftCtrl != iModShiftCtrl) // modifier state change
4332  {
4333  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE;
4334  }
4335  else
4336  {
4337  int iTemp, iDragThresh = CHGetDragThreshold(pDisplay);
4338 
4339  // DRAG DETECT (reserved)
4340 
4341  if(abs(iMouseX - ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x) >= iDragThresh ||
4342  abs(iMouseY - ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y) >= iDragThresh)
4343  {
4344  // check for entering drag state - window proc needs to respond correctly
4345 
4346  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4347  .type=ClientMessage,
4348  .serial=0,
4349  .send_event=0,
4350  .display=pDisplay,
4351  .window=pEvent->xany.window,
4352  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4353  .format=32
4354  };
4355 
4356  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_DRAG;
4357  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState
4358  | (iButton4 ? 8 : 0)
4359  | (iButton5 ? 16 : 0);
4360  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4361  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4362  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4363 
4364  iMouseDragButtonState = iDragButtonState;
4365 
4366  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, iMouseX, iMouseY,
4367  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4368 
4369  // NOTE: sending ORIGINAL 'click' mouse coordinates since the drag moves the mouse
4370  evt.data.l[3] = iX; // TODO: should this be UN-TRANSLATED or SCREEN coordinates?
4371  evt.data.l[4] = iY; // should I indicate WHICH WINDOW this should be for?
4372 
4373  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y,
4374  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4375 
4376  iTemp = WBWindowDispatch(evt.window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4377  if(iTemp == (int)evt.window) // must return window ID
4378  {
4379  iMouseState = MouseState_LDRAG;
4380 
4381  if(wMouseCapture == None)
4382  {
4383  XGrabPointer(pDisplay, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, 1,
4384  ButtonPressMask | ButtonReleaseMask | ButtonMotionMask | PointerMotionMask
4385  | EnterWindowMask | LeaveWindowMask,
4386  GrabModeAsync, // pointer mode
4387  GrabModeAsync, // keyboard mode
4388  None, None, CurrentTime);
4389 
4390  wMouseCapture = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window;
4391 
4392  // post a motion event to update pointer position
4393  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_MOVE;
4394  evt.data.l[3] = iX;
4395  evt.data.l[4] = iY;
4396 
4397  WBPostPriorityEvent(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4398 
4399  iMouseX = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x; // keep track of starting drag position
4400  iMouseY = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y;
4401 
4402 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse drag begins: %d %d,%d\n",
4403 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
4404 // iButton1, iMouseX, iMouseY);
4405  }
4406 // else
4407 // {
4408 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse drag, but already captured: %d %d,%d\n",
4409 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
4410 // iButton1, iMouseX, iMouseY);
4411 // }
4412  }
4413  else
4414  {
4415 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse drag NOT enabled. %08xH %08xH\n",
4416 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iTemp, (int)evt.window);
4417 
4418  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE; // TODO: check for drag support first
4419  }
4420  }
4421  }
4422 
4423  break;
4424 
4425  case MouseState_LDRAG:
4426  case MouseState_RDRAG:
4427  case MouseState_CDRAG:
4428 
4429  if(pEvent->type == ButtonPress || // someone pressed a different mouse button
4430  iMouseDragButtonState != iDragButtonState || // button state has changed
4431  iMouseModShiftCtrl != iModShiftCtrl) // modifier state change
4432  {
4433 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse was dragging, now canceled\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
4434 
4435  WBMouseCancel(pDisplay, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window); // always call this
4436  }
4437  else if(pEvent->type == MotionNotify) // mods and buttons NOT changed
4438  {
4439  // modifiers still match (see above) so no need for cancelation here
4440 
4441  if(iButton1 && // for now rely on other code to cancel this if another button is pressed
4442  (iMouseX != ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x ||
4443  iMouseY != ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y))
4444  {
4445  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4446  .type=ClientMessage,
4447  .serial=0,
4448  .send_event=0,
4449  .display=pDisplay,
4450  .window=((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window,
4451  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4452  .format=32
4453  };
4454 
4455 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse drag motion\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
4456 
4457  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_MOVE;
4458  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState
4459  | (iButton4 ? 8 : 0)
4460  | (iButton5 ? 16 : 0);
4461  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4462  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4463  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4464 
4465  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y,
4466  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4467 
4468  evt.data.l[3] = iX; // TODO: should this be UN-TRANSLATED or SCREEN coordinates?
4469  evt.data.l[4] = iY; // should I indicate WHICH WINDOW this should be for?
4470 
4471  iMouseX = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x; // keep track of current drag position
4472  iMouseY = ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y;
4473 
4474  WBPostPriorityEvent(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4475  }
4476 // else
4477 // {
4478 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s:%d mouse drag motion NOT handled: %d %d,%d (%d,%d) \n",
4479 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
4480 // iButton1, iMouseX, iMouseY, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y);
4481 // }
4482  }
4483  else if(pEvent->type == ButtonRelease) // TODO: check mouse button and key mask match
4484  {
4485  // handle drop event
4486 
4487  XClientMessageEvent evt = {
4488  .type=ClientMessage,
4489  .serial=0,
4490  .send_event=0,
4491  .display=pDisplay,
4492  .window=((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window,
4493  .message_type=aWB_POINTER,
4494  .format=32
4495  };
4496 
4497  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_DROP;
4498  evt.data.l[1] = iDragButtonState;
4499  evt.data.l[2] = (iModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
4500  | (iModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
4501  | (iModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
4502 
4503  WBXlatCoordPoint(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->x, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->y,
4504  ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, &iX, &iY);
4505 
4506  evt.data.l[3] = iX; // TODO: should this be UN-TRANSLATED or SCREEN coordinates?
4507  evt.data.l[4] = iY; // should I indicate WHICH WINDOW this should be for?
4508 
4509  WBPostPriorityEvent(((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window, (XEvent *)&evt);
4510 
4511  if(wMouseCapture != None)
4512  {
4513  // end the mouse capture
4514  XUngrabPointer(pDisplay, CurrentTime);
4515  wMouseCapture = None;
4516  }
4517 
4518  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE; // complete
4519  }
4520 
4521  break;
4522  }
4523  }
4524  else if(iMouseState != MouseState_NONE &&
4525  (pEvent->type == KeyPress ||
4526  pEvent->type == KeyRelease))
4527  {
4528  int iModShiftCtrl = ((XKeyEvent *)pEvent)->state & (ShiftMask | LockMask | ControlMask | Mod1Mask
4529  | Mod2Mask | Mod3Mask | Mod4Mask | Mod5Mask);
4530 
4531  int iKey = XLookupKeysym((XKeyEvent *)pEvent, 0); // always use '0' index for these
4532  //WBKeyEventProcessKey((XKeyEvent *)pEvent, NULL, NULL, NULL)
4533 
4534  // mouse state cancelation due to pressing or releasing a key AFTERWARDS
4535  // for now limit this to escape, space, enter, and one of the modifier keys
4536 
4537  if(iModShiftCtrl != iMouseModShiftCtrl ||
4538  (pEvent->type == KeyPress &&
4539  (iKey == XK_Escape || iKey == XK_Return || iKey == XK_KP_Enter)))
4540  {
4541  // cancel any mouse states due to pressing a key
4542 
4543  WBMouseCancel(pDisplay, ((XButtonEvent *)pEvent)->window);
4544  }
4545  }
4546  }
4547 
4548  return iRval;
4549 }
4550 
4551 
4552 /**********************************************************************/
4553 /* */
4554 /* message dispatching functions */
4555 /* (see also 'WBInternalProcessExposeEvent', below) */
4556 /* */
4557 /**********************************************************************/
4558 
4559 int WBAppDispatch(XEvent *pEvent)
4560 {
4561 Atom aTemp;
4562 XEvent evtTemp;
4563 
4564  // internal-only messages [not hooked]
4565 
4566  if(pEvent->xany.type == ClientMessage
4567  && pEvent->xclient.message_type == aSET_FOCUS) // async assign focus (top level window only)
4568  {
4569  XWindowChanges xwc;
4570  Window wID = (Window)pEvent->xclient.data.l[0];
4571  Window wIDFrom = (Window)pEvent->xclient.data.l[1]; // window inadvertently getting focus
4572  Window wIDRoot = None;
4573  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
4574  Display *pDisplay;
4575 
4576  if(pEntry && pEntry->pDisplay && pEvent->xany.display &&
4577  pEvent->xany.display != pEntry->pDisplay)
4578  {
4579  pEntry = NULL; // anticipate multiple displays with matching window ID's in this case...
4580  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - display pointer mismatch\n", __FUNCTION__);
4581  }
4582 
4583  if(pEntry)
4584  {
4585  if(pEntry->pDisplay)
4586  {
4587  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
4588  }
4589  else
4590  {
4591  pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
4592  }
4593  }
4594  else if(pEvent->xany.display) // TODO: verify it's not different from that for pEntry
4595  {
4596  pDisplay = pEvent->xany.display;
4597  }
4598  else
4599  {
4600  pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
4601  }
4602 
4603 // fprintf(stderr, "** TEMPORARY - %s setting focus to %08xH\n", __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID);
4604  // NOTE: if this is not a top level window, results may be unexpected
4605 
4606  // tell the WM to mark the desired window as "the active window"
4607  aTemp = XInternAtom (pEvent->xany.display ? pEvent->xany.display : pDefaultDisplay,
4608  "_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW", False); /* global scope, must use XInternAtom */
4609 
4610  bzero(&evtTemp, sizeof(evtTemp));
4611 
4612  evtTemp.xany.type = ClientMessage;
4613  evtTemp.xany.send_event = True; // will send it, not post
4614  evtTemp.xany.display = pEvent->xany.display ? pEvent->xany.display : pDefaultDisplay;
4615  evtTemp.xany.window = wID; // in this case, the window to make active
4616  evtTemp.xany.serial = 0;
4617 
4618  __internal_GetParent(evtTemp.xany.display, wID, &wIDRoot); // send to 'wRoot'
4619 
4620  // client message params
4621  evtTemp.xclient.message_type = aTemp;
4622  evtTemp.xclient.format = 32;
4623  evtTemp.xclient.data.l[0] = 0; // "use old method" (should be suitable)
4624  evtTemp.xclient.data.l[1] = 0; // timestamp (zero for now)
4625  evtTemp.xclient.data.l[2] = wIDFrom; // window that was incorrectly set 'active'
4626 
4627  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4628  XSendEvent(pDisplay, wIDRoot, False,
4629  SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask,
4630  &evtTemp);
4631  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4632 
4633  WBSetInputFocus(wID); // set input focus to this window (after doing the above)
4634  // window managers that ignore _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW should work OK with JUST
4635  // a call to XSetInputFocus. fluxbox works when you use XSetInputFocus
4636 
4637  bzero(&xwc, sizeof(xwc));
4638  xwc.stack_mode = Above;
4639 
4640  // bring window forward
4641  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4642 
4643  XConfigureWindow(pDisplay, wID, CWStackMode, &xwc);
4644  XMapWindow(pDisplay, wID);
4645 
4646  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4647 
4648  return 1; // handled
4649  }
4650 
4651  if(!pAppEventCallback || !pAppEventCallback(pEvent))
4652  {
4653  return WBAppDefault(pEvent);
4654  }
4655 
4656  return 0;
4657 }
4658 
4659 void WBDispatch(XEvent *pEvent)
4660 {
4661  // determine the window ID for the message, if applicable
4662 
4663 // if(pEvent->type == KeymapEvent)
4664 // {
4665 // }
4666  if(pEvent->xany.window == None) // the application
4667  {
4668  WBAppDispatch(pEvent);
4669  }
4670  else
4671  {
4672  WBWindowDispatch(pEvent->xany.window, pEvent);
4673  }
4674 
4675  __PeriodicWindowEntryCleanup(); // TODO: find a more intelligent way to make this work
4676 }
4677 
4678 
4679 int WBWindowDispatch(Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
4680 {
4681  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
4682  int iRval = 0, iSetFocus = 0;
4683 
4684  if(pEvent->type == ClientMessage)
4685  {
4686  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4687  "%s - client message, pEntry==%pH\n", __FUNCTION__, pEntry);
4688  }
4689 
4690  if(pEntry)
4691  {
4692  // detect resize, mouse, and keystrokes for menu
4693 
4694  if(pEntry->wIDMenu)
4695  {
4696  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pMenuEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(pEntry->wIDMenu);
4697 
4698  if(WB_UNLIKELY(!pMenuEntry))
4699  {
4700  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - pMenuEntry is NULL, pEntry->wIDMenu = %d (%08xH)\n",
4701  __FUNCTION__, (int)pEntry->wIDMenu, (int)pEntry->wIDMenu);
4702  }
4703  else if(WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pMenuEntry)))
4704  {
4705  // DO NOT dispatch messages to destroyed menus
4706 
4707  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s:%d - %d (%08xH) NOT mapped\n",
4708  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
4709 
4710  goto exit_point; // NOT handled (should I change this?)
4711  }
4712  else if(pMenuEntry->pMenuCallback &&
4713  (pEvent->type == ConfigureNotify || // resize, reposition
4714  pEvent->type == EnterNotify ||
4715  pEvent->type == LeaveNotify ||
4716  pEvent->type == KeyPress ||
4717  pEvent->type == KeyRelease ||
4718  pEvent->type == ButtonPress ||
4719  pEvent->type == ButtonRelease ||
4720  pEvent->type == MotionNotify ||
4721  pEvent->type == ClientMessage))
4722  {
4723  // TODO: do I want to exclude 'Expose' and other event types ???
4724  // [this is the only part that calls the client's callback function]
4725 
4726  iRval = pMenuEntry->pMenuCallback(pMenuEntry->wID, pEvent);
4727 
4728  if(iRval)
4729  {
4730  goto exit_point; // handled
4731  }
4732  }
4733  }
4734 
4735  if(pEvent->type == Expose)
4736  {
4737  WB_GEOM geom;
4738 
4739  if(WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry)))
4740  {
4741  // DO NOT dispatch messages to destroyed menus
4742 
4743  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s:%d - %d (%08xH) NOT mapped\n",
4744  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
4745 
4746  goto exit_point; // NOT handled (should I change this?)
4747  }
4748 
4749  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geom);
4750 
4751  pEntry->width = geom.width; // update geometry for 'pEntry'
4752  pEntry->height = geom.height;
4753  pEntry->border = geom.border;
4754 
4755  iSetFocus = WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pEntry);
4756  }
4757 
4758  if(pEvent->type == ReparentNotify && wID == pEvent->xreparent.window)
4759  {
4760  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
4761  "%s - re-parent event, %d (%08xH), %d (%08xH)\n",
4762  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID,
4763  (int)pEvent->xreparent.parent, (int)pEvent->xreparent.parent);
4764 
4765  pEntry->wParent = pEvent->xreparent.parent;
4766  }
4767 
4768  if(pEntry->pCallback) // CAN be NULL, especially if there are stale events waiting to be sent
4769  {
4770  iRval = pEntry->pCallback(wID, pEvent);
4771 
4772  if(iSetFocus)
4773  {
4774  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4775  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) mapped, setting focus\n",
4776  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
4777 
4778 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (uint32_t)wID);
4779 
4780  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4781  XSetInputFocus(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
4782  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4783  }
4784 
4785  if(iRval) // if my callback 'handled' me properly
4786  {
4787  if(pEvent->type != DestroyNotify || // not a destroy notification
4788  pEvent->xdestroywindow.window != wID) // destroyed window isn't me
4789  {
4790  if(pEvent->type == DestroyNotify)
4791  {
4792  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - UNEXPECTED - DestroyNotify for %d and message is for %d\n",
4793  __FUNCTION__, (int)pEvent->xdestroywindow.window, (int)wID);
4794  }
4795 
4796  // return NOW - no further processing
4797 
4798  goto exit_point; // handled
4799  }
4800 
4801  // at this point, I had a DestroyNotify message for THIS window - flow through to next section
4802  }
4803  }
4804  else if(pEvent->type == DestroyNotify)
4805  {
4806  if(pEvent->xdestroywindow.window == wID)
4807  {
4808  // 'pEntry' is still valid, but SHOULD be marked 'to be destroyed'
4809  if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry)) // already destroyed? no need to say anything
4810  {
4811  // I am being destroyed and I have no callback
4812  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s - DestroyNotify for wID %d (%s) and NO CALLBACK (this is sometimes expected)\n",
4813  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, pEntry->szClassName);
4814  }
4815  }
4816  else
4817  {
4818  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - (UNEXPECTED) DestroyNotify for %d and message is for %d (no callback)\n",
4819  __FUNCTION__, (int)pEvent->xdestroywindow.window, (int)wID);
4820  }
4821  }
4822  else if(iSetFocus) // still handle this, just in case
4823  {
4824  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
4825  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) mapped, setting focus\n",
4826  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
4827 
4828 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (uint32_t)wID);
4829 
4830  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4831  XSetInputFocus(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
4832  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
4833  }
4834 
4835  // handle any DestroyNotify events at this point. A parent window may send these to child windows, even
4836  // after the window is actually destroyed and its callback NULL'd
4837  //
4838  // (NOTE: if I had a callback, I still handle destroy notifications for ME at this point)
4839 
4840  if(pEvent->type == DestroyNotify &&
4841  pEvent->xdestroywindow.window == wID) // I am being destroyed
4842  {
4843  // window destroyed, already called callback (if there is one)
4844 
4845  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry2 = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
4846 
4847  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
4848  "%s - DestroyNotify for %d (%08xH)\n",
4849  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
4850 
4851  if(pEntry2 && !iRval) // must call 'Default'
4852  {
4853 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - doing default processing for DestroyNotify\n");
4854  WBDefault(wID, pEvent);
4855  }
4856 
4857  // if this window is the current 'application' window, set the 'quit' flag.
4858  if(wID == wIDApplication)
4859  {
4860  bQuitFlag = TRUE; // application window destroyed, application must exit
4861  }
4862 
4863  if(pEntry2 && pEntry2 == pEntry)
4864  {
4865  // window destruction means delete remaining events, then unregister the callback
4866  __WBDelWindowEvents(pEntry->pDisplay, wID);
4867 
4868  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // to flag "I am destroying it now"
4869 // WB_ERROR_PRINT(">>TEMPORARY - %s - marking window %d (%s) destroyed and unregistering callback\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, pEntry->szClassName);
4870 
4871  WBUnregisterWindowCallback(wID); // NOTE: this assigns 'wIDApplication' to None if this was the application window
4872 
4873  goto exit_point; // handled
4874  }
4875  else
4876  {
4877  WB_ERROR_PRINT("WARNING - %s - pEntry == %p, pEntry2 == %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pEntry, pEntry2);
4878  }
4879  }
4880  }
4881  else
4882  {
4883  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN/*Medium*/ | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event /*| DebugSubSystem_Selection*/,
4884  "%s - Event %s for window %d (%08xH) not handled [no pEntry]\n",
4885  __FUNCTION__, WBEventName(pEvent->type), (int)wID, (int)wID);
4886  }
4887 
4888  // NOTE: I get here if the registered callback returns zero or isn't assigned
4889  // and it's either NOT a 'DestroyNotify' or there's no window entry
4890 
4891  if(!iRval)
4892  {
4893  iRval = WBDefault(wID, pEvent);
4894  }
4895  else
4896  {
4897  WBDefault(wID, pEvent); // do it anyway but don't use THAT return value
4898  }
4899 
4900 exit_point:
4901 
4902  // TODO: any "always do this" stuff belongs here
4903 
4904  return iRval;
4905 }
4906 
4907 int WBAppDefault(XEvent *pEvent)
4908 {
4909  return 0; // not handled
4910 }
4911 
4912 int WBDefault(Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
4913 {
4914  int i1;
4915  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
4916  Display *pDisplay = pEvent->xany.display ? pEvent->xany.display
4917  : pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
4918 
4919 
4920  if (pEvent->type == Expose && pEvent->xexpose.count == 0)
4921  {
4922  // for now, just erase the background using whatever background color is currently assigned
4923  if(pEntry && pEntry->hGC != NULL)
4924  {
4925  WBGC gc = WBBeginPaint(wID, &(pEvent->xexpose), NULL);
4926  if(gc != NULL)
4927  {
4928  WBClearWindow(wID, gc);
4929  WBEndPaint(wID, gc);
4930  }
4931  }
4932  else
4933  {
4934 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - window has NO assigned GC, calling XClearWindow\n", __FUNCTION__);
4935 
4936  XClearWindow(pDisplay, wID); // TODO: rather than erase background, see if I need to
4937  }
4938 
4939  return 1; // handled
4940  }
4941  else if(pEvent->type == ConfigureNotify && pEvent->xconfigure.window == wID)
4942  {
4943  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
4944  "%s - window %08xH gets ConfigureNotify\n",
4945  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID);
4946 
4947  // see if it's a move, or a re-size. on re-size I have to re-paint and re-calculate
4948  // the various display thingies. But if I'm just moving it, no need.
4949 
4950  if(pEvent->xconfigure.width != pEntry->width ||
4951  pEvent->xconfigure.height != pEntry->height ||
4952  pEvent->xconfigure.border_width != pEntry->border)
4953  {
4954  if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry) || // if I'm not mapped, just change the numbers and create a region
4955  !pEntry->width || !pEntry->height) // same if width/height was zero (but is no longer)
4956  {
4957  XRectangle xrct;
4958 
4959  // NOTE: I must do it THIS way because the window isn't mapped yet.
4960 
4961  pEntry->width = pEvent->xconfigure.width;
4962  pEntry->height = pEvent->xconfigure.height;
4963  pEntry->border = pEvent->xconfigure.border_width;
4964 
4965  if(pEntry->rgnClip != None)
4966  {
4967  XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
4968  }
4969 
4970  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion();
4971 
4972  if(pEntry->rgnClip &&
4973  pEntry->width && pEntry->height) // make sure non-zero
4974  {
4975  xrct.x = 0;//(short)pEntry->x;
4976  xrct.y = 0;//(short)pEntry->y;
4977  xrct.width = (unsigned short)pEntry->width;
4978  xrct.height = (unsigned short)pEntry->height;
4979 
4980  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip);
4981  }
4982  }
4983  else
4984  {
4985 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - ConfigureNotify invalidating geometry\n", __FUNCTION__);
4986 
4987  WBInvalidateGeom(wID, NULL, 1); // for simplicity, just re-paint it - note, NOT saying "do it now"
4988  }
4989  }
4990 
4991  return 1; // handled
4992  }
4993  else if(pEvent->type == VisibilityNotify &&
4994  pEvent->xvisibility.window == wID &&
4995  pEvent->xvisibility.state != VisibilityFullyObscured)
4996  {
4997  // Focus and Z-order changes generate this. If my window's state changes to at least partially 'unobscured',
4998  // then the response is to invalidate the entire window so it re-paints.
4999 
5000  // TODO: see what was covering it up before, to limit the re-painting
5001 
5002  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
5003  "%s - window %08xH gets VisibilityNotify, state=%d\n",
5004  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)pEvent->xvisibility.window, pEvent->xvisibility.state);
5005 
5006  WBInvalidateGeom(pEvent->xvisibility.window, NULL, 1); // TODO: determine what changed
5007 
5008  return 1; // handled
5009  }
5010  else if(pEvent->type == MapRequest &&
5011  (pEvent->xmaprequest.parent == wID || pEvent->xmaprequest.window == wID))
5012  {
5013  // XMapWindow and related can generate this. I want to see if it happens, ever.
5014 
5015  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - window %08xH gets MapRequest for %08xH\n",
5016  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)pEvent->xmaprequest.parent, (unsigned int)pEvent->xmaprequest.window);
5017  }
5018  else if(pEvent->type == ClientMessage)
5019  {
5020 // fprintf(stderr, "TEMPORARY: client message in WBDefault\n");
5021  if(pEvent->xclient.message_type == aWM_PROTOCOLS && pEvent->xclient.window == wID)
5022  {
5023  if(pEvent->xclient.data.l[0] == aWM_DELETE_WINDOW)
5024  {
5025  // If this is managed by the WM, I'll get this message in response to a request
5026  // to close the window. This includes clicking the 'x' button in the title bar
5027 
5028  XClientMessageEvent evt;
5029 
5030  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
5031  "%s - WM_DELETE_WINDOW for %d (%08xH)\n",
5032  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5033 
5034  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - WM_PROTOCOLS WM_DELETE_WINDOW, requests call to XDestroyWindow for %u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5035 
5036  // the default action is to FIRST query the window to see if it's ok to destroy it. if it is,
5037  // the window should THEN safely destroy all of its child windows, etc. before returning, so that
5038  // I don't end up with a pile of X11 errors.
5039 
5040  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
5041  evt.type = ClientMessage;
5042  evt.display = pDisplay;
5043  evt.window = wID;
5044  evt.message_type = aQUERY_CLOSE; // QUERY_CLOSE request
5045  evt.format = 32;
5046  evt.data.l[0] = 1; // tell it to destroy contents if ok to close
5047 
5048  i1 = WBWindowDispatch(evt.window, (XEvent *)&evt);
5049 
5050  if(i1 <= 0) // ok to close the window (or there was an error, so close anyway)
5051  {
5052  if(i1 < 0)
5053  {
5054  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - QUERY_CLOSE returns %d, destroying window %u (%08xH) anyway\n",
5055  __FUNCTION__, i1, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5056  }
5057  else
5058  {
5059  WB_ERROR_PRINT("INFO: %s - QUERY_CLOSE returns %d, ok to destroy window %u (%08xH)\n",
5060  __FUNCTION__, i1, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5061  }
5062 
5063  if(wID == wIDApplication) // if it's the "application window", set the quit flag
5064  {
5065 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - setting 'quit' flag\n", __FUNCTION__);
5066 
5067  bQuitFlag = TRUE; // application window destroyed, application must exit
5068  }
5069 
5070  // window destruction means delete remaining events, then unregister the callback
5071  __WBDelWindowEvents(pEntry->pDisplay, wID);
5072 
5073  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED; // to flag "I am destroying it now"
5074 
5075  WBUnregisterWindowCallback(wID); // make sure this happens - FYI it assigns matching wIDApplication to 'None'
5076 
5077 // WBDestroyWindow(wID); // destroy the window (DO NOT CALL THIS, the application will stay running if it's the main frame)
5078 
5079  // default action is to destroy the window *NOW*
5080  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5081  XDestroyWindow(pDisplay, wID); // todo: wrap this in ???
5082  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5083  }
5084 
5085  return 1; // "handled"
5086  }
5087  }
5088  else if(pEvent->xclient.message_type == aWB_TIMER && pEvent->xclient.window == wID)
5089  {
5090  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
5091  "%s - un-handled WB_TIMER for %d (%08xH)\n",
5092  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5093  }
5094 #ifndef NO_DEBUG // uncomment this block to dump every event NOT handled
5095  else
5096  {
5097  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
5098  "%s - un-handled ClientMessage for %d (%08xH)\n",
5099  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5100 
5101  WB_IF_DEBUG_LEVEL(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event)
5102  {
5103  WBDebugDumpEvent(pEvent);
5104  }
5105  }
5106 #endif // NO_DEBUG
5107  }
5108  else if(pEvent->type == KeyPress ||
5109  pEvent->type == KeyRelease)
5110  {
5111  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Keyboard,
5112  "%s - key press/release event for %d (%08xH) in default handler\n",
5113  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5114 
5115  if(pEvent->type == KeyPress /* || pEvent->type == KeyRelease */)
5116  {
5117  // generate a WB_CHAR event for unhandled 'keypress' events
5118  // this lets all windows have a chance at intercepting the
5119  // keypress event before a WB_CHAR is generated
5120 
5121  XClientMessageEvent evt;
5122  int cbData, iACS = 0;
5123 
5124  // post a high-priority message to myself to display the menu
5125 
5126  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
5127  evt.type = ClientMessage;
5128  evt.display = pDisplay;
5129  evt.window = pEvent->xany.window;
5130  evt.message_type = aWB_CHAR; // WB_CHAR notification
5131  evt.format = 32;
5132 
5133  cbData = sizeof(evt.data) - 3 * sizeof(evt.data.l[0]);
5134  evt.data.l[0] = WBKeyEventProcessKey((XKeyEvent *)pEvent,
5135  (char *)&(evt.data.l[3]),
5136  &cbData, &iACS);
5137 
5138  evt.data.l[1] = iACS;
5139  evt.data.l[2] = cbData;
5140 
5141  // pressing or releasing shift, ctrl, alt, or 'meta' must not
5142  // generate an event. Fortunately these are all within a range
5143 
5144  if(evt.data.l[0] < XK_Shift_L || evt.data.l[0] > XK_Hyper_R)
5145  {
5146  // NOTE: l[0] is return value from WBKeyEventProcessKey
5147  // l[1] is iACS return value
5148  // l[2] is # of characters decoded into 'l[3]'
5149  // l[3..] is character decode buffer
5150 
5151  if(iACS & WB_KEYEVENT_KEYSYM)
5152  {
5153  // temporary debug
5154  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Keyboard,
5155  "%s - generating WB_CHAR for KEYSYM %ld (%lxH) iACS=%xH window %d (%08xH)\n",
5156  __FUNCTION__, evt.data.l[0], evt.data.l[0], iACS,
5157  (int)pEvent->xany.window, (int)pEvent->xany.window);
5158  }
5159  else
5160  {
5161  // temporary debug
5162  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_Event | DebugSubSystem_Keyboard,
5163  "%s - generating WB_CHAR \"%.*s\" iACS=%xH window %d (%08xH)\n",
5164  __FUNCTION__, cbData, (char *)&(evt.data.l[3]), iACS,
5165  (int)pEvent->xany.window, (int)pEvent->xany.window);
5166  }
5167 
5168  WBPostPriorityEvent(pEvent->xany.window, (XEvent *)&evt);
5169  }
5170  }
5171 
5172  }
5173  else if(pEvent->type == DestroyNotify &&
5174  pEvent->xdestroywindow.window == wID)
5175  {
5176  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5177 
5178  if(pEntry && pEntry->wIDMenu)
5179  {
5180  Window wIDMenu = pEntry->wIDMenu;
5181  pEntry->wIDMenu = 0;
5182 
5183  // Look for any other occurences of this menu attached to any other window
5184  // TODO: make this more efficient, eh?
5185  // TODO: see if I even need this. I've not been sharing WBMenu resources at all...
5186 
5187  for(i1=0; i1 <= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX; i1++)
5188  {
5189  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wIDMenu == wIDMenu)
5190  break;
5191  }
5192 
5193  // am I the last guy using the menu?
5194  if(i1 > WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX)
5195  {
5196  WBDestroyWindow(wIDMenu);
5197  }
5198  }
5199  }
5200  else if(pEvent->type == SelectionRequest)
5201  {
5202  // NOTE: selection events are handled by the Clipboard worker thread. However, I can still (possibly)
5203  // get these things sent to me. The *POLITE* thing to do is respond to them with an error sent
5204  // back to the requestor. And so, that's what I do. And display it in on stderr in debug code...
5205 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
5206  char *p1 = pEvent->xselectionrequest.selection != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselectionrequest.selection) : NULL;
5207  char *p2 = pEvent->xselectionrequest.target != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselectionrequest.target) : NULL;
5208  char *p3 = pEvent->xselectionrequest.property != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselectionrequest.property) : NULL;
5209 
5210  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - SelectionRequest wID=%d(%08xH) class=%s owner=%d requestor=%d selection=%s target=%s property=%s\n",
5211  __FUNCTION__,
5212  (int)wID, (int)wID,
5213  (const char *)(pEntry ? pEntry->szClassName : "UNK"),
5214  (int)pEvent->xselectionrequest.owner,
5215  (int)pEvent->xselectionrequest.requestor,
5216  p1 ? p1 : "NULL",
5217  p2 ? p2 : "NULL",
5218  p3 ? p3 : "NULL");
5219 
5220  if(p1)
5221  {
5222  WBFree(p1);
5223  }
5224  if(p2)
5225  {
5226  WBFree(p2);
5227  }
5228  if(p3)
5229  {
5230  WBFree(p3);
5231  }
5232 #endif // NO_DEBUG
5233 
5234  // the default rejects the request. Send a 'SelectionNotify' to indicate the failure
5235  // failing to send the SelectionNotify can REALLY screw things up for the requestor
5236 
5237  if(pEvent->xselectionrequest.owner == wID) // only if I'm the selection owner
5238  {
5239  XSelectionEvent evtN;
5240 
5241  memset(&evtN, 0, sizeof(evtN));
5242 
5243  evtN.type = SelectionNotify;
5244  evtN.send_event = True; // 'cause I'm going to use 'XSendEvent' to reply immediately
5245  evtN.requestor = pEvent->xselectionrequest.requestor;
5246  evtN.selection = pEvent->xselectionrequest.selection;
5247  evtN.target = pEvent->xselectionrequest.target;
5248  evtN.property = None; // to indicate failure
5249  evtN.time = pEvent->xselectionrequest.time; // same time as request (for now)
5250 
5251  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5252  XSendEvent(pDisplay, evtN.requestor, False, 0, (XEvent *)&evtN);
5253  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5254  }
5255  }
5256  else if(pEvent->type == SelectionClear)
5257  {
5258 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
5259  char *p1 = WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselectionclear.selection);
5260 
5261  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - SelectionClear wID=%d(%08xH) class=%s window=%d selection=%s\n",
5262  __FUNCTION__,
5263  (int)wID, (int)wID,
5264  (const char *)(pEntry ? pEntry->szClassName : "UNK"),
5265  (int)pEvent->xselectionclear.window,
5266  p1 ? p1 : "NULL");
5267 
5268  if(p1)
5269  {
5270  WBFree(p1);
5271  }
5272 #endif // NO_DEBUG
5273 
5274  // the default rejects the request. No need to send a 'SelectionNotify'
5275  }
5276  else if(pEvent->type == SelectionNotify)
5277  {
5278 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
5279  char *p1 = pEvent->xselection.selection != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselection.selection) : NULL;
5280  char *p2 = pEvent->xselection.target != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselection.target) : NULL;
5281  char *p3 = pEvent->xselection.property != None ? WBGetAtomName(pDisplay, pEvent->xselection.property) : NULL;
5282 
5283  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - SelectionNotify wID=%d(%08xH) class=%s requestor=%d selection=%s target=%s property=%s\n",
5284  __FUNCTION__,
5285  (int)wID, (int)wID,
5286  (const char *)(pEntry ? pEntry->szClassName : "UNK"),
5287  (int)pEvent->xselection.requestor,
5288  p1 ? p1 : "NULL",
5289  p2 ? p2 : "NULL",
5290  p3 ? p3 : "NULL");
5291 
5292  if(p1)
5293  {
5294  WBFree(p1);
5295  }
5296  if(p2)
5297  {
5298  WBFree(p2);
5299  }
5300  if(p3)
5301  {
5302  WBFree(p3);
5303  }
5304 #endif // NO_DEBUG
5305  }
5306 //#ifndef NO_DEBUG // uncomment this block to dump every event NOT handled
5307 // else
5308 // {
5309 // WBDebugDumpEvent(pEvent);
5310 // }
5311 //#endif // NO_DEBUG
5312 
5313  return 0; // indicate 'not handled' for now
5314 }
5315 
5316 
5317 void WBProcessExposeEvent(XExposeEvent *pEvent)
5318 {
5319 XEvent xevt;
5320 
5321  // first, handle the expose event as-is
5322  WBInternalProcessExposeEvent(pEvent);
5323 
5324  // next, grab whatever expose events are still out there and combine them, too
5325 
5326 // XFlush(pEvent->display);
5327  XSync(pEvent->display, 0); // to grab whatever expose events might be out there
5328 
5329  while(!bQuitFlag && XCheckTypedWindowEvent(pEvent->display, pEvent->window, Expose, &xevt))
5330  {
5331  WBInternalProcessExposeEvent((XExposeEvent *)&xevt);
5332  }
5333 }
5334 
5335 
5336 void WBMouseCancel(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5337 {
5338 XClientMessageEvent evt;
5339 int iX, iY;
5340 
5341 
5342  if((iMouseState != MouseState_LDRAG &&
5343  iMouseState != MouseState_RDRAG &&
5344  iMouseState != MouseState_CDRAG &&
5345  iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_LCLICK &&
5346  iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_RCLICK &&
5347  iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_CCLICK) // expected states to do a 'Mouse Cancel' for
5348  || wMouseCapture == None)
5349  {
5350  if(wMouseCapture != None)
5351  {
5352  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - incorrect mouse state: %d (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, iMouseState, iMouseState);
5353 
5354  XUngrabPointer(pDisplay ? pDisplay : WBGetDefaultDisplay(), CurrentTime);
5355 
5356  wMouseCapture = None; // not captured
5357  }
5358  else if(iMouseState == MouseState_NONE)
5359  {
5360  return; // just ignore it. no harm, no foul. mouse not captured, state is 'None'
5361  }
5362  else if(iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_LCLICK &&
5363  iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_RCLICK &&
5364  iMouseState != MouseState_WAS_CCLICK) // the "was" states are ok here. 'mouse cancel' will not be sent, however
5365  {
5366  // any other mouse state is unexpected here. spit out a message
5367 
5368  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - mouse not captured. mouse state: %d (%08xH) \n", __FUNCTION__, iMouseState, iMouseState);
5369  }
5370 
5371  // TODO: send notification for a 'WAS' state??
5372 
5373  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE; // by convention, do this (always) on mouse cancel
5374 
5375  return; // for now, just do this [no capture]
5376  }
5377 
5378  if(wID == None)
5379  {
5380  wID = wMouseCapture; // the window with the mouse capture (checked for 'None' previously)
5381  }
5382 
5383  if(!pDisplay)
5384  {
5385  pDisplay = WBGetWindowDisplay(wID);
5386  if(!pDisplay)
5387  {
5388  pDisplay = WBGetDefaultDisplay(); // desperately make it work
5389  }
5390  }
5391 
5392  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
5393  evt.type=ClientMessage;
5394  evt.display=pDisplay;
5395  evt.window=wID;
5396  evt.message_type=aWB_POINTER;
5397  evt.format=32;
5398  evt.data.l[0] = WB_POINTER_CANCEL;
5399 
5400  evt.data.l[1] = iMouseDragButtonState;
5401  evt.data.l[2] = (iMouseModShiftCtrl & ShiftMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0)
5402  | (iMouseModShiftCtrl & ControlMask ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
5403  | (iMouseModShiftCtrl & Mod1Mask ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0);
5404 
5405  WBXlatCoordPoint(wMouseCapture, iMouseX, iMouseY, wMouseCapture, &iX, &iY);
5406 
5407  evt.data.l[3] = iX;
5408  evt.data.l[4] = iY;
5409 
5410  WBPostPriorityEvent(wID, (XEvent *)&evt); // post the WB_POINTER 'WB_POINTER_CANCEL' event
5411 
5412  iMouseState = MouseState_NONE; // canceled
5413 
5414  XUngrabPointer(pDisplay, CurrentTime);
5415 
5416  wMouseCapture = None;
5417  iMouseModShiftCtrl = iMouseDragButtonState = 0;
5418 }
5419 
5420 
5421 
5422 int WBMapWindow(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5423 {
5424  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5425  int iRval, iSetFocus = 0;
5426 
5427  if(pEntry)
5428  {
5429  iSetFocus = WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pEntry);
5430 
5431  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_MAPPED;
5432 
5433  if(!pEntry->pWMHints)
5434  {
5435  // if no window hints were configured, set some up
5436 
5437  if(!__internal_alloc_WMHints(pEntry))
5438  {
5439  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5440  XSetWMHints(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, pEntry->pWMHints);
5441  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5442  }
5443  }
5444  }
5445 
5446  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5447  iRval = XMapWindow(pDisplay, wID);
5448  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5449 
5450  if(iSetFocus)
5451  {
5452  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
5453  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) mapped, setting focus\n",
5454  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5455 
5456 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (uint32_t)wID);
5457 
5458  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5459  XSetInputFocus(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
5460  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5461  }
5462 
5463  return iRval;
5464 }
5465 
5466 int WBMapRaised(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5467 {
5468  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5469 
5470  int iRval, iSetFocus = 0;
5471 
5472  if(pEntry)
5473  {
5474  iSetFocus = WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pEntry);
5475 
5476  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_MAPPED;
5477 
5478  if(!pEntry->pWMHints)
5479  {
5480  // if no window hints were configured, set some up
5481 
5482  if(!__internal_alloc_WMHints(pEntry))
5483  {
5484  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5485  XSetWMHints(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, pEntry->pWMHints);
5486  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5487  }
5488  }
5489  }
5490 
5491  iRval = XMapRaised(pDisplay, wID);
5492 
5493  if(iSetFocus)
5494  {
5495  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Window,
5496  "%s:%d - %d (%08xH) mapped, setting focus\n",
5497  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
5498 
5499 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s calling XSetInputFocus on wID=%u (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (uint32_t)wID);
5500 
5501  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5502  XSetInputFocus(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, RevertToParent, CurrentTime);
5503  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5504  }
5505 
5506  return iRval;
5507 }
5508 
5509 int WBUnmapWindow(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5510 {
5511  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5512  int iRval;
5513 
5514  if(pEntry)
5515  {
5516  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(*pEntry) || WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
5517  {
5518  return 0;
5519  }
5520 
5521  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED; // aka 'unmapped'
5522  }
5523 
5524  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5525  iRval = XUnmapWindow(pDisplay, wID);
5526  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
5527 
5528  // TODO: if window HAD focus, set it to the main app window?
5529 
5530  return iRval;
5531 }
5532 
5533 
5534 int WBIsMapped(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5535 {
5536  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5537 
5538  if(pEntry && WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry) && !WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
5539  {
5540  return 1;
5541  }
5542 
5543  // TODO: handle windows NOT being tracked???
5544 
5545  return 0;
5546 }
5547 
5548 int WBIsValid(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
5549 {
5550  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
5551 
5552  if(pEntry && !WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry))
5553  {
5554 // fprintf(stderr, "TEMPORARY - returning 'valid' for window %d\n", wID);
5555  return 1;
5556  }
5557 
5558  // TODO: handle windows NOT being tracked???
5559 
5560  return 0;
5561 }
5562 
5563 
5564 
5565 /**********************************************************************/
5566 /* */
5567 /* basic window property functions */
5568 /* */
5569 /**********************************************************************/
5570 
5571 static int __internal_alloc_WMHints(_WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry)
5572 {
5573  if(pEntry)
5574  {
5575  if(pEntry->pWMHints)
5576  {
5577  return 0;
5578  }
5579  else
5580  {
5581  pEntry->pWMHints = XAllocWMHints();
5582  if(pEntry->pWMHints)
5583  {
5584  // set defaults
5585  pEntry->pWMHints->initial_state = NormalState;
5586  pEntry->pWMHints->input = True; // this means the WINDOW MANAGER should manage input focus (this is normal)
5587  pEntry->pWMHints->flags = InputHint | StateHint;
5588 
5589  return 0;
5590  }
5591  }
5592  }
5593 
5594  return -1;
5595 }
5596
