6260 const char *WBGetWindowClassName(Window wID)
6261 {
6262  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6263 
6264  if(pEntry)
6265  {
6266  return(pEntry->szClassName);
6267  }
6268 
6269  return(NULL);
6270 }
6271 
6272 void *WBGetWindowData(Window wID, int iIndex)
6273 {
6274  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6275 
6276  if(pEntry && iIndex >= 0 && iIndex <= WINDOW_DATA_SIZE)
6277  {
6278  return(pEntry->aWindowData[iIndex]);
6279  }
6280 
6281  return(NULL);
6282 }
6283 
6284 // use this to set the cursor without assigning the 'current cursor'
6285 static void __InternalSetWindowCursor(Window wID, int idCursor)
6286 {
6287  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6288  Display *pDisplay = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
6289  Cursor curNew = idCursor != -1 ? XCreateFontCursor(pDisplay, idCursor) : None;
6290  XColor clrF, clrB;
6291 
6292  if(curNew == None && idCursor != -1)
6293  {
6294  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - Cursor ID %d (%xH) returns 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__, idCursor, idCursor);
6295  }
6296 
6297  // this will work for *ANY* window (assuming default display for unmapped windows)
6298  // unfortunately it may cause a memory leak for windows that aren't mapped
6299  if(curNew != None)
6300  XDefineCursor(pDisplay, wID, curNew);
6301  else
6302  XUndefineCursor(pDisplay, wID);
6303 
6304  // and this will manage resources for internally 'known' windows
6305 
6306  if(pEntry)
6307  {
6308  if(pEntry->curRecent != None)
6309  XFreeCursor(pDisplay, pEntry->curRecent);
6310 
6311  pEntry->curRecent = curNew;
6312 
6313 #if 1
6314  if(curNew != None)
6315  {
6316  // TODO: use the default FG and BG colors of the window and
6317  // change the cursor colors accordingly. This should force
6318  // the cursor to change immediately
6319 
6320  // for now it's always white background, black foreground
6321 
6322  bzero(&clrF, sizeof(clrF));
6323  bzero(&clrB, sizeof(clrB));
6324  clrB.pixel = /*pEntry->clrFG*/ WhitePixel(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay));
6325  clrF.pixel = /*pEntry->clrBG*/ BlackPixel(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay));
6326  XQueryColor(pDisplay, DefaultColormap(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)), &clrF);
6327  XQueryColor(pDisplay, DefaultColormap(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)), &clrB);
6328 
6329  XRecolorCursor(pDisplay, curNew, &clrB, &clrF); // this will 'flash' it, kinda
6330  XRecolorCursor(pDisplay, curNew, &clrF, &clrB); // show NOW
6331  }
6332 #endif // 0
6333  }
6334 }
6335 
6336 void WBSetWindowDefaultCursor(Window wID, int idStandardCursor)
6337 {
6338  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6339 
6340  if(pEntry)
6341  {
6342  pEntry->idDefaultCursor = idStandardCursor;
6343 
6344  if(!pEntry->iWaitCursorCount) // if we're not currently displaying a wait cursor
6345  WBSetWindowCursor(wID, idStandardCursor); // change the cursor immediately to this one
6346  }
6347 }
6348 
6349 int WBGetWindowDefaultCursor(Window wID)
6350 {
6351  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6352 
6353  if(pEntry)
6354  return pEntry->idDefaultCursor;
6355 
6356  return WB_DEFAULT_CURSOR; // the standard default cursor
6357 }
6358 
6359 void WBBeginWaitCursor(Window wID)
6360 {
6361  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6362  Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDParent = 0;
6363  Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
6364  unsigned int u1, nChildren = 0;
6365 
6366  if(pEntry)
6367  {
6368  if(!(pEntry->iWaitCursorCount++))
6369  {
6370  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, WB_WAIT_CURSOR); // change the cursor immediately to the 'watch' cursor
6371 
6372  // also do the same for all of the child windows
6373 
6374  if(XQueryTree(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, &wIDRoot, &wIDParent, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
6375  {
6376  if(pwIDChildren)
6377  {
6378  for(u1=nChildren; u1; u1--) // go backwards
6379  {
6380  Window wKid = pwIDChildren[u1 - 1];
6381  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pE = WBGetWindowEntry(wKid);
6382 
6383  if(pE)
6384  {
6385  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wKid, WB_WAIT_CURSOR); // all must use the wait cursor now
6386  }
6387  }
6388 
6389  XFree(pwIDChildren);
6390  }
6391  }
6392  }
6393  }
6394  else
6395  {
6396  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, WB_WAIT_CURSOR); // change the cursor immediately to the 'watch' cursor
6397  }
6398 }
6399 
6400 void WBEndWaitCursor(Window wID)
6401 {
6402  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6403  Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDParent = 0;
6404  Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
6405  unsigned int u1, nChildren = 0;
6406 
6407 
6408  if(pEntry)
6409  {
6410  if(pEntry->iWaitCursorCount <= 1)
6411  {
6412  pEntry->iWaitCursorCount = 0;
6413 // WBRestoreDefaultCursor(wID);
6414  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, pEntry->idCursor);
6415 
6416  // walk child windows, restore THEIR cursors also
6417 
6418  if(XQueryTree(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, &wIDRoot, &wIDParent, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
6419  {
6420  if(pwIDChildren)
6421  {
6422  for(u1=nChildren; u1; u1--) // go backwards
6423  {
6424  Window wKid = pwIDChildren[u1 - 1];
6425  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pE = WBGetWindowEntry(wKid);
6426 
6427  if(pE)
6428  {
6429  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wKid, pE->idCursor); // restore to what it was
6430  }
6431  }
6432 
6433  XFree(pwIDChildren);
6434  }
6435  }
6436  }
6437  else
6438  {
6439  pEntry->iWaitCursorCount--;
6440  }
6441  }
6442  else
6443  {
6444  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, -1); // change the cursor immediately to the 'watch' cursor
6445  }
6446 }
6447 
6448 void WBSetWindowCursor(Window wID, int idCursor)
6449 {
6450  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6451 
6452  if(pEntry)
6453  {
6454  pEntry->idCursor = idCursor;
6455  }
6456 
6457  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, idCursor);
6458 }
6459 
6460 void WBRestoreDefaultCursor(Window wID)
6461 {
6462  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6463 
6464  if(pEntry)
6465  {
6466  pEntry->idCursor = pEntry->idDefaultCursor;
6467  __InternalSetWindowCursor(wID, pEntry->idDefaultCursor); // restore the cursor immediately
6468  }
6469 }
6470 
6471 
6472 // read-only window properties
6473 
6474 void WBGetWindowGeom0(Window wID, WB_GEOM *pGeom) // absolute window geometry (from latest notification)
6475 {
6476  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6477 
6478  if(pGeom)
6479  {
6480  if(!pEntry || (!pEntry->geomAbsolute.width && !pEntry->geomAbsolute.height))
6481  {
6482  bzero(pGeom, sizeof(*pGeom));
6483 
6484  Window wIDTemp = wID;
6485 
6486  while(wIDTemp)
6487  {
6488  WB_GEOM gm;
6489  WBGetWindowGeom(wIDTemp, &gm);
6490 
6491  pGeom->x += gm.x;
6492  pGeom->y += gm.y;
6493 
6494  if(wIDTemp == wID)
6495  {
6496  pGeom->width = gm.width;
6497  pGeom->height = gm.height;
6498  pGeom->border = gm.border;
6499 
6500  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6501  "%s - geometry for window %d (%08xH) = %d,%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
6502  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID,
6503  gm.x, gm.y, gm.width, gm.height, gm.border);
6504  }
6505  else
6506  {
6507  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6508  "%s - geometry for parent window %d (%08xH) = %d,%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
6509  __FUNCTION__, (int)wIDTemp, (int)wIDTemp,
6510  gm.x, gm.y, gm.width, gm.height, gm.border);
6511  }
6512 
6513  wIDTemp = WBGetParentWindow(wIDTemp);
6514  }
6515  }
6516  else
6517  {
6518  memcpy(pGeom, &(pEntry->geomAbsolute), sizeof(*pGeom));
6519  }
6520  }
6521 }
6522 
6523 void WBGetWindowGeom(Window wID, WB_GEOM *pGeom)
6524 {
6525  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6526  Display *pDisp = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
6527  Window winRoot = None;
6528  unsigned int uiDepth = 0;
6529 
6530  if(!pGeom)
6531  {
6532  return;
6533  }
6534 
6535 // bzero(&xwa, sizeof(xwa));
6536  bzero(pGeom, sizeof(*pGeom));
6537 
6538  if(WB_LIKELY(pEntry) &&
6539  WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry) || WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(*pEntry)))
6540  {
6541  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s:%d - %d (%08xH) NOT mapped\n",
6542  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
6543  return;
6544  }
6545 
6546  if(!pEntry)
6547  {
6548  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6549  "%s:%d - pEntry is NULL, %d (%08xH) may NOT be mapped\n",
6550  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
6551  }
6552  else if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry) &&
6553  pEntry->geomAbsolute.width > 0 && pEntry->geomAbsolute.height > 0)
6554  {
6555  // if not mapped, return the best guess geometry
6556 
6557  pGeom->x = 0; // pEntry->geomAbsolute.x;
6558  pGeom->y = 0; // pEntry->geomAbsolute.y;
6559  pGeom->width = pEntry->geomAbsolute.width;
6560  pGeom->height = pEntry->geomAbsolute.height;
6561  pGeom->border = pEntry->geomAbsolute.border;
6562 
6563  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - unmapped window geometry %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
6564  __FUNCTION__, pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height);
6565 
6566  return;
6567  }
6568 // else if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry))
6569 // {
6570 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - unmapped window, no 'absolute' GEOM available (pre 'X' calls)\n", __FUNCTION__);
6571 // }
6572 
6573  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6574  XSync(pDisp, 0);
6575  XGetGeometry(pDisp, wID, &winRoot,
6576  &(pGeom->x), &(pGeom->y),
6577  &(pGeom->width), &(pGeom->height),
6578  &(pGeom->border), &uiDepth);
6579  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6580 
6581 // if(pEntry && !WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry))
6582 // {
6583 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - unmapped window, no 'absolute' GEOM available (post 'X' calls)\n", __FUNCTION__);
6584 // }
6585 
6586 //fprintf(stderr, "XGetGeometry: window %08xH %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
6587 // wID, pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height);
6588 
6589 #if 0 /* 1 */
6590  {
6591  XWindowAttributes xwa; /* getting size of window, etc. */
6592  memset(&xwa, 0, sizeof(xwa));
6593  if(XGetWindowAttributes(pDisp, winRoot, &xwa))
6594  {
6595  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6596  "%s - window %08xH %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
6597  __FUNCTION__, winRoot, xwa.x, xwa.y, xwa.width, xwa.height);
6598 // pGeom->x = xwa.x;
6599 // pGeom->y = xwa.y;
6600 // pGeom->width = xwa.width;
6601 // pGeom->height = xwa.height;
6602 // pGeom->border = xwa.border_width;
6603  }
6604  }
6605 #endif // 0,1
6606 }
6607 
6608 void WBGetWindowGeom2(Window wID, WB_GEOM *pGeom)
6609 {
6610  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6611  Display *pDisp = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
6612  Window winRoot = 0, wParent;
6613  unsigned int uiDepth = 0;
6614  WB_GEOM geom;
6615 
6616  bzero(pGeom, sizeof(*pGeom));
6617 
6618  if(WB_LIKELY(pEntry) &&
6619  WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry) || WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(*pEntry)))
6620  {
6621  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s:%d - %d (%08xH) NOT mapped\n",
6622  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
6623  return;
6624  }
6625  else if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry) &&
6626  pEntry->geomAbsolute.width > 0 && pEntry->geomAbsolute.height > 0)
6627  {
6628  // if not mapped, return the best guess geometry
6629 
6630  pGeom->x = pEntry->geomAbsolute.x;
6631  pGeom->y = pEntry->geomAbsolute.y;
6632  pGeom->width = pEntry->geomAbsolute.width;
6633  pGeom->height = pEntry->geomAbsolute.height;
6634  pGeom->border = pEntry->geomAbsolute.border;
6635 
6636  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - unmapped window geometry %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
6637  __FUNCTION__, pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height);
6638 
6639  return;
6640  }
6641 // else if(!WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry))
6642 // {
6643 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - unmapped window, no 'absolute' GEOM available\n", __FUNCTION__);
6644 // }
6645 
6646 
6647  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6648  XGetGeometry(pDisp, wID, &winRoot,
6649  &(pGeom->x), &(pGeom->y),
6650  &(pGeom->width), &(pGeom->height),
6651  &(pGeom->border), &uiDepth);
6652  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6653 
6654  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6655  "%s - geometry for window %d (%08xH) = %d,%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
6656  __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID,
6657  pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height, pGeom->border);
6658 
6659  wParent = WBGetParentWindow(wID);
6660 
6661  while(wParent > 0 && winRoot != wParent)
6662  {
6663  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pParentEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wParent);
6664 
6665  if(WB_LIKELY(pParentEntry) &&
6666  WB_UNLIKELY(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pParentEntry) || WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(*pParentEntry)))
6667  {
6668  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s:%d - %d (%08xH) NOT mapped\n",
6669  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
6670  continue;
6671  }
6672 
6673  bzero(&geom, sizeof(geom));
6674 
6675  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6676  XGetGeometry(pDisp, wParent, &winRoot, // assumes parent windows have same display, which is reasonable
6677  &geom.x, &geom.y,
6678  &geom.width, &geom.height,
6679  &geom.border, &uiDepth);
6680  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
6681 
6682  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window,
6683  "%s - geometry for parent window %d (%08xH) = %d,%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
6684  __FUNCTION__, (int)wParent, (int)wParent,
6685  geom.x, geom.y, geom.width, geom.height, geom.border);
6686 
6687  pGeom->x += geom.x;
6688  pGeom->y += geom.y;
6689 
6690  wParent = WBGetParentWindow(wParent);
6691  }
6692 }
6693 
6694 void WBGetWindowRect(Window wID, WB_RECT *pRect)
6695 {
6696  WB_GEOM geom;
6697 
6698  if(!pRect)
6699  return;
6700 
6701  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geom);
6702 
6703  pRect->left = geom.x; // + geom.border;
6704  pRect->top = geom.y; // + geom.border; // TODO: verify
6705  pRect->right = pRect->left + geom.width + 2 * geom.border;
6706  pRect->bottom = pRect->top + geom.height + 2 * geom.border; // TODO: verify
6707 }
6708 
6709 void WBGetClientRect(Window wID, WB_RECT *pRect)
6710 {
6711  WB_GEOM geom;
6712 
6713  if(!pRect)
6714  return;
6715 
6716  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geom);
6717 
6718  // NOTE: GEOM 'border' isn't correct unless I'm trying to calculate
6719  // the size of the border surrounding a window. the client rect
6720  // will always have 0,0 as its upper left corner
6721 
6722  pRect->left = 0;// geom.border; // 0
6723  pRect->top = 0; // geom.border; // 0
6724  pRect->right = geom.width;
6725  pRect->bottom = geom.height;
6726 }
6727 
6728 void WBXlatCoordPoint(Window wIDSrc, int iXSrc, int iYSrc, Window wIDDest, int *piXDest, int *piYDest)
6729 {
6730 WB_GEOM gOrig, gXlat;
6731 
6732  if(wIDSrc == wIDDest)
6733  {
6734  if(piXDest)
6735  *piXDest = iXSrc;
6736  if(piYDest)
6737  *piYDest = iYSrc;
6738  return;
6739  }
6740 
6741  if(wIDSrc != 0) // not "root window"
6742  WBGetWindowGeom0(wIDSrc, &gOrig);
6743  else
6744  bzero(&gOrig, sizeof(gOrig));
6745 
6746  if(wIDDest != 0)
6747  WBGetWindowGeom0(wIDDest, &gXlat);
6748  else
6749  bzero(&gXlat, sizeof(gXlat));
6750 
6751 //WB_WARN_PRINT("TEMPORARY: xlat %d,%d via %d,%d %d,%d\n",
6752 // iXSrc, iYSrc, gOrig.x, gOrig.y, gXlat.x, gXlat.y);
6753 
6754  if(piXDest)
6755  *piXDest = iXSrc + gOrig.x // xlat relative to absolute position
6756  - gXlat.x; // new relative position from absolute position
6757 
6758  if(piYDest)
6759  *piYDest = iYSrc + gOrig.y
6760  - gXlat.y;
6761 }
6762 
6763 void WBXlatCoordGeom(Window wIDSrc, const WB_GEOM *pGeomSrc, Window wIDDest, WB_GEOM *pGeomDest)
6764 {
6765 WB_GEOM gOrig, gXlat;
6766 
6767  if(!pGeomSrc || !pGeomDest)
6768  return;
6769 
6770  if(wIDSrc == wIDDest)
6771  {
6772  memcpy(pGeomDest, pGeomSrc, sizeof(*pGeomDest));
6773  return;
6774  }
6775 
6776  if(wIDSrc != 0) // not "root window"
6777  WBGetWindowGeom(wIDSrc, &gOrig);
6778  else
6779  bzero(&gOrig, sizeof(gOrig));
6780 
6781  if(wIDDest != 0)
6782  WBGetWindowGeom(wIDDest, &gXlat);
6783  else
6784  bzero(&gXlat, sizeof(gXlat));
6785 
6786  pGeomDest->x = pGeomSrc->x + gOrig.x - gXlat.x;
6787  pGeomDest->y = pGeomSrc->y + gOrig.y - gXlat.y;
6788  pGeomDest->width = pGeomSrc->width;
6789  pGeomDest->height = pGeomSrc->height;
6790  pGeomDest->border = pGeomSrc->border;
6791 }
6792 
6793 void WBXlatCoordRect(Window wIDSrc, const WB_RECT *pRectSrc, Window wIDDest, WB_RECT *pRectDest)
6794 {
6795 WB_GEOM geomSrc, geomDest;
6796 
6797  if(!pRectSrc || !pRectDest)
6798  return;
6799 
6800  if(wIDSrc == wIDDest)
6801  {
6802  memcpy(pRectDest, pRectSrc, sizeof(*pRectDest));
6803  return;
6804  }
6805 
6806  geomSrc.x = pRectSrc->left;
6807  geomSrc.y = pRectSrc->top;
6808  geomSrc.width = pRectSrc->right - geomSrc.x;
6809  geomSrc.height = pRectSrc->bottom - geomSrc.y;
6810  geomSrc.border = 0;
6811 
6812  WBXlatCoordGeom(wIDSrc, &geomSrc, wIDDest, &geomDest);
6813 
6814  pRectDest->left = geomDest.x;
6815  pRectDest->right = geomDest.y;
6816  pRectDest->right = geomDest.width + geomDest.x;
6817  pRectDest->bottom = geomDest.y + geomDest.height;
6818 }
6819 
6820 int WBPointInWindow(Window wIDRef, int iX, int iY, Window wIDQuery)
6821 {
6822 WB_RECT rctDest;
6823 
6824  if(wIDRef != wIDQuery)
6825  WBXlatCoordPoint(wIDRef, iX, iY, wIDQuery, &iX, &iY);
6826 
6827  WBGetWindowRect(wIDQuery, &rctDest);
6828 
6829  return(iX >= rctDest.left && iX < rctDest.right
6830  && iY >= rctDest.top && iY < rctDest.bottom);
6831 }
6832 
6833 // keyboard mappings
6834 
6835 int WBKeyEventProcessKey(const XKeyEvent *pEvent, char *pBuf, int *pcbLen, int *piAltCtrlShift)
6836 {
6837 KeySym ks;
6838 int cRval = 0, cbLen, cbLen0 = pcbLen ? *pcbLen : 1;
6839 int iACSMask = ShiftMask | ControlMask | Mod1Mask /* | Mod2Mask | Mod3Mask | Mod4Mask | Mod5Mask */;
6840 int bKeySym = 0;
6841 
6842  // extract as much information from this keystroke as possible.
6843 
6844  iACSMask &= ((XKeyEvent *)pEvent)->state;
6845 
6846  if(piAltCtrlShift)
6847  {
6848  *piAltCtrlShift = 0;
6849  }
6850 
6851  if(!pEvent)
6852  {
6853  return -1;
6854  }
6855 
6856  if(pBuf)
6857  {
6858  cbLen = XLookupString((XKeyEvent *)pEvent, pBuf, cbLen0, &ks, NULL);
6859 
6860  if((int)ks == XK_Delete || (int)ks == XK_KP_Delete)
6861  {
6862  cbLen = 0; // force this for the delete key - sometimes it translates
6863  }
6864 
6865  // TODO: force other keys to use keycodes? maybe backspace, escape, ???
6866 
6867  if(cbLen <= 0)
6868  {
6869  *pBuf = 0;
6870  bKeySym = 1;
6871  cbLen = 0; // just in case
6872  cRval = (int)ks; // return the keysym code
6873  }
6874  else
6875  {
6876  if(cbLen < cbLen0)
6877  {
6878  pBuf[cbLen] = 0;
6879  }
6880 
6881  cRval = *pBuf; // always (for now)
6882  }
6883  if(pcbLen)
6884  {
6885  *pcbLen = cbLen;
6886  }
6887  }
6888  else
6889  {
6890  int tbuf[8]; // note: must be int aligned, that's why
6891 
6892  cbLen = XLookupString((XKeyEvent *)pEvent, (char *)tbuf, sizeof(tbuf) - 1, &ks, NULL);
6893 
6894  if(pcbLen)
6895  {
6896  *pcbLen = cbLen; // calculates actual length this way
6897  }
6898 
6899  if(cbLen <= 0)
6900  {
6901  cRval = ks; // use the scan code
6902  bKeySym = 1;
6903  }
6904  else if(cbLen == 1)
6905  {
6906  cRval = *((unsigned char *)tbuf);
6907  }
6908  else if(cbLen == 2)
6909  {
6910  cRval = *((unsigned short *)tbuf);
6911  }
6912  else if(cbLen == 4)
6913  {
6914  cRval = *((unsigned int *)tbuf);
6915  }
6916  else
6917  {
6918  cRval = *((unsigned char *)tbuf); // for now
6919  }
6920  }
6921 
6922  if(piAltCtrlShift)
6923  {
6924  *piAltCtrlShift = (bKeySym ? WB_KEYEVENT_KEYSYM : 0)
6925  | ((iACSMask & Mod1Mask) ? WB_KEYEVENT_ALT : 0)
6926  | ((iACSMask & ControlMask) ? WB_KEYEVENT_CTRL : 0)
6927  | ((iACSMask & ShiftMask) ? WB_KEYEVENT_SHIFT : 0);
6928  }
6929 
6930  return cRval;
6931 }
6932 
6933 
6934 
6935 // parent-child relationships
6936 
6937 static Window __internal_GetParent(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, Window *pwRoot)
6938 {
6939 Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDParent = 0;
6940 Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
6941 unsigned int nChildren = 0;
6942 
6943  // TODO: if parent is desktop, return 'None' ?
6944 
6945  if(XQueryTree(pDisplay, wID, &wIDRoot, &wIDParent, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
6946  {
6947  if(pwIDChildren)
6948  XFree(pwIDChildren);
6949  }
6950 
6951  if(pwRoot)
6952  {
6953  *pwRoot = wIDRoot;
6954  }
6955 
6956  return wIDParent;
6957 }
6958 
6959 Window WBGetParentWindow(Window wID)
6960 {
6961  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6962  Display *pDisplay = pEntry ? pEntry->pDisplay : pDefaultDisplay;
6963  Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDParent = 0;
6964  Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
6965  unsigned int nChildren = 0;
6966 
6967  if(pEntry && pEntry->wParent > 0)
6968  {
6969  return pEntry->wParent;
6970  }
6971 
6972  if(XQueryTree(pDisplay, wID, &wIDRoot, &wIDParent, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
6973  {
6974  if(pwIDChildren)
6975  XFree(pwIDChildren);
6976  }
6977 
6978  if(wIDParent > 0 && pEntry)
6979  {
6980  pEntry->wParent = wIDParent; // cache it
6981  }
6982 
6983  return wIDParent;
6984 }
6985 
6986 void WBSetParentWindow(Window wID, Window wIDParent)
6987 {
6988  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6989 
6990  if(pEntry)
6991  pEntry->wParent = wIDParent;
6992 }
6993 
6994 int WBReparentWindow(Window wID, Window wIDParent, int iX, int iY)
6995 {
6996  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
6997  Display *pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
6998  int iRval;
6999 
7000  if(pEntry)
7001  {
7002  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
7003  }
7004 
7005  iRval = XReparentWindow(pDisplay, wID, wIDParent, iX, iY);
7006 
7007  if(iRval < 0 && pEntry) // TODO: verify if non-zero or negative is error
7008  {
7009  pEntry->wParent = wIDParent;
7010  }
7011 
7012  return iRval;
7013 }
7014 
7015 int WBIsChildWindow(Window wIDParent, Window wIDChild)
7016 {
7017  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wIDParent);
7018  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry2 = WBGetWindowEntry(wIDChild);
7019  Display *pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
7020  Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDP = 0;
7021  Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
7022  int iRval = 0;
7023  unsigned int i1, nChildren = 0;
7024 
7025 
7026  if(wIDParent == wIDChild)
7027  return 0;
7028 
7029  if(pEntry2 && pEntry2->wParent > 0)
7030  {
7031  return pEntry2->wParent == wIDParent ? 1 : 0;
7032  }
7033 
7034 // if(!pEntry2)
7035 // {
7036 // fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: wIDChild %d (%08xH) has no entry\n", wIDChild, wIDChild);
7037 //
7038 // if(!WBIsChildWindow(DefaultRootWindow(pDisplay), wIDChild))
7039 // return 0; // not a valid window - I don't want crashes, so I do this
7040 // }
7041 
7042  if(pEntry)
7043  {
7044  if(WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(*pEntry) || WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(*pEntry))
7045  return 0; // can't determine parent/child relationship
7046 
7047  // TODO: if the window has been unmapped, I may get an error
7048  // so use some kind of flag to determine if the window was unmapped...
7049 
7050  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
7051  }
7052  else
7053  {
7054  // this window may be invalid, so check for that case
7055  if(!WBIsChildWindow(DefaultRootWindow(pDisplay), wIDParent))
7056  return 0; // not a valid window - I don't want crashes, so I do this
7057  }
7058 
7059  if(XQueryTree(pDisplay, wIDParent, &wIDRoot, &wIDP, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
7060  {
7061  for(i1=0; pwIDChildren && i1 < nChildren; i1++)
7062  {
7063  if(pwIDChildren[i1] == wIDChild)
7064  {
7065  iRval = 1;
7066  break;
7067  }
7068  }
7069 
7070  // recurse children and get their children (etc.)
7071  for(i1=0; !iRval && pwIDChildren && i1 < nChildren; i1++)
7072  {
7073  iRval = WBIsChildWindow(pwIDChildren[i1], wIDChild); // recurse to the bottom
7074  }
7075 
7076  if(pwIDChildren)
7077  XFree(pwIDChildren);
7078 
7079  return iRval;
7080  }
7081 
7082 #if 0
7083  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wIDChild);
7084  Display *pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
7085  Window wIDRoot = 0, wIDP = 0;
7086  Window *pwIDChildren = NULL;
7087  unsigned int i1, nChildren = 0;
7088 
7089  if(wIDParent == wIDChild)
7090  return 0;
7091 
7092  if(pEntry)
7093  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
7094 
7095  if(XQueryTree(pDisplay, wIDChild, &wIDRoot, &wIDP, &pwIDChildren, &nChildren))
7096  {
7097  if(pwIDChildren)
7098  XFree(pwIDChildren);
7099 
7100  if(wIDRoot == wIDParent || // check for parent = root
7101  wIDP == wIDParent) // and a direct parent/child relationship
7102  {
7103  return 1;
7104  }
7105  else if(!wIDP || wIDP == wIDRoot)
7106  {
7107  return 0;
7108  }
7109  else
7110  {
7111  return WBIsChildWindow(wIDParent, wIDP);
7112  }
7113  }
7114 #endif // 0
7115  return 0;
7116 }
7117 
7118 
7119 /**********************************************************************/
7120 /* */
7121 /* basic menu helper functions */
7122 /* */
7123 /**********************************************************************/
7124 
7125 void WBRegisterMenuCallback(Window wID, WBWinEvent pMenuCallback)
7126 {
7127  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7128 
7129  if(pEntry)
7130  {
7131  pEntry->pMenuCallback = pMenuCallback;
7132  }
7133  else
7134  {
7135  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - NULL pEntry wID = %d (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7136  }
7137 }
7138 
7139 void WBAddMenuWindow(Window wID, Window wIDMenu)
7140 {
7141  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7142 
7143  if(pEntry)
7144  {
7145  // for now there is only one
7146 
7147  pEntry->wIDMenu = wIDMenu;
7148  }
7149  else
7150  {
7151  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - NULL pEntry wID = %d (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7152  }
7153 }
7154 
7155 Window WBGetMenuWindow(Window wID)
7156 {
7157  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7158 
7159  if(pEntry)
7160  {
7161  return pEntry->wIDMenu;
7162  }
7163  else
7164  {
7165  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - NULL pEntry wID = %d (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7166  }
7167 
7168  return 0;
7169 }
7170 
7171 void WBRemoveMenuWindow(Window wID, Window wIDMenu)
7172 {
7173  int i1;
7174  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = NULL;
7175 
7176 
7177  if(wID == -1) // meaning ALL of them
7178  {
7179  for(i1=0; i1 <= WINDOW_ENTRY_ARRAY_MAX; i1++)
7180  {
7181  if(sWBHashEntries[i1].wIDMenu == wIDMenu)
7182  {
7183  sWBHashEntries[i1].wIDMenu = 0;
7184  }
7185  }
7186 
7187  return;
7188  }
7189 
7190  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7191  if(pEntry)
7192  {
7193  if(pEntry->wIDMenu == wIDMenu)
7194  {
7195  pEntry->wIDMenu = 0;
7196  }
7197  }
7198  else
7199  {
7200  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - NULL pEntry wID = %d (%08xH)\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7201  }
7202 }
7203 
7204 
7205 
7206 /**********************************************************************/
7207 /* */
7208 /* expose event (aka 'paint') helpers */
7209 /* */
7210 /**********************************************************************/
7211 
7212 void WBUpdateWindow(Window wID)
7213 {
7214  XRectangle xrct;
7215  XExposeEvent evt;
7216  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7217 
7218  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7219  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7220 
7221  if(pEntry)
7222  {
7223  if(pEntry->rgnClip == None ||
7224  XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip))
7225  {
7226 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
7227  if(pEntry->rgnClip == None) // should not happen in this case
7228  {
7229  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - clipping region is 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__);
7230  }
7231  else
7232  {
7233  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnClip, &xrct);
7234 
7235  if(xrct.width != 0 && xrct.height != 0)
7236  {
7237  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - clipping region is 'empty', but bounds = %d, %d, %d, %d\n", __FUNCTION__,
7238  xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
7239 
7240 // WBDebugDumpRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, 1);
7241  }
7242  }
7243 #endif // NO_DEBUG
7244  }
7245  else
7246  {
7247  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnClip, &xrct);
7248  // generate an 'expose' event and post it
7249 
7250  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
7251  evt.type = Expose;
7252  evt.display = pEntry->pDisplay;
7253  evt.window = wID;
7254  evt.x = xrct.x;
7255  evt.y = xrct.y;
7256  evt.width = xrct.width;
7257  evt.height = xrct.height;
7258 
7259  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7260  "%s.%d creating/handling Expose event, %d,%d,%d,%d\n",
7261  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, evt.x, evt.y, evt.width, evt.height);
7262 
7263  WBProcessExposeEvent(&evt); // better than posting it (this consolidates every Expose event for that window)
7264  // NOTE: it also calls WBInvalidateGeom() internally but NOT 'WBUpdateWindow()'
7265  // It also checks the message queue an combines *ALL* expose events that are waiting
7266  }
7267 
7268  }
7269  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7270 }
7271 
7272 void WBUpdateWindowImmediately(Window wID)
7273 {
7274  XRectangle xrct;
7275  XExposeEvent evt;
7276  XEvent evt0; // NOTE if it's too small I get a stack overflow so MUST be 'XEvent'
7277  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7278 
7279 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED || (X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP)
7280 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_MAPPED)
7281 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_BEING_DESTROYED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYING)
7282 #define WB_IS_WINDOW_DESTROYED(X) ((X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED || (X).iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DELETE)
7283 
7284  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7285  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7286  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7287 
7288  if(pEntry &&
7289  WB_IS_WINDOW_MAPPED(*pEntry) &&
7290  pEntry->rgnClip != None && !XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip))
7291  {
7292  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7293  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnClip, &xrct);
7294  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7295 
7296  // generate an 'expose' event and post it
7297 
7298  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
7299  evt.type = Expose;
7300  evt.display = pEntry->pDisplay;
7301  evt.window = wID;
7302  evt.x = xrct.x;
7303  evt.y = xrct.y;
7304  evt.width = xrct.width;
7305  evt.height = xrct.height;
7306 
7307  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7308  "%s.%d creating/handling Expose event, %d,%d,%d,%d\n",
7309  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, evt.x, evt.y, evt.width, evt.height);
7310 
7311  WBInternalProcessExposeEvent(&evt); // better than posting it (this consolidates every Expose event for that window)
7312  // NOTE: it also calls WBInvalidateGeom() internally but NOT 'WBUpdateWindow()'
7313 
7314  if(__WBNextPaintEvent(pEntry->pDisplay, &evt0, wID) >= 0) // grab the 'combined' paint event from the queue
7315  {
7316  WBWindowDispatch(wID, &evt0); // send "combined painting" message synchronously
7317  }
7318  else
7319  {
7320  WBWindowDispatch(wID, (XEvent *)&evt); // send message synchronously
7321  }
7322  }
7323 }
7324 
7325 void WBInvalidateGeom(Window wID, const WB_GEOM *pGeom, int bPaintNow)
7326 {
7327  WB_GEOM geom;
7328  XRectangle xrct;
7329 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
7330  XRectangle xrct2;
7331 #endif // NO_DEBUG
7332 
7333  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7334 
7335  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7336  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7337 
7338  if(pEntry)
7339  {
7340  if(!pGeom)
7341  {
7342  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geom);
7343  geom.x = geom.y = geom.border; // always use coordinates relative to window origin (0,0)
7344  pGeom = &geom;
7345 
7346  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7347  "%s.%d - NULL pGeom, %d,%d,%d,%d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
7348  pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height);
7349  }
7350  else
7351  {
7352  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7353  "%s.%d - %d,%d,%d,%d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
7354  pGeom->x, pGeom->y, pGeom->width, pGeom->height);
7355  }
7356 
7357  // NOTE: XRectangle doesn't encompass the full range of x,y,width,height - limited to 16-bit values
7358 
7359  xrct.x = (short)pGeom->x;
7360  xrct.y = (short)pGeom->y;
7361  xrct.width = (unsigned short)pGeom->width;
7362  xrct.height = (unsigned short)pGeom->height;
7363 
7364  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7365  {
7366  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion();
7367  }
7368 
7369  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
7370  {
7371  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip);
7372 
7373  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7374  "%s.%d - resulting invalid rect: %d,%d,%d,%d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
7375  xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
7376 
7377  if(WBCheckDebugLevel(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose))
7378  {
7379  XRectangle xrct;
7380 
7381  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7382  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnClip, &xrct);
7383  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7384 
7385  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s.%d - Bounding rectangle of new invalid region: %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
7386  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
7387 
7388 // WBDebugDumpRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, 1);
7389  }
7390 
7391  if(bPaintNow)
7392  {
7393  WBUpdateWindow(wID);
7394  }
7395  }
7396  }
7397  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7398 }
7399 
7400 void WBInvalidateRegion(Window wID, Region rgn, int bPaintFlag)
7401 {
7402 // WB_GEOM geom;
7403 
7404  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7405 
7406  if(rgn == None)
7407  {
7408  WBInvalidateGeom(wID, NULL, bPaintFlag);
7409  return;
7410  }
7411 
7412  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7413  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7414  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7415 
7416  if(pEntry)
7417  {
7418  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7419  {
7420  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion();
7421  }
7422 
7423  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
7424  {
7425  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7426  XUnionRegion(rgn, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip);
7427  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7428 
7429  if(bPaintFlag)
7430  {
7431  WBUpdateWindow(wID);
7432  }
7433 
7434  if(WBCheckDebugLevel(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose))
7435  {
7436  XRectangle xrct;
7437 
7438  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7439  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnClip, &xrct);
7440  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7441 
7442  // use WB_ERROR_PRINT since it avoids the test for debug level
7443  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s.%d - Bounding rectangle of new invalid region: %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
7444  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
7445 
7446 // WBDebugDumpRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, 1);
7447  }
7448  }
7449  else
7450  {
7451  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s.%d - unable to create clipping region\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
7452  }
7453  }
7454 }
7455 
7456 void WBValidateGeom(Window wID, const WB_GEOM *pGeom)
7457 {
7458 // WB_GEOM geom;
7459  Region rgnTemp;
7460  XRectangle xrct;
7461  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry;
7462 
7463  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7464 
7465  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7466  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7467  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7468 
7469  if(pEntry)
7470  {
7471  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7472  {
7473  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion(); // put an empty one there
7474 
7475  return;
7476  }
7477 
7478  if(!pGeom) // validate everything
7479  {
7480  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
7481  {
7482  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7483  XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
7484  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7485  }
7486 
7487  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion(); // put an empty one there
7488 
7489  return;
7490  }
7491 
7492  xrct.x = (short)pGeom->x;
7493  xrct.y = (short)pGeom->y;
7494  xrct.width = (unsigned short)pGeom->width;
7495  xrct.height = (unsigned short)pGeom->height;
7496 
7497  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7498  rgnTemp = XCreateRegion();
7499  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7500 
7501  if(!rgnTemp)
7502  {
7503  return; // oops (error)
7504  }
7505 
7506  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7507  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, rgnTemp, rgnTemp);
7508  XSubtractRegion(rgnTemp, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip);
7509 
7510  XDestroyRegion(rgnTemp);
7511 
7512  if(XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip)) // if it's empty, destroy it
7513  {
7514  // now I leave the empty region alone
7515  }
7516 
7517  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7518  }
7519 }
7520 
7521 void WBValidateRegion(Window wID, Region rgn)
7522 {
7523  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry;
7524 
7525  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7526 
7527  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7528  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7529  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7530 
7531  if(pEntry)
7532  {
7533  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7534  {
7535  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion(); // put an empty one there
7536 
7537  return;
7538  }
7539 
7540  if(rgn == None) // validate everything
7541  {
7542  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
7543  {
7544  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7545  XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
7546  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7547  }
7548 
7549  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion(); // put an empty one there
7550 
7551  return;
7552  }
7553 
7554  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7555  XSubtractRegion(rgn, pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnClip);
7556  if(XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip))
7557  {
7558  // now I leave the empty region alone
7559  }
7560  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7561  }
7562 }
7563 
7564 Region WBGetInvalidRegion(Window wID)
7565 {
7566  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7567 
7568  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7569  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7570  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7571 
7572  if(pEntry && pEntry->rgnClip)
7573  {
7574  int iRet;
7575 
7576  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7577  iRet = XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
7578  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7579 
7580  if(iRet)
7581  {
7582  return None;
7583  }
7584  else
7585  {
7586  Region rgnRval = XCreateRegion();
7587 
7588  if(rgnRval == None)
7589  {
7590  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no region created\n", __FUNCTION__);
7591  }
7592  else
7593  {
7594  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7595  XUnionRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, rgnRval, rgnRval);
7596  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7597  }
7598 
7599  return rgnRval;
7600  }
7601  }
7602 
7603  return None;
7604 }
7605 
7606 Region WBGetPaintRegion(Window wID)
7607 {
7608  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7609 
7610  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7611  XFlush(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID));
7612  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7613 
7614  if(pEntry && pEntry->rgnPaint)
7615  {
7616  Region rgnRval = XCreateRegion();
7617 
7618  if(rgnRval == None)
7619  {
7620  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no region created\n", __FUNCTION__);
7621  }
7622  else
7623  {
7624  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7625  XUnionRegion(pEntry->rgnPaint, rgnRval, rgnRval);
7626  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7627  }
7628 
7629  return rgnRval;
7630  }
7631 
7632  return None;
7633 }
7634 
7635 Region WBCopyRegion(Region rgnSource)
7636 {
7637 Region rgnRval;
7638 
7639  if((CARD32)(intptr_t)rgnSource & 0xe0000000) // see man page for XGetGCValues and the implication of invalid XIDs
7640  {
7641  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - invalid source region %d (%08xH), no region created\n",
7642  __FUNCTION__, (int)(intptr_t)rgnSource, (int)(intptr_t)rgnSource);
7643 
7644  return NULL;
7645  }
7646 
7647  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7648  rgnRval = XCreateRegion();
7649  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7650 
7651  if(rgnRval == None)
7652  {
7653  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - unable to create region\n", __FUNCTION__);
7654  }
7655  else
7656  {
7657  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7658  XUnionRegion(rgnSource, rgnRval, rgnRval);
7659  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7660  }
7661 
7662  return rgnRval;
7663 }
7664 
7665 Region WBRectToRegion(const WB_RECT *pRect)
7666 {
7667 XRectangle xrct;
7668 Region rgnRval;
7669 
7670  if(!pRect)
7671  {
7672  return None;
7673  }
7674 
7675  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7676  rgnRval = XCreateRegion();
7677  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7678 
7679  if(rgnRval == None)
7680  {
7681  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no region created\n", __FUNCTION__);
7682  }
7683  else
7684  {
7685  xrct.x = (short)pRect->left;
7686  xrct.y = (short)pRect->top;
7687  xrct.width = (unsigned short)(pRect->right - pRect->left);
7688  xrct.height = (unsigned short)(pRect->bottom - pRect->top);
7689 
7690  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7691  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, rgnRval, rgnRval);
7692  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7693  }
7694 
7695  return rgnRval;
7696 }
7697 
7698 Region WBGeomToRegion(const WB_GEOM *pGeom)
7699 {
7700 XRectangle xrct;
7701 Region rgnRval;
7702 
7703  if(!pGeom)
7704  {
7705  return None;
7706  }
7707 
7708  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7709  rgnRval = XCreateRegion();
7710  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7711 
7712  if(rgnRval == None)
7713  {
7714  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no region created\n", __FUNCTION__);
7715  }
7716  else
7717  {
7718  xrct.x = (short)pGeom->x;
7719  xrct.y = (short)pGeom->y;
7720  xrct.width = (unsigned short)pGeom->width;
7721  xrct.height = (unsigned short)pGeom->height;
7722 
7723  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7724  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, rgnRval, rgnRval);
7725  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7726  }
7727 
7728  return rgnRval;
7729 }
7730 
7731 // paint helpers
7732 
7733 WBGC WBBeginPaint(Window wID, XExposeEvent *pEvent, WB_GEOM *pgBounds)
7734 {
7735 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7736 WB_GEOM geomTemp;
7737 WBGC gcRval;
7738 int iRet;
7739 
7740 
7741  if(!pEvent || pEvent->type != Expose || !pEntry)
7742  {
7743  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7744  "%s.%d - returning None (bad parameter)\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
7745  return None;
7746  }
7747 
7748  geomTemp.x = pEvent->x;
7749  geomTemp.y = pEvent->y;
7750  geomTemp.width = pEvent->width;
7751  geomTemp.height = pEvent->height;
7752 
7753  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7754  iRet = XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
7755  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7756 
7757  if(iRet)
7758  {
7759  geomTemp.x = geomTemp.y = geomTemp.width = geomTemp.height = 0;
7760  gcRval = NULL; // nothing to paint
7761 
7762  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7763  "%s.%d - returning NULL (nothing to paint)\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
7764  }
7765  else
7766  {
7767  gcRval = WBBeginPaintGeom(wID, &geomTemp);
7768 
7769  if(gcRval && pgBounds)
7770  {
7771  pgBounds->x = geomTemp.x;
7772  pgBounds->y = geomTemp.y;
7773  pgBounds->width = geomTemp.width;
7774  pgBounds->height = geomTemp.height;
7775  }
7776  }
7777 
7778  return gcRval;
7779 }
7780 
7781 WBGC WBBeginPaintGeom(Window wID, WB_GEOM *pgBounds) // WBGC will get the 'invalid' region assigned as clip region
7782 {
7783  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7784  WBGC gcRval;
7785  Region rgnPaint;
7786  XRectangle xrct;
7787  int iRet;
7788 
7789 
7790  if(!pEntry || !pgBounds)
7791  {
7792  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s.%d - invalid parameters\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
7793 
7794  return NULL;
7795  }
7796 
7797  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7798  XSync(WBGetWindowDisplay(wID), 0);
7799  if(pEntry->rgnClip)
7800  {
7801  iRet = XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
7802  }
7803  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7804 
7805  if(!pEntry->rgnClip || iRet) // clipping region is empty?
7806  {
7807  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7808  {
7809  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7810  "%s.%d - no clip region (returning NULL)\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
7811  }
7812  else // if(pBounds)
7813  {
7814  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7815  "%s.%d - empty clip region - bounds = %d,%d,%d,%d (returning NULL)\n",
7816  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, pgBounds->x, pgBounds->y, pgBounds->width, pgBounds->height);
7817  }
7818 
7819  // NOTE: If I'm in the middle of painting, *AND* the region is empty, then additional 'Expose'
7820  // handlers might call this function. I need to gracefully allow the empty region
7821 
7822  if(!pEntry->rgnClip)
7823  {
7824  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7825  pEntry->rgnClip = XCreateRegion(); // create an empty region
7826  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7827  }
7828 
7829  return NULL; // don't return a WBGC - no need to paint
7830  }
7831 
7832  gcRval = WBCopyGC(pEntry->hGC);
7833 
7834  if(!gcRval)
7835  {
7836  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - * BUG * at line %d - unable to copy GC for window %d (%08xH)\n",
7837  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7838 
7839  // it's checked again, but I need to flow through to the next part
7840  }
7841 
7842  // using pEntry->rgnClip create a paint region
7843  // that intersects with the paint area
7844 
7845  if(pEntry->rgnPaint)
7846  {
7847  WB_WARN_PRINT("%s - * BUG * at line %d - non-zero paint region for window %d (%08xH)\n",
7848  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7849 
7850  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7851  XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnPaint);
7852  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7853 
7854  pEntry->rgnPaint = None;
7855  }
7856 
7857  if(gcRval)
7858  {
7859  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7860  rgnPaint = XCreateRegion();
7861  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7862 
7863  if(rgnPaint)
7864  {
7865  Region rgnTemp = XCreateRegion();
7866 
7867  if(!rgnTemp)
7868  {
7869  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7870  XDestroyRegion(rgnPaint);
7871  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7872 
7873  rgnPaint = None;
7874 
7875  WBFreeGC(gcRval);
7876  gcRval = NULL;
7877 
7878  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - could not create clip region\n", __FUNCTION__);
7879  }
7880  else
7881  {
7882  // combine specified region with clipping region. result is new paint region
7883  xrct.x = pgBounds->x;
7884  xrct.y = pgBounds->y;
7885  xrct.width = pgBounds->width;
7886  xrct.height = pgBounds->height;
7887 
7888  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7889  XUnionRectWithRegion(&xrct, rgnTemp, rgnTemp); // the paint rectangle as a region
7890  XUnionRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, rgnPaint, rgnPaint); // a copy of the invalid region
7891  XIntersectRegion(rgnTemp, rgnPaint, rgnPaint); // INTERSECT with xrct (usually from the Expose event)
7892 
7893  // so now the paint region includes the intersect of the xrct passed as 'pgBounds' with the invalid region
7894  // (if called by WBBeginPaint, 'pgBounds' will be the rectangular area from the Expose event)
7895 
7896  XDestroyRegion(rgnTemp);
7897  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7898  }
7899  }
7900 
7901  if(rgnPaint) // using this as a flag, of sorts - could also use 'gcRval'
7902  {
7903  // by default we clip children so I must enumerate them now
7904  // for those that are visible, clip their rectangles out of
7905  // the paint region.
7906 
7907  // TDDO: clip children
7908 
7909 
7910  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7911  iRet = XEmptyRegion(rgnPaint);
7912  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7913 
7914  if(iRet) // it's empty - return NULL
7915  {
7916  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7917  XDestroyRegion(rgnPaint);
7918  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7919 
7920  WBFreeGC(gcRval);
7921 
7922  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7923  "%s.%d - empty paint region - returning NULL gcRval for window %d (%08xH)\n",
7924  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7925 
7926  return NULL;
7927  }
7928 
7929  pEntry->rgnPaint = rgnPaint;
7930 
7931  // gcRval is always NOT-NULL here
7932 
7933  // assign the clipping region to the GC
7934 
7935  WBSetClipOrigin(gcRval, 0, 0);
7936  WBSetRegion(gcRval, rgnPaint);
7937  }
7938  }
7939 
7940  if(gcRval != NULL /*&& pgBounds*/) // pgBounds is ALWAYS 'NOT NULL'
7941  {
7942  // get the 'bounds' from the expose event
7943  // and intersect them. This should prevent me from re-painting several times
7944 
7945  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7946  XClipBox(rgnPaint, &xrct);
7947  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7948 
7949  pgBounds->x = xrct.x;
7950  pgBounds->y = xrct.y;
7951  pgBounds->width = xrct.width;
7952  pgBounds->height = xrct.height;
7953  pgBounds->border = 0;
7954 
7955 
7956  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7957  "%s.%d - bounds=%d,%d,%d,%d\n",
7958  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
7959  xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
7960  }
7961 
7962  if(gcRval == NULL)
7963  {
7964  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_WARN | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
7965  "%s.%d - returning NULL gcRval for window %d (%08xH)\n",
7966  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)wID, (int)wID);
7967  }
7968 
7969  return gcRval;
7970 }
7971 
7972 void WBClearWindow(Window wID, WBGC gc)
7973 {
7974 unsigned long clrFG, clrBG;
7975 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
7976 Display *pDisplay;
7977 XRectangle xrct;
7978 
7979 
7980  if(!pEntry || pEntry->rgnPaint == None)
7981  {
7982  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - WBClearWindow with no paint region\n", __FUNCTION__);
7983 
7984  return; // for now don't do anything
7985  }
7986 
7987  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay; // cache it
7988 
7989  clrFG = WBGetGCFGColor(gc);
7990  clrBG = WBGetGCBGColor(gc);
7991 
7992  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7993  XClipBox(pEntry->rgnPaint, &xrct);
7994  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
7995 
7997 // if(xrct.x < 0 || xrct.y < 0 ||
7998 // xrct.width > pEntry->width ||
7999 // xrct.height > pEntry->height)
8000 // {
8001 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - rect exceeds window bounds (%d, %d, %d, %d)\n", __FUNCTION__,
8002 // xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.x + xrct.width, xrct.y + xrct.height);
8003 // }
8004 // else
8005 // {
8006 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - filling rect (%d, %d, %d, %d)\n", __FUNCTION__,
8007 // xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.x + xrct.width, xrct.y + xrct.height);
8008 // }
8010 
8011 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8012 //
8013 // // use XClearArea first (this should refresh what was there before if 'covered up')
8014 // XClearArea(pDisplay, wID, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height, False);
8015 //
8016 // END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8017 
8018  // now erase the background according to the clip rectangle
8019 
8020 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8021  WBSetForeground(gc, clrBG);
8022 
8023  if(xrct.width > 0 && xrct.height > 0)
8024  {
8025 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - clearing window %08xH geom %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
8026 // __FUNCTION__, (WB_UINT32)wID, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
8027 
8028  WBFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
8029  }
8030 
8031  WBSetForeground(gc, clrFG);
8032 }
8033 
8034 void WBEndPaint(Window wID, WBGC gc)
8035 {
8036  // validate the paint region and remove it from the 'invalid' region
8037 
8038  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8039 
8040  if(pEntry->rgnClip != None)
8041  {
8042  if(pEntry->pImage)
8043  {
8044  // for now update with everything; later, just update the modified rgnPaint paint region?
8045  // (it would have to be an intersection between the paint region and the clipping region)
8046 
8047  WBUpdateWindowWithImage(pEntry->pDisplay, wID);
8048  }
8049 
8050  if(pEntry->rgnPaint != None)
8051  {
8052  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8053  XSubtractRegion(pEntry->rgnClip, pEntry->rgnPaint, pEntry->rgnClip);
8054  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8055 
8056 // TODO: should I leave the empty region anyway, or not? leaving it might work better...
8057 //
8058 // if(XEmptyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip))
8059 // {
8060 // XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
8061 // pEntry->rgnClip = None;
8062 // }
8063 
8064 // some debugging code
8065 //
8066 // {
8067 // XRectangle xrct;
8068 //
8069 // BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8070 // XClipBox(pEntry->rgnPaint, &xrct);
8071 // END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8072 //
8073 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - new clip region, window %08xH geom %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
8074 // __FUNCTION__, (WB_UINT32)wID, xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width, xrct.height);
8075 // }
8076  }
8077  else // destroy clip region if paint region is 'None'
8078  {
8079  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no paint region\n", __FUNCTION__);
8080 
8081 // XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnClip);
8082 // pEntry->rgnClip = None;
8083  }
8084  }
8085  else
8086  {
8087  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no clip region\n", __FUNCTION__);
8088  }
8089 
8090  if(pEntry->rgnPaint != None)
8091  {
8092  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8093  XDestroyRegion(pEntry->rgnPaint);
8094  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8095 
8096  pEntry->rgnPaint = None;
8097  }
8098 
8099  if(gc)
8100  {
8101  WBFreeGC(gc);
8102  }
8103 }
8104 
8105 
8106 /**********************************************************************/
8107 /* */
8108 /* Cached XImage handling for paint and graphics */
8109 /* */
8110 /**********************************************************************/
8111 
8112 // POOBAH
8113 XImage *WBGetWindowImage(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
8114 {
8115 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8116 
8117  if(!pEntry || pEntry->iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED) // so that there is no attempt to use the window
8118  {
8119  return NULL;
8120  }
8121 
8122  if(pEntry->iFlags & WBCreateWindow_flagsNoImageCache)
8123  {
8124  return NULL; // always
8125  }
8126 
8127 #ifdef USE_WINDOW_XIMAGE
8128  if(!disable_imagecache && !(pEntry->pImage)) // this allows me to do a 'soft disable' of the image cache
8129  {
8130  Window winRoot = None;
8131  int iX0=0, iY0=0;
8132  unsigned int iWidth0=0, iHeight0=0, iBorder;
8133  unsigned int uiDepth = 0;
8134 
8135  if(!pDisplay)
8136  {
8137  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
8138  if(!pDisplay)
8139  {
8140  pDisplay = WBGetDefaultDisplay();
8141  }
8142  }
8143 
8144  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8145  XGetGeometry(pDisplay, wID, &winRoot, &iX0, &iY0, &iWidth0, &iHeight0, &iBorder, &uiDepth);
8146 
8147  // TODO: if the window has never been painted, create a blank pixmap and fill with the background color
8148  // It may also be possible (for a completely invalid window) to erase its pixmap and then create
8149  // a 'blank' one of the appropriate size without grabbing the bits off of the X server
8150 
8151  pEntry->pImage = WBXGetImage(pDisplay, wID, 0, 0, iWidth0, iHeight0, 0xffffffff, ZPixmap);
8152  // NOTE: this may fail if part of the window extends past the screen size. In those cases, it may
8153  // be necessary to 'fudge' it a bit.
8154  // TODO: test for and handle this condition
8155  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8156 
8157  // NOTE: the XImage has width and height members indicating such. when window is re-sized, these can be
8158  // compared, and if the new window size is larger than the pixmap (or just different) either a
8159  // new pixmap can be derived from the old one, or it can simply be deleted and re-created when needed.
8160  }
8161 #endif // USE_WINDOW_XIMAGE
8162 
8163  return pEntry->pImage;
8164 }
8165 
8166 
8167 int WBAssignWindowImage(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, XImage *pImage)
8168 {
8169 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8170 
8171 
8172  if(!pEntry || (pEntry->iFlags & WBCreateWindow_flagsNoImageCache))
8173  {
8174  return -1; // not using an image, can't assign one
8175  }
8176 
8177 
8178  return -1; // for now
8179 }
8180 
8181 
8182 int WBCopyIntoWindowImage(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, XImage *pSrcImage,
8183  int xSrc, int ySrc, int width, int height,
8184  int xOffs, int yOffs)
8185 {
8186 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8187 
8188 
8189  if(!pEntry || (pEntry->iFlags & WBCreateWindow_flagsNoImageCache))
8190  {
8191  return -1; // not using an image, can't assign one nor copy
8192  // TODO: handle this situation using a Pixmap and copy to window instead??
8193  }
8194 
8195 
8196  return -1; // for now
8197 }
8198 
8199 
8200 void WBUpdateWindowWithImage(Display *pDisplay, Window wID)
8201 {
8202 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8203 
8204  // TODO: see __internalDoAntiAlias in draw_text.c for similar operations
8205 
8206  if(!pEntry || pEntry->iWindowState == WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED) // so that there is no attempt to use the window
8207  {
8208  if(!pEntry)
8209  {
8210  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: %s - no 'window entry' for Window %d (%08xH)\n",
8211  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID);
8212  }
8213  else
8214  {
8215  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium, "WARNING: %s - NOT updating 'destroyed' Window %d (%08xH)\n",
8216  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID);
8217  }
8218 
8219  return;
8220  }
8221 
8222  // use the current (default) graphics context. if not valid, fail.
8223  // TODO: make a copy and ONLY update the current 'invalid' region instead??
8224  // this might actually speed things up a LOT
8225 
8226  if(pEntry->hGC == None) // no default GC - can't do this
8227  {
8228  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light, "WARNING: %s - no GC for Window %d (%08xH)\n",
8229  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID);
8230  return;
8231  }
8232 
8233  if(!(pEntry->pImage))
8234  {
8235  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: %s - no XImage for %d (%08xH) - this should never happen\n",
8236  __FUNCTION__, (unsigned int)wID, (unsigned int)wID);
8237  }
8238  else
8239  {
8240  Window winRoot = None;
8241  int iX0=0, iY0=0;
8242  unsigned int iWidth0=0, iHeight0=0, iBorder;
8243  unsigned int uiDepth = 0;
8244 
8245  if(!pDisplay)
8246  {
8247  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
8248  if(!pDisplay)
8249  {
8250  pDisplay = WBGetDefaultDisplay();
8251  }
8252  }
8253 
8254  BEGIN_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8255  // TODO: always use cached information from pEntry ???
8256  XGetGeometry(pDisplay, wID, &winRoot, &iX0, &iY0, &iWidth0, &iHeight0, &iBorder, &uiDepth);
8257  END_XCALL_DEBUG_WRAPPER
8258 
8259  // if the image size is too small, reduce width and height accordingly
8260 
8261  if(WB_UNLIKELY(pEntry->pImage->width < iWidth0))
8262  {
8263  iWidth0 = pEntry->pImage->width;
8264  }
8265 
8266  if(WB_UNLIKELY(pEntry->pImage->height < iHeight0))
8267  {
8268  iHeight0 = pEntry->pImage->height;
8269  }
8270 
8271  // TODO: limit the update to the bounding rectangle of the invalid/clipping region. This
8272  // might be fastest. But, when the invalid/clip region is empty, do it ALL.
8273 
8274  WBXPutImage(pDisplay, wID, pEntry->hGC, pEntry->pImage, 0, 0, iX0, iY0, iWidth0, iHeight0);
8275  // NOTE: this process should be very fast by comparison to getting the image from the drawable (window)
8276  }
8277 }
8278 
8279 
8280 
8281 /**********************************************************************/
8282 /* */
8283 /* internal event queue processing */
8284 /* */
8285 /**********************************************************************/
8286 
8287 static void __WBInitEvent()
8288 {
8289  int i1;
8290 
8291  if(iInitEventFlag)
8292  {
8293  return; // already done
8294  }
8295 
8296  iInitEventFlag = 1;
8297 
8298  // initialize the 'free' event pool, and all of the other event queue entries
8299 
8300  iWBFreeEvent = 0;
8301  for(i1=1; i1 < EVENT_ARRAY_SIZE; i1++)
8302  {
8303  axWBEvt[i1 - 1].iNext = i1;
8304  }
8305 
8306  axWBEvt[EVENT_ARRAY_SIZE - 1].iNext = -1; // end of chain
8307  iWBQueuedEvent = iWBQueueLast = -1; // because the queue is empty
8308  iWBPaintEvent = iWBPaintLast = -1; // same here
8309 }
8310 
8311 
8312 static int __WBAddEvent(Display *pDisp, Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
8313 {
8314  int iEvent = -1;
8315  // TODO: synchronization objects?
8316 
8317  if(!iInitEventFlag)
8318  {
8319  __WBInitEvent();
8320  }
8321 
8322  if(iWBFreeEvent < 0) // none left
8323  {
8324  return -1;
8325  }
8326 
8327  if(pEvent->type == Expose)
8328  {
8329  WBProcessExposeEvent((XExposeEvent *)pEvent);
8330  }
8331 
8332  iEvent = iWBFreeEvent;
8333  iWBFreeEvent = axWBEvt[iWBFreeEvent].iNext; // new 'free' pointer
8334  axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext = -1; // mark the end of the 'iEvent's entry
8335 
8336  // add to iWBQueuedEvent linked list
8337 
8338  if(iWBQueuedEvent < 0)
8339  {
8340  iWBQueuedEvent = iEvent;
8341  iWBQueueLast = iEvent;
8342  }
8343  else
8344  {
8345  if(iWBQueueLast < 0)
8346  {
8347  // traverse the queue
8348  iWBQueueLast = iWBQueuedEvent;
8349  while(axWBEvt[iWBQueueLast].iNext != -1)
8350  {
8351  iWBQueueLast = axWBEvt[iWBQueueLast].iNext;
8352  }
8353  }
8354 
8355  axWBEvt[iWBQueueLast].iNext = iEvent;
8356  iWBQueueLast = iEvent;
8357  }
8358 
8359  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay = pDisp;
8360  axWBEvt[iEvent].wID = wID;
8361  memcpy(&(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt), pEvent, sizeof(XEvent));
8362 
8363  return 0; // success
8364 }
8365 
8366 static void __WBDelWindowPaintEvents(Display *pDisp, Window wID)
8367 {
8368  int iEvent, iPrev, iTemp;
8369  XEvent event;
8370 
8371  if(iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8372  {
8373  return;
8374  }
8375 
8376  iEvent = iWBPaintEvent;
8377  iPrev = -1;
8378 
8379  while(iEvent >= 0)
8380  {
8381  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].wID == wID &&
8382  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay == pDisp)
8383  {
8384  if(iPrev < 0)
8385  {
8386  iWBPaintEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from head
8387  if(iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8388  {
8389  iWBPaintLast = -1;
8390  }
8391  }
8392  else
8393  {
8394  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from chain
8395  if(axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext < 0)
8396  {
8397  iWBPaintLast = iPrev;
8398  }
8399  }
8400 
8401  iTemp = iEvent;
8402 
8403  // add 'iEvent' to the chain of free events
8404  iEvent = axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext;
8405  axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext = iWBFreeEvent;
8406  iWBFreeEvent = iTemp;
8407  }
8408  else
8409  {
8410  iPrev = iEvent;
8411  iEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext;
8412  }
8413  }
8414 
8415  XSync(pDisp, 0);
8416 
8417  // now the X events (remove them from the queue)
8418  while(XCheckWindowEvent(pDisp, wID, ExposureMask, &event))
8419  ;
8420 }
8421 
8422 static void __WBDelWindowEvents(Display *pDisp, Window wID)
8423 {
8424  int iEvent, iPrev, iTemp;
8425  XEvent event;
8426 
8427 // if(iWBQueuedEvent < 0 && iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8428 // {
8429 // return;
8430 // }
8431 
8432  // traverse iWBQueuedEvent
8433 
8434  iEvent = iWBQueuedEvent;
8435  iPrev = -1;
8436  while(iEvent >= 0)
8437  {
8438  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].wID == wID &&
8439  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay == pDisp)
8440  {
8441  if(iPrev < 0)
8442  {
8443  iWBQueuedEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from head
8444  if(iWBQueuedEvent < 0)
8445  {
8446  iWBQueueLast = -1;
8447  }
8448  }
8449  else
8450  {
8451  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from chain
8452  if(axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext < 0)
8453  {
8454  iWBQueueLast = iPrev;
8455  }
8456  }
8457 
8458  iTemp = iEvent;
8459 
8460  // add 'iEvent' to the chain of free events
8461  iEvent = axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext;
8462  axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext = iWBFreeEvent;
8463  iWBFreeEvent = iTemp;
8464  }
8465  else
8466  {
8467  iPrev = iEvent;
8468  iEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext;
8469  }
8470  }
8471 
8472  // NOW traverse iWBPaintEvent
8473 
8474  iEvent = iWBPaintEvent;
8475  iPrev = -1;
8476  while(iEvent >= 0)
8477  {
8478  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].wID == wID &&
8479  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay == pDisp)
8480  {
8481  if(iPrev < 0)
8482  {
8483  iWBPaintEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from head
8484  if(iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8485  {
8486  iWBPaintLast = -1;
8487  }
8488  }
8489  else
8490  {
8491  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext; // remove from chain
8492  if(axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext < 0)
8493  {
8494  iWBPaintLast = iPrev;
8495  }
8496  }
8497 
8498  iTemp = iEvent;
8499 
8500  // add 'iEvent' to the chain of free events
8501  iEvent = axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext;
8502  axWBEvt[iTemp].iNext = iWBFreeEvent;
8503  iWBFreeEvent = iTemp;
8504  }
8505  else
8506  {
8507  iPrev = iEvent;
8508  iEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext;
8509  }
8510  }
8511 
8512 // do XSync and exit
8513 
8514  XSync(pDisp, 0);
8515 
8516  // now the X 'expose' events (remove them from the queue)
8517  while(XCheckWindowEvent(pDisp, wID, EVENT_ALL_MASK, &event))
8518  ;
8519 
8520 // XSync(pDisp);
8521 //
8522 // // the X events again
8523 // while(XCheckWindowEvent(pDisp, wID, EVENT_ALL_MASK, &event))
8524 // ;
8525 }
8526 
8527 static int __WBInsertPriorityEvent(Display *pDisp, Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
8528 {
8529  int iEvent = -1;
8530  // TODO: synchronization objects?
8531 
8532  if(!iInitEventFlag)
8533  {
8534  __WBInitEvent();
8535  }
8536 
8537  if(iWBFreeEvent < 0) // none left
8538  {
8539  return -1;
8540  }
8541 
8542 // TODO: do I do something different for Expose events?
8543 // if(pEvent->type == Expose)
8544 // WBProcessExposeEvent((XExposeEvent *)pEvent);
8545 
8546  iEvent = iWBFreeEvent;
8547  iWBFreeEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext;
8548  axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext = -1; // the end
8549 
8550  // add to iWBQueuedEvent linked list
8551 
8552  if(iWBQueuedEvent < 0)
8553  {
8554  iWBQueuedEvent = iEvent;
8555  iWBQueueLast = iEvent;
8556  }
8557  else
8558  {
8559  int iTempEvent = iWBQueuedEvent;
8560 
8561  // insert at the beginning of the chain
8562  iWBQueuedEvent = iEvent;
8563  axWBEvt[iWBQueuedEvent].iNext = iTempEvent;
8564  }
8565 
8566  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay = pDisp;
8567  axWBEvt[iEvent].wID = wID;
8568  memcpy(&(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt), pEvent, sizeof(XEvent));
8569 
8570  return 0;
8571 }
8572 
8573 static int __WBNextPaintEvent(Display *pDisp, XEvent *pEvent, Window wID)
8574 {
8575  int iRval = iWBPaintEvent, iPrev = -1;
8576 
8577  while(iRval >= 0)
8578  {
8579  if(WB_LIKELY(axWBEvt[iRval].pDisplay == pDisp) &&
8580  (WB_LIKELY(wID == None) || axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.xany.window == wID))
8581  {
8582  break;
8583  }
8584 
8585  iPrev = iRval;
8586  iRval = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8587  }
8588 
8589  if(iRval >= 0)
8590  {
8591  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
8592  "%s - getting an EXPOSE event for %d (%08xH)\n",
8593  __FUNCTION__,
8594  (int)axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.xany.window,
8595  (int)axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.xany.window);
8596 
8597  if(iRval == iWBPaintEvent)
8598  {
8599  iWBPaintEvent = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8600  }
8601  else
8602  {
8603  if(iRval == iWBPaintLast)
8604  {
8605  iWBPaintLast = iPrev;
8606  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = -1;
8607  }
8608  else if(iPrev >= 0)
8609  {
8610  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8611  }
8612  }
8613 
8614  if(iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8615  {
8616  iWBPaintLast = -1;
8617  }
8618 
8619  if(pEvent)
8620  {
8621  memcpy(pEvent, &(axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt), sizeof(XEvent));
8622  }
8623 
8624  axWBEvt[iRval].iNext = iWBFreeEvent;
8625  iWBFreeEvent = iRval;
8626  }
8627 
8628  return iRval;
8629 }
8630 
8631 
8632 static int __WBNextDisplayEvent(Display *pDisp, XEvent *pEvent)
8633 {
8634  int iRval = iWBQueuedEvent, iPrev = -1;
8635 
8636  while(WB_LIKELY(iRval >= 0))
8637  {
8638  if(WB_LIKELY(axWBEvt[iRval].pDisplay == pDisp))
8639  {
8640  break;
8641  }
8642 
8643  iPrev = iRval;
8644  iRval = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8645  }
8646 
8647  if(WB_LIKELY(iRval >= 0)) // I want the "I have an event" path to be faster
8648  {
8649  if(WB_LIKELY(iRval == iWBQueuedEvent)) // TODO: is this "likely" ?
8650  {
8651  iWBQueuedEvent = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8652 
8653  if(iWBQueuedEvent < 0)
8654  {
8655  iWBQueueLast = -1;
8656  }
8657  }
8658  else
8659  {
8660  if(iRval == iWBQueueLast)
8661  {
8662  iWBQueueLast = iPrev;
8663  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = -1;
8664  }
8665  else if(iPrev >= 0)
8666  {
8667  axWBEvt[iPrev].iNext = axWBEvt[iRval].iNext;
8668  }
8669  }
8670 
8671  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Excessive | DebugSubSystem_Window | DebugSubSystem_Event,
8672  "%s - getting %s event for %d (%08xH)\n",
8673  __FUNCTION__,
8674  WBEventName(axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.type),
8675  (int)axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.xany.window,
8676  (int)axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt.xany.window);
8677 
8678  if(WB_LIKELY(pEvent))
8679  {
8680  memcpy(pEvent, &(axWBEvt[iRval].xEvt), sizeof(XEvent));
8681  }
8682 
8683  axWBEvt[iRval].iNext = iWBFreeEvent;
8684  iWBFreeEvent = iRval;
8685  }
8686 
8687  // TODO: is this really "unlikely" ?
8688  if(WB_UNLIKELY(iRval < 0)) // no event found in normal queue - try paint queue
8689  {
8690  // this function is separated out so I can call it directly - see WBUpdateWindowImmediately()
8691 
8692  iRval = __WBNextPaintEvent(pDisp, pEvent, None);
8693  }
8694 
8695  return iRval >= 0;
8696 }
8697 
8698 static void WBInternalProcessExposeEvent(XExposeEvent *pEvent)
8699 {
8700 int iEvent;
8701 Window wID;
8702 Display *pDisp;
8703 WB_GEOM geom;
8704 
8705 
8706  if(!iInitEventFlag)
8707  {
8708  __WBInitEvent();
8709  }
8710 
8711  // expose events are combined whenever possible
8712  // so that I can choose to respond to them immediately, increment
8713  // the 'count' member to indicate that at least one more event is waiting
8714  // then, make sure I place an event in the 'paint' queue that encompasses
8715  // the entire invalid region. Then I make sure that the 'invalid' region
8716  // of the window contains the rectangular area specified by the Expose
8717  // event so that the final paint message will paint everything properly.
8718 
8719  wID = pEvent->window;
8720  pDisp = pEvent->display;
8721 
8722  // STEP 1: search the 'paint' queue for a matching window ID
8723 
8724  for(iEvent=iWBPaintEvent; iEvent >= 0; iEvent = axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext)
8725  {
8726  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].wID == wID && axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay == pDisp)
8727  {
8728  break;
8729  }
8730  }
8731 
8732  if(iEvent >= 0) // found!
8733  {
8734  // expand the expose event's rectangle to include THIS one
8735 
8736  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.x > pEvent->x)
8737  {
8738  axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.x = pEvent->x;
8739  }
8740 
8741  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.y > pEvent->y)
8742  {
8743  axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.y = pEvent->y;
8744  }
8745 
8746  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.x + axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.width < pEvent->x + pEvent->width)
8747  {
8748  axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.width = pEvent->x + pEvent->width - axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.x;
8749  }
8750 
8751  if(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.y + axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.height < pEvent->y + pEvent->height)
8752  {
8753  axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.height = pEvent->y + pEvent->height - axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.y;
8754  }
8755  }
8756  else
8757  {
8758  // make a copy of the event and put it into the 'paint' queue
8759  // note that if I have no room, I'll simply have to reject it
8760 
8761  if(iWBFreeEvent < 0) // I check here because an existing event might be editable
8762  {
8763  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - no more free 'event queue' entries\n", __FUNCTION__);
8764  return; // can't do anything else, really
8765  }
8766  else
8767  {
8768  iEvent = iWBFreeEvent;
8769  iWBFreeEvent = axWBEvt[iWBFreeEvent].iNext; // remove 'iEvent' from the head of the free chain
8770 
8771  axWBEvt[iEvent].iNext = -1; // the end of the chain on my new "not free any more" event 'iEvent'
8772 
8773  // add to iWBPaintEvent linked list
8774 
8775  if(iWBPaintEvent < 0)
8776  {
8777  iWBPaintEvent = iEvent;
8778  iWBPaintLast = iEvent;
8779  }
8780  else
8781  {
8782  if(iWBPaintLast < 0)
8783  {
8784  // traverse the queue
8785  iWBPaintLast = iWBPaintEvent;
8786  while(axWBEvt[iWBPaintLast].iNext != -1)
8787  {
8788  iWBPaintLast = axWBEvt[iWBPaintLast].iNext;
8789  }
8790  }
8791 
8792  axWBEvt[iWBPaintLast].iNext = iEvent;
8793  iWBPaintLast = iEvent;
8794  }
8795 
8796  axWBEvt[iEvent].pDisplay = pDisp;
8797  axWBEvt[iEvent].wID = wID;
8798  memcpy(&(axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt), pEvent, sizeof(XEvent));
8799 
8800  axWBEvt[iEvent].xEvt.xexpose.count = 0; // always make this a zero
8801  }
8802  }
8803 
8804  // make sure I invalidate the region covered by the expose event
8805 
8806  geom.x = pEvent->x;
8807  geom.y = pEvent->y;
8808  geom.width = pEvent->width;
8809  geom.height = pEvent->height;
8810  geom.border = 0;
8811 
8812 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s - %d,%d,%d,%d\n", __FUNCTION__, geom.x, geom.y, geom.width, geom.height);
8813 
8814  WBInvalidateGeom(wID, &geom, 0);
8815 
8816  pEvent->count++; // increment so it indicates "more to come" before I pass it along
8817 
8818  // make sure window is no longer "unmapped'
8819  // TODO: fix this so it's less of a hack??
8820  {
8821  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8822  if(pEntry && WB_IS_WINDOW_UNMAPPED(*pEntry))
8823  {
8824  if(WB_CHECK_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP(*pEntry))
8825  {
8826  WBSetInputFocus(wID); // hopefully will NOT cause trouble
8827  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_MAPPED;
8828  }
8829  else
8830  {
8831  pEntry->iWindowState = WB_WINDOW_MAPPED;
8832  }
8833  }
8834  }
8835 
8836 }
8837 
8838 // event queue functions
8839 
8840 int WBNextEvent(Display *pDisplay, XEvent *pEvent)
8841 {
8842  return __WBNextDisplayEvent(pDisplay, pEvent);
8843 }
8844 
8845 int WBPostEvent(Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
8846 {
8847  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8848 
8849  if(!pEntry)
8850  return -1;
8851 
8852 // if(pEvent->type == ClientMessage)
8853 // fprintf(stderr, "TEMPORARY: client message in WBPostEvent\n");
8854 
8855  return __WBAddEvent(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, pEvent);
8856 }
8857 
8858 void WBPostDelayedEvent(XEvent *pEvent, unsigned int nDelay)
8859 {
8860  __CreateDelayedEvent(pEvent, nDelay);
8861 }
8862 
8863 int WBPostPriorityEvent(Window wID, XEvent *pEvent)
8864 {
8865  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8866 
8867 // if(pEvent->type == ClientMessage)
8868 // fprintf(stderr, "TEMPORARY: client message in WBPostPriorityEvent\n");
8869 
8870  if(!pEntry)
8871  {
8872 // fprintf(stderr, "TEMPORARY: returning -1 from WBPostPriorityEvent because pEntry is NULL\n");
8873  return -1;
8874  }
8875 
8876  return __WBInsertPriorityEvent(pEntry->pDisplay, wID, pEvent);
8877 }
8878 
8879 int WBPostAppEvent(XEvent *pEvent)
8880 {
8881  Display *pDisp = pDefaultDisplay;
8882 
8883 // pEvent->xany.window = 0; // make sure
8884  if(pEvent->xany.display)
8885  {
8886  pDisp = pEvent->xany.display;
8887  }
8888 
8889  return __WBAddEvent(pDisp, 0, pEvent);
8890 }
8891 
8892 void WBPostDelayedSetFocusAppEvent(Display *pDisplay, Window wID, Window wIDFrom, unsigned int iDelay)
8893 {
8894 XClientMessageEvent evtClient;
8895 
8896  if(!pDisplay)
8897  {
8898  _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
8899 
8900  if(pEntry && pEntry->pDisplay)
8901  {
8902  pDisplay = pEntry->pDisplay;
8903  }
8904  else
8905  {
8906  pDisplay = pDefaultDisplay;
8907  }
8908  }
8909 
8910  memset(&evtClient, 0, sizeof(evtClient));
8911 
8912  evtClient.type = ClientMessage;
8913  evtClient.display = pDisplay;
8914  evtClient.window = None; // sent to application
8915  evtClient.message_type = aSET_FOCUS;
8916  evtClient.format = 32;
8917  evtClient.data.l[0] = wID; // set focus here
8918  evtClient.data.l[1] = wIDFrom; // was focus THERE (but should not be NOW)
8919 
8920  if(iDelay > 0)
8921  {
8922  WBPostDelayedEvent((XEvent *)&evtClient, iDelay);
8923  }
8924  else
8925  {
8926  WBPostAppEvent((XEvent *)&evtClient);
8927  }
8928 }
8929 
8930 
8931 
8932 #define EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(X) { X, #X }
8933 
8934 static struct
8935 {
8936  int iID;
8937  const char *szName;
8938 } aIDName[]=
8939 {
8940  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(KeyPress),
8941  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(KeyRelease),
8942  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ButtonPress),
8943  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ButtonRelease),
8944  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(MotionNotify),
8945  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(EnterNotify),
8946  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(LeaveNotify),
8947  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(FocusIn),
8948  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(FocusOut),
8949  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(KeymapNotify),
8950  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(Expose),
8951  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(GraphicsExpose),
8952  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(NoExpose),
8953  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(VisibilityNotify),
8954  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(CreateNotify),
8955  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(DestroyNotify),
8956  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(UnmapNotify),
8957  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(MapNotify),
8958  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(MapRequest),
8959  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ReparentNotify),
8960  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ConfigureNotify),
8961  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ConfigureRequest),
8962  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(GravityNotify),
8963  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ResizeRequest),
8964  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(CirculateNotify),
8965  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(CirculateRequest),
8966  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(PropertyNotify),
8967  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(SelectionClear),
8968  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(SelectionRequest),
8969  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(SelectionNotify),
8970  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ColormapNotify),
8971  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(ClientMessage),
8972  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(MappingNotify),
8973  EVENT_NAME_ENTRY(LASTEvent),
8974  { 0, NULL }
8975 };
8976 
8977 const char * WBEventName(int iEventID)
8978 {
8979  int i1;
8980  static char aTemp[32];
8981 
8982  for(i1=0; aIDName[i1].iID; i1++)
8983  {
8984  if(aIDName[i1].iID == iEventID)
8985  {
8986  return aIDName[i1].szName;
8987  }
8988  }
8989 
8990  sprintf(aTemp, "[Event %d]", iEventID);
8991  return aTemp;
8992 }
8993

8997
