9127 
9128 static const char * __internal_event_type_string(int iEventType)
9129 {
9130  switch(iEventType)
9131  {
9132  case KeyPress:
9133  return "KeyPress";
9134  case KeyRelease:
9135  return "KeyRelease";
9136  case ButtonPress:
9137  return "ButtonPress";
9138  case ButtonRelease:
9139  return "ButtonRelease";
9140  case MotionNotify:
9141  return "MotionNotify";
9142  case EnterNotify:
9143  return "EnterNotify";
9144  case LeaveNotify:
9145  return "LeaveNotify";
9146  case FocusIn:
9147  return "FocusIn";
9148  case FocusOut:
9149  return "FocusOut";
9150  case KeymapNotify:
9151  return "KeymapNotify";
9152  case Expose:
9153  return "Expose";
9154  case GraphicsExpose:
9155  return "GraphicsExpose";
9156  case NoExpose:
9157  return "NoExpose";
9158  case VisibilityNotify:
9159  return "VisibilityNotify";
9160  case CreateNotify:
9161  return "CreateNotify";
9162  case DestroyNotify:
9163  return "DestroyNotify";
9164  case UnmapNotify:
9165  return "UnmapNotify";
9166  case MapNotify:
9167  return "MapNotify";
9168  case MapRequest:
9169  return "MapRequest";
9170  case ReparentNotify:
9171  return "ReparentNotify";
9172  case ConfigureNotify:
9173  return "ConfigureNotify";
9174  case ConfigureRequest:
9175  return "ConfigureRequest";
9176  case GravityNotify:
9177  return "GravityNotify";
9178  case ResizeRequest:
9179  return "ResizeRequest";
9180  case CirculateNotify:
9181  return "CirculateNotify";
9182  case CirculateRequest:
9183  return "CirculateRequest";
9184  case PropertyNotify:
9185  return "PropertyNotify";
9186  case SelectionClear:
9187  return "SelectionClear";
9188  case SelectionRequest:
9189  return "SelectionRequest";
9190  case SelectionNotify:
9191  return "SelectionNotify";
9192  case ColormapNotify:
9193  return "ColormapNotify";
9194  case ClientMessage:
9195  return "ClientMessage";
9196  case MappingNotify:
9197  return "MappingNotify";
9198 #ifdef GenericEvent /* this wasn't present in earlier versions of X11 */
9199  case GenericEvent:
9200  return "GenericEvent";
9201 #endif // GenericEvent
9202  }
9203  return "*Unknown Event";
9204 }
9205 
9206 
9207 void WBDebugDumpGC(Display *pDisplay, WBGC hGC)
9208 {
9209 XGCValues xgcv;
9210 
9211  if(!hGC)
9212  {
9213  WBDebugPrint("GC DUMP - NULL hGC\n");
9214  return;
9215  }
9216 
9217  bzero(&xgcv, sizeof(xgcv));
9218  memcpy(&xgcv, &(hGC->values), sizeof(xgcv));
9219 
9220  WBGetGCValues(hGC,
9221  GCFunction | GCPlaneMask | GCForeground | GCBackground | GCLineWidth | GCLineStyle | GCCapStyle
9222  | GCJoinStyle | GCFillStyle | GCFillRule | GCTile | GCStipple | GCTileStipXOrigin | GCTileStipYOrigin
9223  | GCFont | GCSubwindowMode | GCGraphicsExposures | GCClipXOrigin | GCClipYOrigin /*| GCClipMask*/
9224  | GCDashOffset /*| GCDashList*/ | GCArcMode,
9225  &xgcv);
9226 
9227  WBDebugPrint("WBGC DUMP - GC = %ld (%08lxH)\n", (long)(hGC->gc), (long)(hGC->gc));
9228  WBDebugPrint("function = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.function, xgcv.function);
9229  WBDebugPrint("plane_mask = %ld (%016lxH)\n", xgcv.plane_mask, xgcv.plane_mask);
9230  WBDebugPrint("foreground = %ld (%016lxH)\n", xgcv.foreground, xgcv.foreground);
9231  WBDebugPrint("background = %ld (%016lxH)\n", xgcv.background, xgcv.background);
9232  WBDebugPrint("line_width = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.line_width, xgcv.line_width);
9233  WBDebugPrint("line_style = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.line_style, xgcv.line_style);
9234  WBDebugPrint("cap_style = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.cap_style, xgcv.cap_style);
9235  WBDebugPrint("join_style = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.join_style, xgcv.join_style);
9236  WBDebugPrint("fill_style = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.fill_style, xgcv.fill_style);
9237  WBDebugPrint("fill_rule = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.fill_rule, xgcv.fill_rule);
9238  WBDebugPrint("arc_mode = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.arc_mode, xgcv.arc_mode);
9239  WBDebugPrint("tile = %d (%08xH)\n", (int)xgcv.tile, (int)xgcv.tile);
9240  WBDebugPrint("stipple = %d (%08xH)\n", (int)xgcv.stipple, (int)xgcv.stipple);
9241  WBDebugPrint("ts_x_origin = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.ts_x_origin, xgcv.ts_x_origin);
9242  WBDebugPrint("ts_y_origin = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.ts_y_origin, xgcv.ts_y_origin);
9243  WBDebugPrint("font = %d (%08xH)\n", (int)xgcv.font, (int)xgcv.font);
9244  WBDebugPrint("subwindow_mode = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.subwindow_mode, xgcv.subwindow_mode);
9245  WBDebugPrint("graphics_exposures = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.graphics_exposures, xgcv.graphics_exposures);
9246  WBDebugPrint("clip_x_origin = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.clip_x_origin, xgcv.clip_x_origin);
9247  WBDebugPrint("clip_y_origin = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.clip_y_origin, xgcv.clip_y_origin);
9248 // WBDebugPrint("clip_mask = %d (%08xH)\n", (int)xgcv.clip_mask, (int)xgcv.clip_mask);
9249  WBDebugPrint("dash_offset = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.dash_offset, xgcv.dash_offset);
9250 // WBDebugPrint("dashes = %d (%08xH)\n", xgcv.dashes, xgcv.dashes);
9251 }
9252 
9253 
9254 void WBDebugDumpEvent(XEvent *pEvent)
9255 {
9256 char *p1;
9257 
9258  WBDebugPrint("EVENT %s\n", __internal_event_type_string(pEvent->xany.type));
9259  WBDebugPrint(" serial: %ld\n", pEvent->xany.serial);
9260  WBDebugPrint(" send_event: %c\n", pEvent->xany.send_event ? 'T' : 'F');
9261  WBDebugPrint(" display: %p\n", pEvent->xany.display);
9262  WBDebugPrint(" Window: %08xH\n", (unsigned int)pEvent->xany.window);
9263 
9264  switch(pEvent->xany.type)
9265  {
9266  case ClientMessage: /* these require WBGetAtomName since the atoms may not be 'global' */
9267  p1 = WBGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xclient.message_type);
9268  WBDebugPrint(" message_type: %s\n", p1);
9269  WBFree(p1);
9270 
9271  WBDebugPrint(" format: %d\n", pEvent->xclient.format);
9272  WBDebugPrint(" data[0].l: %ld (%08lxH)\n", pEvent->xclient.data.l[0], pEvent->xclient.data.l[0]);
9273  WBDebugPrint(" data[1].l: %ld (%08lxH)\n", pEvent->xclient.data.l[1], pEvent->xclient.data.l[1]);
9274  WBDebugPrint(" data[2].l: %ld (%08lxH)\n", pEvent->xclient.data.l[2], pEvent->xclient.data.l[2]);
9275  WBDebugPrint(" data[3].l: %ld (%08lxH)\n", pEvent->xclient.data.l[3], pEvent->xclient.data.l[3]);
9276  WBDebugPrint(" data[4].l: %ld (%08lxH)\n", pEvent->xclient.data.l[4], pEvent->xclient.data.l[4]);
9277 
9278  WBDebugDump("** client event data dump **", &(pEvent->xclient.data), sizeof(pEvent->xclient.data));
9279  break;
9280 
9281 
9282  case SelectionNotify: /* note THESE always use 'XGetAtomName' */
9283  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselection.selection);
9284  WBDebugPrint(" selection: %s\n", p1);
9285  XFree(p1);
9286 
9287  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselection.target);
9288  WBDebugPrint(" target: %s\n", p1);
9289  XFree(p1);
9290 
9291  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselection.property);
9292  WBDebugPrint(" property: %s\n", p1);
9293  XFree(p1);
9294 
9295  WBDebugPrint(" time: %ld\n", (unsigned long)pEvent->xselection.time);
9296  break;
9297 
9298 
9299  case SelectionRequest: /* note THESE always use 'XGetAtomName' */
9300  WBDebugPrint(" Requestor: %08xH\n", (unsigned int)pEvent->xselectionrequest.requestor);
9301 
9302  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselectionrequest.selection);
9303  WBDebugPrint(" selection: %s\n", p1);
9304  XFree(p1);
9305 
9306  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselectionrequest.target);
9307  WBDebugPrint(" target: %s\n", p1);
9308  XFree(p1);
9309 
9310  p1 = XGetAtomName(pEvent->xany.display, pEvent->xselectionrequest.property);
9311  WBDebugPrint(" property: %s\n", p1);
9312  XFree(p1);
9313 
9314  WBDebugPrint(" time: %ld\n", (unsigned long)pEvent->xselectionrequest.time);
9315  break;
9316 
9317 // default:
9318  // nothing else
9319  }
9320 }
9321 
9322 
9323 void WBDebugDumpRegion(Region hRgn, int bRotate)
9324 {
9325 XRectangle xrct;
9326 int iW, iH;
9327 
9328  XClipBox(hRgn, &xrct);
9329 
9330  WBDebugPrint("REGION %u (%08xH): clip rect: %d, %d, %d, %d bRotate=%d\n",
9331  (unsigned int)(WB_UINTPTR)hRgn,
9332  (unsigned int)(WB_UINTPTR)hRgn,
9333  xrct.x, xrct.y, xrct.width + xrct.x, xrct.height + xrct.y,
9334  bRotate);
9335 
9336  if(xrct.width == 0 || xrct.height == 0)
9337  {
9338  WBDebugPrint(" (Region is empty)\n");
9339  return;
9340  }
9341 
9342  if(bRotate)
9343  {
9344  iW = xrct.x;
9345  xrct.x = xrct.y;
9346  xrct.y = iW;
9347 
9348  iW = xrct.width;
9349  xrct.width = xrct.height;
9350  xrct.height = iW;
9351  }
9352 
9353  WBDebugPrint(" ");
9354  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9355  {
9356  WBDebugPrint("%d", (iW / 100) % 10);
9357  }
9358 
9359  WBDebugPrint("\n ");
9360 
9361  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9362  {
9363  WBDebugPrint("%d", (iW / 10) % 10);
9364  }
9365 
9366  WBDebugPrint("\n ");
9367 
9368  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9369  {
9370  WBDebugPrint("%d", iW % 10);
9371  }
9372 
9373  WBDebugPrint("\n ");
9374 
9375  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9376  {
9377  WBDebugPrint("-");
9378  }
9379 
9380  WBDebugPrint("+\n");
9381 
9382 
9383  for(iH=xrct.y; iH < xrct.y + xrct.height; iH++)
9384  {
9385  WBDebugPrint("%5d|", iH);
9386  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9387  {
9388  if((!bRotate && XPointInRegion(hRgn, iW, iH)) ||
9389  (bRotate && XPointInRegion(hRgn, iH, iW)))
9390  {
9391  WBDebugPrint(".");
9392  }
9393  else
9394  {
9395  WBDebugPrint(" ");
9396  }
9397  }
9398  WBDebugPrint("|\r\n");
9399  }
9400 
9401  WBDebugPrint(" ");
9402 
9403  for(iW=xrct.x; iW < xrct.x + xrct.width; iW++)
9404  {
9405  WBDebugPrint("=");
9406  }
9407 
9408  WBDebugPrint("+\n");
9409 
9410 }
9411 
9412 
9413 // ****************************************************
9414 //
9415 // E R R O R H A N D L I N G
9416 //
9417 // ****************************************************
9418 
9419 static int WBXErrorHandler(Display *pDisplay, XErrorEvent *pError)
9420 {
9421 char tbuf[512];
9422 int i1;
9423 _WINDOW_ENTRY_ *pEntry;
9424 
9425 
9426  // if the error results from an expected condition, just set the
9427  // appropriate error information in the exception buffer and return
9428  // For now this will be a manual check after a function call but
9429  // later I may enable structured exception handling or a signal
9430  // 'SIGUSR1' might work for this...
9431 
9432  // cacheing the latest error information
9433  xErrorInfo.pDisplay = pDisplay;
9434  xErrorInfo.serial = pError->serial;
9435  xErrorInfo.pFunc = sz_xcall_func;
9436  xErrorInfo.iLine = i_xcall_line;
9437  xErrorInfo.error_code = pError->error_code;
9438  xErrorInfo.request_code = pError->request_code;
9439  xErrorInfo.minor_code = pError->minor_code;
9440  xErrorInfo.resourceid = pError->resourceid;
9441 
9442  if(bIgnoreXErrors)
9443  {
9444  return 1;
9445  }
9446 
9447 
9448  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s","************************************************************************\n");
9449 
9450  // NOTE: pError->type is always zero - replies are always 1 - these are reserved values, see X11/X.h
9451 
9452  WB_ERROR_PRINT("window_helper.c:%d %s\n display %pH serial %08lxH\n",
9453  __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, pDisplay, pError->serial);
9454  if(sz_xcall_func)
9455  {
9456  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" called from %s line %d\n", sz_xcall_func, i_xcall_line);
9457  }
9458 // else
9459 // {
9460 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("called from unknown function\n");
9461 // }
9462 
9463  XGetErrorText(pDisplay, pError->error_code, tbuf, sizeof(tbuf));
9464  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Error Code: %d %s\n", pError->error_code, tbuf);
9465 
9466  for(i1=0; aXProto[i1].szProto; i1++)
9467  {
9468  if(aXProto[i1].iProto == pError->request_code)
9469  {
9470  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Request Code: %s\n", aXProto[i1].szProto);
9471  break;
9472  }
9473  }
9474 
9475  if(!aXProto[i1].szProto)
9476  {
9477  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Request Code: UNKNOWN (%d, %08xH)\n", pError->request_code, pError->request_code);
9478  }
9479 
9480  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Minor Request Code: %d (%08xH)\n", pError->minor_code, pError->minor_code);
9481 
9482  if(pError->error_code == BadWindow ||
9483  ((pError->error_code == BadMatch || pError->error_code == BadDrawable) &&
9484  (pError->request_code == X_SetInputFocus ||
9485  pError->request_code == X_GetGeometry)))
9486  {
9487  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry((Window)pError->resourceid);
9488 
9489  if(pEntry)
9490  {
9491 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
9492 
9493  const char *pState;
9494 
9495  switch(pEntry->iWindowState)
9496  {
9497  case WB_WINDOW_DELETE:
9498  pState = "WB_WINDOW_DELETE";
9499  break;
9500  case WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED:
9501  pState = "WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED";
9502  break;
9503  case WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED:
9504  pState = "WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED";
9505  break;
9506  case WB_WINDOW_MAPPED:
9507  pState = "WB_WINDOW_MAPPED";
9508  break;
9509  case WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP:
9510  pState = "WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP";
9511  break;
9512  default:
9513  pState = "UNKNOWN STATE";
9514  }
9515 
9516  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" X Resource ID: %d (%08xH) state=%d %s\n",
9517  (int)pError->resourceid, (int)pError->resourceid,
9518  pEntry->iWindowState, pState);
9519 
9520  if(pEntry->szClassName)
9521  {
9522  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Window 'class name': %s\n", pEntry->szClassName);
9523  }
9524 
9525 #endif // NO_DEBUG
9526 
9527  while(pEntry && pEntry->wParent != None)
9528  {
9529  Window wID = pEntry->wParent;
9530  pEntry = WBGetWindowEntry(wID);
9531 
9532  if(!pEntry)
9533  {
9534  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Parent window: %d (%08xH) (no entry)\n",
9535  (int)wID, (int)wID);
9536  }
9537  else
9538  {
9539 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
9540 
9541  switch(pEntry->iWindowState)
9542  {
9543  case WB_WINDOW_DELETE:
9544  pState = "WB_WINDOW_DELETE";
9545  break;
9546  case WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED:
9547  pState = "WB_WINDOW_DESTROYED";
9548  break;
9549  case WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED:
9550  pState = "WB_WINDOW_UNMAPPED";
9551  break;
9552  case WB_WINDOW_MAPPED:
9553  pState = "WB_WINDOW_MAPPED";
9554  break;
9555  case WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP:
9556  pState = "WB_WINDOW_SET_FOCUS_ON_MAP";
9557  break;
9558  default:
9559  pState = "UNKNOWN STATE";
9560  }
9561 
9562  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Parent window: %d (%08xH) state=%d %s\n",
9563  (int)wID, (int)wID,
9564  pEntry->iWindowState, pState);
9565 
9566  if(pEntry->szClassName)
9567  {
9568  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" Parent Window 'class name': %s\n", pEntry->szClassName);
9569  }
9570 
9571 #endif // NO_DEBUG
9572  }
9573  }
9574  }
9575  else
9576  {
9577  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" X Resource ID: %d (%08xH) (no window entry)\n", (int)pError->resourceid, (int)pError->resourceid);
9578  }
9579  }
9580  else
9581  {
9582  WB_ERROR_PRINT(" X Resource ID: %d (%08xH)\n", (int)pError->resourceid, (int)pError->resourceid);
9583  }
9584 
9585  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s","************************************************************************\n");
9586  return 1;
9587 }
9588 
9589 
9590 void WBErrorClear(void)
9591 {
9592  memset(&xErrorInfo, 0, sizeof(xErrorInfo));
9593 }
9594 
9595 int WBErrorCheck(void)
9596 {
9597  return xErrorInfo.pDisplay != NULL;
9598 }
9599 
9600 int WBErrorCheckRetry(void)
9601 {
9602  if(!xErrorInfo.pDisplay)
9603  {
9604  return 0;
9605  }
9606 
9607  // check for possibility of retry
9608 
9609  return xErrorInfo.error_code == BadAlloc; // for now this is the only retryable one
9610 }
9611 
9612 const WB_ERROR_INFO * WBGetLastError(void)
9613 {
9614  return &xErrorInfo;
9615 }
9616 
9617 
9618 
9619 // certain C compilers might not handle inlines well. So I define function bodies for them here
9620 
9621 #if !defined(__DOXYGEN__) && !defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(_MSVC_VER)
9622 
9623 Display * WBGetDefaultDisplay(void)
9624 {
9625  return pDefaultDisplay;
9626 }
9627 
9628 void WBInvalidateRect(Window wID, const WB_RECT *pRCT, int bPaintFlag)
9629 {
9630  WB_GEOM geom;
9631 
9632  if(!pRCT)
9633  {
9634  WBInvalidateGeom(wID, NULL, bPaintFlag);
9635  return;
9636  }
9637 
9638  geom.x = pRCT->left;
9639  geom.y = pRCT->top;
9640  geom.width = pRCT->right - pRCT->left;
9641  geom.height = pRCT->bottom - pRCT->top;
9642  geom.border = 0;
9643 
9644  WBInvalidateGeom(wID, &geom, bPaintFlag);
9645 }
9646 
9647 void WBValidateRect(Window wID, WB_RECT *pRCT)
9648 {
9649  WB_GEOM geom;
9650 
9651  if(!pRCT)
9652  {
9653  WBValidateGeom(wID, NULL);
9654  return;
9655  }
9656 
9657  geom.x = pRCT->left;
9658  geom.y = pRCT->top;
9659  geom.width = pRCT->right - pRCT->left;
9660  geom.height = pRCT->bottom - pRCT->top;
9661  geom.border = 0;
9662 
9663  WBValidateGeom(wID, &geom);
9664 }
9665 
9666 void WBSupressErrorOutput(void)
9667 {
9668 extern int bIgnoreXErrors;
9669 
9670  // TODO: serialize this with a mutex or other sync object?
9671  bIgnoreXErrors++;
9672 }
9673 
9674 void WBAllowErrorOutput(void)
9675 {
9676 extern int bIgnoreXErrors;
9677 
9678  // TODO: serialize this with a mutex or other sync object?
9679  if(bIgnoreXErrors > 0)
9680  {
9681  bIgnoreXErrors--;
9682  }
9683  else
9684  {
9685  bIgnoreXErrors = 0;
9686  }
9687 }
9688 
9689 #endif // !defined(__DOXYGEN__) && !defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(_MSVC_VER)
